faqs.question: When is Terminal V 2023?
faqs.answer: Terminal V returns to The Royal Highland Centre on Saturday 8th - Sunday 9th April 2023

faqs.question: How much are Terminal V tickets?
faqs.answer: Head to the tickets section to find out the latest ticket prices.

faqs.question: How do I get to Terminal V?
faqs.answer: By Air - With regular flights connecting Edinburgh Airport to the UK and Europe there are plenty options available. The festival site is a short 10 minute walk from the airport. By Car - Public transport is recommended as parking is not available on site. By Taxi - There are several local taxi firms to choose from and a taxi drop off point easily accessible by following the signs for the North Car Park.By Bus - Organised travel is available from Happy Bus and Big Green Coach from several locations direct to The Royal Highland Centre. 24 hour bus services are available with travel across Edinburgh and Glasgow.By Rail - The closest railway station is The Edinburgh Gateway Station with a 40 minute walk to the festival site. The next closest railway station is Haymarket. Terminal V is held at The Royal Highland centre, located on the west side of city, near the grounds of Edinburgh Airport.Terminal V is easily accessible by coach, shuttle buses and taxis.Return buses from Edinburgh to Glasgow will be running 24 hours.The Edinburgh Gateway Station is a 40mins walk from the site for access to trains all over Scotland. Haymarket is the next nearest train station with excellent train links across the UK. For more information contact National Rail on 08457 48 49 50.The Royal Highland Centre is situated adjacent to Edinburgh Airport. Over 180 flights connect Edinburgh to the rest of the UK and Europe each day and the Royal Highland Centre is just a ten-minute walk from the airport.There is no parking available for cars, apart from TAXIS, so please do not consider driving to this eventPlease follow the signs for the North Car Park. This is also the drop off and taxi pickup point.Please plan ahead and organise travel plans in advance for leaving arrangements before you arrive at Terminal V.

faqs.question: Where is Terminal V?
faqs.answer: Terminal V is located at The Royal Highland Centre which is close to Edinburgh Airport. The festival site can be accessed easily by taxi, rail and shuttle bus.

faqs.question: Are pre-payment plan tickets available?
faqs.answer: Payment plan tickets are currently not on sale.

faqs.question: Does Terminal V have onsite camping?
faqs.answer: No, Terminal V is a non camping festival so camping equipment is not needed. It is however close to a large choice of accommodation within 1 mile from the festival site.

faqs.question: What happens If I bought a ticket and cannot attend?
faqs.answer:
Unfortunately we can’t issue you with a refund if you can’t make the event due to work commitments or your mates have dropped out. In these circumstances, we advise passing on your tickets privately to avoid losing out on the money spent.

Refunds can only be offered if the event is cancelled or postponed, as agreed upon purchase.

faqs.question: Does Terminal V have any age restrictions?

faqs.answer: You are not allowed to bring your own food and drink into Terminal V. There will be a wide variety of food and drink stalls inside the festival, serving up organic, vegetarian and vegan options.

faqs.question: What happens if I bought a ticket and cannot attend?
faqs.answer: Unfortunately we can’t issue you with a refund if you can’t make the event due to work commitments or your mates have dropped out. In these circumstances, we advise passing on your tickets privately to avoid losing out on the money spent. Refunds can only be offered if the event is cancelled or postponed, as agreed upon purchase.

faqs.question: Accessibility information
faqs.answer: The Festival is on a flat field, with disabled toilets. There are hard standing path ways around the park for accessibility. Please notify Lost Minds before hand if you are on crutches or wheelchair so they can greet you at the gate and assist with queues at tickets@dancegenevents.co.uk. Please be aware, the location is a greenspace park and as such there are certain areas of the festival that are only accessible by entering grass sections of the park, such as the Main Arena, Megadome etc. Please make your carer aware beforehand so you are prepared for every eventuality.

faqs.question: How do I get to Lost Minds?
faqs.answer: Public transport is encouraged as Lost Minds is located in central Newcastle. There are no official customer car parks but there is plenty of on road street parking with pay meters and 24-hour secure car parks nearby.

faqs.question: Where is Lost Minds?
faqs.answer: Lost Minds is located at Leazes Park, Newcastle.

faqs.question: What is included in a VIP ticket?
faqs.answer: Extra perks such as VIP entry and area.

faqs.question: How do we enter Lost Minds?
faqs.answer: Lost Minds entry is accessed from Richardson Road. The entrance from Barrack Road will be closed off.

faqs.question: What are the opening times for Lost Minds?
faqs.answer: Lost Minds opens 13:00 - 23:00Last entry is 19:00

faqs.question: Can I upgrade my Standard Ticket to VIP?
faqs.answer: Yes, but there will only be limited upgrades. Head to the Box Office on the day...this will cost you £20 per upgrade.

faqs.question: I'm coming by Coach, where will I be dropped off?
faqs.answer: All Coaches should head to coach drop off / pick up point which is located at " Claremont Road Car Park / NE2 4AA", a 5 Minutes walk to the festival site.

faqs.question: Does Lost Minds have any age restrictions?
faqs.answer: Yes you must be 18 or over to attend Lost Minds. You may be asked to show photo ID as there is a Challenge 21 policy upon entry and at all bars on site.

faqs.question: Do I need to print my tickets out?
faqs.answer: Yes you can, or you can save the PDF to your phone, or use the Skiddle App to download to your wallet.

faqs.question: Can I bring food & drink into the Lost Minds?
faqs.answer: You are not allowed to bring your own food and drink into Lost Minds, but they do have fully stocked bars and food stalls.

faqs.question: What is prohibited from Lost Minds?
faqs.answer: You cannot enter Lost Minds with the following:- Pets / Animals- Aerosols (Inc: Deodorant, Air Horns)- Alcohol/Food- Cameras (DSLR etc, Compact Cameras are fine!)- Children Under 18 (Leave these with Nan)- Illegal Drugs (Inc: Powders, Legal Highs, Poppers, Nitrous Oxide)- Glass- Chairs- Umbrellas- Selfie Sticks- Flag Poles (Flags Okay!)- Masks / Face Garments (PPE is okay)- Explosives (Inc: Blowtorches, Fireworks, Flares / Smoke Bombs, Lantens)- Firearms, Weapons, Sharp Objects All persons must be searched on entry.

faqs.question: Are there any lockers at Lost Minds?
faqs.answer: No, but you may bring a bag (this will be searched on entry).

faqs.question: Can I leave the Lost Minds event site and then come back (i.e. are there pass-outs)?
faqs.answer: There are no pass outs at Lost Minds.

faqs.question: Can I use cash or card at Lost Minds?
faqs.answer: All bars at Lost Minds operate a Token System; you will need to purchase these via the Token Office (Payment via Cash/Card, they offer Cash Back). Food/Stalls/Fair is Cash.

faqs.question: Is there a dress code at Lost Minds?
faqs.answer: Lost Minds is a festival - go wild!

title: The Great Escape Festival
title_location: Brighton Dome And Various Venues in Brighton

faqs.question: When is The Great Escape Festival 2023?
faqs.answer: The Great Escape Festival takes place Wednesday 10th May - Saturday 13th May 2023.

faqs.question: Is there on-site camping available at The Great Escape Festival?
faqs.answer: No, The Great Escape is a non-camping festival based in Brighton city centre. If you are attending for the full 3 days, we recommend you book and stay in one of Brighton's many hotels.

faqs.question: Accessibility information
faqs.answer: For full accessibility information, please contact info@greatescapefestival.com.

faqs.question: Where is The Great Escape Festival?
faqs.answer: The Great Escape Festival takes place in Brighton at over 30+ walkable venues across the city and a pop-up festival site on Brighton Beach.

faqs.question: Does The Great Escape Festival have any age restrictions?
faqs.answer: Yes, you must be 18+ to attend The Great Escape Festival, and you may require valid photo ID.

faqs.question: Does Highest Point have onsite camping?
faqs.answer: No, Highest Point is a non-camping festival so camping equipment is not needed. However, there is plenty of alternative accommodation to choose from in Lancaster.

faqs.question: How can I apply for a Personal Assistant/Disabled Parking Ticket?
faqs.answer: Please purchase the tickets you require for Highest Point Festival via Skiddle, not including the Personal Assistant ticket.We then ask you to supply us with one of the following documents dated within the past 12 months or with valid date covering the event:-The front page of the DLA letter with the PIP letter-The front page of Attendance Allowance letter-Evidence of being registered as severely sight impaired (blind)-Recognised Assistance Dog ID card-Valid Access Card showing you require a +1 to accompany you For a disabled parking space we will need an image of your Blue Badge. Please be aware there is a limited number of disabled spaces available and these will be allocated on a first come first service basis. If you could email the supporting document and your Skiddle order ID number to info@highestpoint.co.uk we can add a Personal Assistant ticket to your order.

faqs.question: When is Highest Point 2023?
faqs.answer: Highest Point returns to Williamson Park from Thursday 11th to Sunday 14th May 2023.

faqs.question: How much are Highest Point tickets?
faqs.answer: Adult tickets for 3 days at the festival start at just £145 + booking fee.Adult tickets for 2 days at the festival start at just £135 + booking fee.Adult day tickets for Friday or Saturday start at just £69.50 + booking fee, with Thursday Adult day tickets starting from just £39.50 + booking fee. 13-17 Kids tickets for 3 days at the festival start at just £80 + booking fee.13-17 Kids tickets for 2 days at the festival start at just £70 + booking fee.13-17 Kids day tickets for Friday or Saturday start at just £35 + booking fee, with Thursday 13-17 Kids day tickets starting from just £20 + booking fee. 0-12 Kids tickets are free.

faqs.question: How do I get to Highest Point?
faqs.answer: By Car - You can reach Williamson Park via Junction 34 of the M6. There will be designated parking close to the festival site at North West Auctions. As the festival is in a residential area, road closures will be in place.By Rail - Lancaster is the closest rail station and is approximately a 10 minute taxi ride or 30 minute walk. By Taxi - Yes, there is a taxi rank at Lancaster station. We  encourage you to share  taxis with fellow festival goers where possible.By Foot - The festival is a 10 minute walk from Dalton Square.

faqs.question: I have requested disabled parking, where is the car park?
faqs.answer: The disabled car park is situated on the University of Cumbria campus. Please use the postcode LA1 3JD. This car park is opposite the site entrance. Please turn either left or right off Bowerham Rd into the University campus, you will be met by a steward who will request your name & provide you with a disabled car park pass.  How to get from car park to Highest Point Entrance: From the car park, please follow a path where you will pass a football pitch on your right then the University of Cumbria Sports complex on your left. Next, cross Wyresdale Rd which is closed for the duration of the festival. Finally, you will reach Highest Point Festival main entrance where you will have your ticket(s) scanned and you will receive your wristbands.

faqs.question: Where is Highest Point?
faqs.answer: Highest Point is located in Williamson Park, Lancaster. It takes about 5 minutes to get there from the town centre by bus, or car. The entrance to Highest Point Festival is located on Wyresdale Road. The postcode is LA1 3EA.

faqs.question: Are pre-payment plan tickets available for Highest Point?
faqs.answer: Yes, payment plans are available for Highest Point Festival:Three Day Adult Ticket: £15* deposit plus 4x payments of £35*Two Day Adult Ticket: £15* deposit plus 4x payments of £32.50*Friday OR Saturday Adult Ticket: £5* deposit plus 4x payments of £18.75* * + booking fee

faqs.question: Where can I park at Highest Point?
faqs.answer:
North West AuctionsExit the M6 at junction 34 and head towards Lancaster city centre. Please follow Highest Point diversion signs directing you to the event car park.

Disabled access Car Park - How to find the car park:University of Cumbria, Lancaster CampusAccess via Bowerham Rd, Lancaster, LA1 3JD Please follow your sat nav as the Highest Point diversion signs will route you to an alternate car park.

faqs.question: Where are the disabled toilets?
faqs.answer: These will be located all across the park. You will be able to locate them on the map in the Highest Point Festival guide which will be provided at the festival entrance. Furthermore, Highest Point has an app that contains a full festival map with key facilities highlighted.

faqs.question: Does Highest Point have any age restrictions?
faqs.answer: Highest Point is a family festival and therefore there aren't any age restrictions. Children are able to attend the full duration of the festival and do not have to leave the event at a certain time in the evening. Please note, anyone aged 17 years old and under will need to be accompanied by an adult aged 21+ at all times throughout the event. You may be asked to show a photo ID upon entry.

faqs.question: How do I access my tickets?
faqs.answer: Your RapidScan tickets will be available via your Skiddle account or confirmation email. Head to www.skiddle.com/orders or the 'my tickets' section within the app, for quick easy access.

faqs.question: Can I access the disabled viewing platform?
faqs.answer: If you require access to the viewing platform, please email through to info@highestpoint.co.uk with your requirement.  Please note, there is limited availability on the viewing platform so a space is not guaranteed.

faqs.question: Can I leave and re-enter Highest Point?
faqs.answer: Yes, but you must be back before the advertised last entry time. Please note, you may be subject to another search upon re-entering the festival.

faqs.question: What happens if I bought a ticket and cannot attend?
faqs.answer: Unfortunately we can’t issue you with a refund if you can’t make the event due to work commitments or your mates have dropped out. In these circumstances, we advise passing on your tickets privately to avoid losing out on the money spent.Refunds can only be offered if the event is cancelled or postponed, as agreed upon purchase.

faqs.question: Does my child need to have a ticket for Highest Point?
faqs.answer: All Highest Point festival goers must have a ticket for entry, no matter the age.

faqs.question: What are the stage times at Highest Point?
faqs.answer: Stage times will be published on our social media channels nearer to the event and will be displayed at the festival.

faqs.question: Can I pass on my tickets privately?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can pass them on to family, friends or work colleagues so that they can use the tickets at the event instead. Please see the article below on how you can change the name on the order. https://bit.ly/3eQen75

faqs.question: Can I park at Highest Point?
faqs.answer:
Yes, parking is available. How to find the car park:

North West Auction

Exit the M6 at junction 34 and head towards Lancaster city centre. Please follow Highest Point diversion signs directing you to the event car park.

Disabled Car Park - How to find the car park:

University of Cumbria, Lancaster Campus

Access via Bowerham Rd, Lancaster, LA1 3JD 

Please follow your sat nav as the Highest Point diversion signs will route you to an alternate car park.

faqs.question: I have a multiple-day ticket but now cannot attend one of the days, can I give a day ticket to someone else?
faqs.answer: No, when you arrive at the festival you will be given a wristband permitting entry for the rest of the event. As a result, we cannot split multiple-day tickets.

faqs.question: Can I bring my own food and drink into Highest Point?
faqs.answer: You are not allowed to bring your own food and drink into Highest Point. There will be a wide variety of food and drink stalls inside the festival, serving up organic, vegetarian and vegan options.  If you have special dietary requirements please email info@highestpoint.co.uk and we can help accommodate this.

faqs.question: Can I bring my dog to Highest Point?
faqs.answer: No dogs are allowed on site for the festival, with the exception of guide dogs / assistance dogs.

faqs.question: Can I bring my camping chairs?
faqs.answer: Due to security restrictions you are unable to bring camping chairs into the festival. You are welcome to bring a picnic blanket along with you as there is plenty of space available.

faqs.question: What are the ground conditions like at Highest Point?
faqs.answer: Highest Point takes place at Williamson Park in Lancaster, home to the iconic Ashton Memorial and is set in 54 acres of parkland with woodland walks & play areas. The event will be held within the parkland and you’ll find that some areas within the site will be uneven. There are plenty of tarmac pathways within the park, with the stages easily accessible. Please prepare for all scenarios; consider the ground conditions and the unpredictable English weather!

faqs.question: When is Cultivate Festival 2023: Summer Edition?

faqs.question: What happens if I bought a ticket and cannot attend?
faqs.answer: Unfortunately we can’t issue you with a refund if you can’t make the event due to work commitments or your mates have dropped out. In these circumstances, we advise passing on your tickets privately to avoid losing out on the money spent. Refunds can only be offered if the event is cancelled or postponed, as agreed upon purchase.

faqs.answer: Once you’ve entered the festival you will receive a wrist band, please do not take this off as it will allow you to re-enter the arena. The same search and ID check policy will be in force upon re-entry.

faqs.answer: Final entry is 6PM, we recommend arriving well before this or expect to queue. The festival opens at 2PM.

 Use Your Common Sense

faqs.question: What's included in a Lets Rock The Moor VIP ticket?
faqs.answer: 2023 will see the ever popular and totally cool, funky 80s themed CLUB TROPICANA VIP enclosure. As well as entry to the event, VIP tickets include fast track entry, luxury loos, meal and welcome drink, PLUS exclusive DJ sets. Sit back and relax in this exclusive area with comfy seating and chairs and a full bar serving quality brands and 80’s cocktails, plus of course the all-important VIP luxury loos – essential at any festival! Fancy dress is recommended, but not compulsory! For any group or company bookings (10 or more) please email uklcs@uk-live.co.uk

faqs.question: How do I apply for a personal assistant ticket?
faqs.answer: Disabled ticket holders are offered, subject to availability, a free ticket for a personal assistant. This offer is open to those who hold a current higher rate of DLA or other UK government approved supporting evidence of their requirement for a personal assistant. Carer tickets can only be issued against general entry tickets. IMPORTANT: This offer is only available to those people that would be unable to attend the festival without a full time assistant. Every application is looked at on an individual basis and if anyone is found to be making a fraudulent application, the festival reserve the right to cancel both the original ticket and personal assistant ticket, before and during the event. To apply for a personal assistant ticket, please follow the procedure below:– Buy a standard general admission ticket (must be online)– Email proof of purchase (the email from Gigantic) AND a copy of your letter of award for DLA (or equivalent) Please send your email to uklcs@uk-live.co.uk . Please ensure that any attachments do not exceed a file size of 1MB, and that you include your full postal address in your email. PERSONAL ASSISTANT TICKETS WILL BE EMAILED ONE WEEK BEFORE THE EVENT

faqs.question: Disabled Access Information?
faqs.answer: DEAF AND DISABLED GUESTS We aim to be accessible to all. faqs.question: Can I hire a yurt at Knockengorroch Festival?
faqs.answer: There is the option of hiring a yurt and staying in that if tents aren’t your thing or you fancy something special. The yurts are handcrafted by Red Kite Yurts. Tel 01877 330943, email paul@redkiteyurts.comMore info: www.redkiteyurts.com

faqs.question: Where is Knockengorroch Festival?
faqs.answer: Knockengorroch Festival is located in Galloway in south west Scotland. The address and postcode is:Carsphairn, Castle Douglas, Kirkcudbrightshire, DG7 3TJ

faqs.question: Does Knockengorroch Festival have a dedicated bus service?
faqs.answer: The Knock Bus travels from Glasgow, Edinburgh, Dumfries and Carlisle to the festival site on Thursday and Friday, returning on Monday.Further info on the Knock Bus page at https://www.knockengorroch.org.uk/information/knock-bus/PLEASE NOTE – Knockbus E-tickets will be emailed to you. Your name will also be on the passenger list with the number of seats you’ve booked when you board.

faqs.question: Are pre-payment plan tickets available for Knockengorroch Festival?
faqs.answer: There are no Payment Plan tickets available for this event at present.

faqs.question: What do I need to know about vehicles and access at Knockengorroch Festival?
faqs.answer: Knockengorroch is a unique site. The last leg of your journey will take you off the A road and 4 miles along private roads. In order to use these roads for festival access we are subject to certain restrictions. We must keep a very close eye on number and type of vehicles coming in. If you are bringing a vehicle on to the site you must purchase a vehicle pass at the appropriate rate. Our vehicle passes reflect the fact that we are not on a public road. Please try and car share wherever possible and save costs.Vehicle passes for over 3 tonnes will only be available to purchase in advance and vehicles must have a vehicle pass to enter.If in doubt email info@knockengorroch.org.ukPlease note there is no access for vehicles over 7 ½ tonnes or vehicles or caravans wider than 7 feet.We highly recommend you buy a vehicle pass in advance. Vehicle passes are in high demand on Friday and we are highly likely to sell out again this year. Buying your vehicle pass in advance will guarantee you get it on site.Vehicle passes will be available to purchase on the gate subject to availability only.This year we again have provisions for off site parking. Off site parking is NOT on the festival site it is in Carsphairn village. Passes are at a much reduced price. A shuttle bus will bring you onto the site. One and two day off site parking passes will be available to purchase online on Saturday subject to availability.Also this year we will again be running larger Knock buses to allow more people to go car free.

faqs.question: Does Knockengorroch Festival have any age restrictions?
faqs.answer: Alll ages are welcome at Knockengorroch Festival, however all under 16s must be accompanied by an adult.

faqs.question: What happens If I bought a ticket and cannot attend?
faqs.answer: Unfortunately we can’t issue you with a refund if you can’t make the event due to work commitments or your mates have dropped out. In these circumstances, we advise passing on your tickets privately to avoid losing out on the money spent.Refunds can only be offered if the event is cancelled or postponed, as agreed upon purchase.

faqs.question: Will there be tickets available on the gate for Knockengorroch Festival?
faqs.answer: Tickets will be available to purchase on the gate subject to availability. Check online the morning you plan to arrive and please purchase before leaving if you can so that we know you are coming.

faqs.question: More Travel Information?
faqs.answer:
TAKE THE KNOCK BUS:
Knock Bus TBC for 202.Public Transport InformationFrom outside Dumfries and Galloway or Scotland the best route is to get to Glasgow, from Glasgow to Ayr by bus or train, then bus to Dalmellington where local taxi firm (Town & Country Taxis 01292 551 661) will be providing shuttle service from Dalmellington/Festival.Alternatively you can also get to New Cumnock by train and then a bus to Dalmellington. Cross road after leaving New Cumnock station and turn RIGHT, 3 minute walk from station to nearest bus stop. Bus no 356 Mon to Sat NB NO SUNDAY SERVICE Cheap train return tickets can be obtained to New Cumnock, Glasgow Central or Ayr (via Glasgow Central) from London or anywhere en route if you book early enough.National rail enquiries can provide info on ALL train journeys: 08457 48 49 50, as can Trainline. Air Travel Glasgow Prestwick airport is the closest airport-approx 35 miles from Knockengorroch. Tel 0871 223 0700.Air TravelGlasgow Prestwick airport is the closest airport-approx 35 miles from Knockengorroch. Tel 0871 223 0700. Car hire is available at the airport – book in advance.The travel info desk at the airport can advise on public transport to Ayr from the airport, from Ayr proceed as above.From within the regionKnockengorroch festival site is around 55 miles from Dumfries.If you want to reach Knockengorroch from Dumfries, you need to get a bus to Castle Douglas, and from Castle Douglas a bus to Dalmellington (bus no 520) which runs twice daily from Castle Douglas (no service on Sunday). Ask to be let off at Meadowhead or Lamford, and you are then at the ‘road end’ and 4 miles by road from the festival, the closest you can reach Knockengorroch using public transport.520 bus from Castle Douglas to Dalmellington runs Mon to Sat. Castle Douglas to Dalmellington/Ayr: leaves Castle Douglas at 8.50am and 12.50pm, arriving Dalmellington 10.07am and 2.07pm. Meadowhead and Lamford are approx 10 min before bus reaches Dalmellington.Ask to be let off at Meadowhead or Lamford and you are then at the ‘road end’ and 4 miles by road from the festival.Dalmellington to Castle Douglas: leaves Dalmellington 10.20AM AND 2.20PM, arriving Castle Douglas 11.33 AM AND 3.33 PM. You need to be at road end by 10.20 OR 2.20 to be sure of catching the bus which needs flagging down.NO SUNDAY SERVICE either way. Large vehicle access:- You MUST BUY A VEHICLE PASS IN ADVANCE for vehicles over 3 tonnes - they cannot be purchased at the gate, with no access permitted. - No access for vehicles over 7.5 tonnes. Restricted access for vehicles or caravans wider than 7 feet. Please email info@knockengorroch.org.uk with your vehicle width.For terms and conditions please see http://www.knockengorroch.org.uk/tickets/terms-conditions/ or email info@knockengorroch.org.uk

faqs.question: What's happening on Thursday at Knockengorroch Festival?
faqs.answer: Our buoyant bar and stage opens at lunchtime, giving plenty of time to park, position your camper, pitch your tent and greet old friends. You’ll also have time to browse our global shopping and food stalls, even go for a walk in our stunning upland glen – the views are fantastic from just a little way up Dodd Hill! Our iconic longhouse venue is also open for some brilliant acoustic music late into the night.

faqs.question: Can I buy a one or two day ticket for Knockengorroch Festival?
faqs.answer: One and two day tickets are NOT available to buy on Friday.You can buy either a one or two day ticket on Saturday subject to availability.A limited number of advance one day Sunday tickets are now available to buy. You may also be able to buy on the gate subject to availability.

faqs.question: What can I expect for entertainment at Knockengorroch Festival?
faqs.answer: Workshops begin at 9am each morning and continue throughout the day. The music stages begin from 12 noon and the dance venues continue until 5am.There are options to camp further away from the dance tents if you are concerned about noise. Just make sure you turn up early and ask the stewards about the best place.

faqs.question: Can I upgrade my ticket for Knockengorroch Festival?
faqs.answer: People with advance 3 day Friday entry tickets can pay an extra £20 to be admitted Thursday on the gate, subject to availability.

faqs.question: What if I have a different question?
faqs.answer: Please contact us at https://www.knockengorroch.org.uk/contact/ or call the fest office on 01644 460662

faqs.question: When is Creamfields South?
faqs.answer: Creamfields South takes place on Friday 26th - Sunday 28th May 2023.

faqs.question: How much are tickets for Creamfields South?
faqs.answer: 3-day tickets start from £220. 2 day tickets start from £195.

faqs.question: Where is Creamfields South?
faqs.answer: Creamfields South is located in ChelmsfordAddress:Hylands ParkCM2 8WQ

faqs.question: What are the entry times?
faqs.answer: Start: 2:00pmEnd: 11:00pm

faqs.question: Does Creamfields South have any age restrictions?
faqs.answer: Yes, 18’s and over – Challenge 21 in place. Photo ID required

faqs.question: Gold Ticket benefits?
faqs.answer: A Gold camping ticket includes access to the Gold campsite which features 'proper' toilets, showers, pamper parlour (with mirrors, hair straighteners, hairdryers etc), 24 hour manned Info Hub, free car parking plus access to the exclusive Hospitality Arena on site which will serve you up a complimentary meal each day. The Hospitality Arena also includes 'proper toilets', indoor and outdoor seating areas, leather sofas, wooden flooring, plus access to various exclusive concessions inside the hospitality arena* If you are purchasing a Gold Day ticket - you get everything within the Gold Package (excluding the camping features) + free car parking. A Gold camping ticket does not include Dreamfields accommodation or a pre-pitched tent, you still need to bring your own tent. Alternatively, you can book Dreamfields or Pre Pitch accommodation separately *Chargeable

faqs.question: Are pre-payment plan tickets available?
faqs.answer: No, there aren't any payment plans available for this event.

faqs.question: What happens If I bought a ticket and cannot attend?
faqs.answer: Unfortunately, we can’t issue you with a refund if you can’t make the event due to work commitments or your mates have dropped out. In these circumstances, we advise passing on your tickets privately to avoid losing out on the money spent.Refunds can only be offered if the event is cancelled or postponed, as agreed upon purchase.

faqs.question: When is Glastonbudget 2023?
faqs.answer: Glastonbudget takes place on Friday 26th May - Sunday 28th May 2023.

faqs.question: Where is Glastonbudget?
faqs.answer: Glastonbudget is located at Turnpost Farm in Wymeswold, Leicestershire, England.

faqs.question: Can I camp at Spring Classic?
faqs.answer: Yes. You must purchase a weekend camping ticket.

faqs.question: How to get to Spring Classic
faqs.answer: Parking is available, but you must purchase a car park pass. Local busses stop within walking distance to Woolacombe. A dedicated 'pick up and drop off' area is provided.

faqs.question: When is Spring Classic 2023?
faqs.answer: Spring Classic Friday 26th May - Monday 29th May 2023.

faqs.question: Can I bring my motorhome/campervan to Spring Classic?
faqs.answer: Yes. You must purchase a live-in vehicle ticket.

faqs.question: Where is Spring Classic?
faqs.answer: Spring Classic is located at Woolacombe Down, EX34 7HLWhat3Words: https://what3words.com/rushed.innovator.birdcage

faqs.question: Can I bring a Caravan to Spring Classic?
faqs.answer: No. Only live-in vehicles are permitted.

faqs.question: Can I bring my pet to Spring Classic?
faqs.answer: No animals are permitted onto the site, including car parks. The only exception is assistance dogs for customers with a disability. Such assistance dogs must be registered with a national organisation.

faqs.question: Am I allowed to bring alcohol into the festival site at Spring Classic?
faqs.answer: You are allowed to bring alcohol into the camp site only, not the festival site.

faqs.question: What are the opening times for Spring Classic?
faqs.answer: For campsite ticket holders: 10am Fri 27th May to 11am Monday 30th May For day ticket holders: 12pm – 11.45pm on either Sat 28th or Sun 29th May

faqs.question: Can I re-enter at Spring Classic?
faqs.answer: Yes. You can leave via the main gate and re-enter at any time. You must retain your festival wristband, as you will not be permitted to re enter without it. Any cars exiting and re-entering the site will be charged.

faqs.question: What am I not allowed to bring to Spring Classic?
faqs.answer:
• Glass (of any kind).
  • Any item which may reasonably be considered for use as a weapon (including penknives and cutlery)
  • Personal portable toilets (unless in combination with a van / caravan ticket)
  • Camping gas canisters above 1kg
  • Firewood and charcoal
  • Generators of any kind
  • Bean bags & inflatable chairs / loungers (they can blow away in the wind – and it can get windy.)
  • Paint spray cans
  • Laser equipment or pens
  • Fireworks / flares
  • Smoke canisters
  • Chinese lanterns
  • Klaxons / air horns / megaphones (or other similar items capable of making loud noise)
  • Personal motorized vehicles (unless a mobility scooter)
  • Any animals (with the exception of assistance dogs, are not permitted at any time)
  • Drones
  • Large sound systems
  • Unauthorised or professional photography, film or video equipment
  • Excessive amounts of alcohol – You are allowed to bring in your own alcohol (for personal consumption in the camping area only, not the arena area) but only up to reasonable amount per person. Once you have entered the event you cannot re-enter with more alcohol supplies.
  • High visibility bibs and jackets
  • Poles, banners and flags (small static flag poles in the campsites are allowed)

faqs.question: When is Midstock 2023?
faqs.answer: Midstock returns to Dalkeith Country Park on Friday 26th and Saturday 27th May 2023.

faqs.question: How do I get to Midstock?
faqs.answer: Midstock is held in the picturesque Dalkeith Country Park, just outside Edinburgh and conveniently close to Railway Borders station Eskbank. At the east end of Dalkeith High Street and with 1000 acres of space, it’s easy to get to with plenty of space for enthusiastic dancing. By Car - Use the following postcode - EH22 2NJ By Bus - If you’re coming from Edinburgh city centre, take Lothian Buses 3, 33, 49 from Edinburgh to Dalkeith. Jump off on Dalkeith High Street (outside Morrisons for the No.3, Glebe St or Old Edinburgh Road for the No. 33 , Bridgend Court or Jarnac Court for the No.49). The walk is then 5-10 minutes up the High Street to the park. Services are fast and frequent. Visit Lothian Buses for timetable information. Please note Lothian Bus tickets are £1.70 (80p for a child) and the bus drivers cannot give change. There is now contactless payments for adult tickets. From Portobello or Musselburgh, catch the number 140 East Coast bus. From Bonnyrigg take the 49 bus. Both take you to the Corn Exchange Bus Stop on Dalkeith High Street and you can walk from here. By Rail - You can also use the new Borders’ Railway to get to Dalkeith Country Park. There are regular trains from the Borders and Edinburgh City Centre to Eskbank Station.  You can then walk from here (25 minutes) or get on the number 40 Lothian Bus from outside the Tesco opposite the station to Dalkeith High Street. From Dalkeith High Street we’re 5-10 walk to Restoration Yard and Fort Douglas.Alternative Options It’s a 25-minute walk from the station to Dalkeith Country Park following Bonnyrigg Road, or you can jump on a number 40 Lothian Bus from outside the Tesco superstore opposite the station - you’ll need to get off at the Corn Exchange bus stop on Dalkeith High Street. Alternatively, Shawfair Station will be newly opened and is a 30-minute walk from the Dalkeith Country Park King’s Gate.

faqs.question: What happens If I bought a ticket and cannot attend?
faqs.answer: Unfortunately we can’t issue you with a refund if you can’t make the event due to work commitments or your mates have dropped out. In these circumstances, we advise passing on your tickets privately to avoid losing out on the money spent. Refunds can only be offered if the event is cancelled or postponed, as agreed upon purchase.

faqs.question: Does Midstock have onsite camping?
faqs.answer: No, Midstock is a non camping festival so camping equipment is not needed. It is however close to the city centre so there is plenty of alternative accommodation to choose from.

faqs.question: Where is Midstock?
faqs.answer: Midstock is located at Dalkeith Country Park, Edinburgh. The postcode is EH22 2NJ

faqs.question: Are pre-payment plan tickets available?
faqs.answer: Payment Plan tickets aren't currently available for this event.

faqs.question: Does Midstock have any age restrictions?
faqs.answer: Friday - 18 and overSaturday - under 18's accompanied by a paying adult

faqs.question: Can I bring my own food and drink into Midstock?
faqs.answer: You are not allowed to bring your own food and drink into Midstock. There will be a wide variety of food and drink stalls inside the festival.

title: This Is Tomorrow Festival
title_location: Exhibition Park in Newcastle Upon Tyne

faqs.question: When is This is Tomorrow Festival 2023?
faqs.answer: This is Tomorrow Festival takes place Friday 26th May - Sunday 28th May 2023.

faqs.question: Accessibility information
faqs.answer: For accessibility info, please see https://thisistomorrow.co.uk/info/faqs/.

faqs.question: How do I get to This is Tomorrow Festival?
faqs.answer: For the most up to date travel information, check out https://thisistomorrow.co.uk/info/travel/.

faqs.question: Where is This is Tomorrow Festival?
faqs.answer: This is Tomorrow Festival is located at:Exhibition Park,Claremont Road,Newcastle Upon Tyne,NE2 4PZ

faqs.question: What time does This is Tomorrow Festival start/end?
faqs.answer: This is Tomorrow Festival starts on Friday 26th at 15:00 (Saturday & Sunday at 13:00) and finishes at approximately 23:00.

faqs.question: Does This is Tomorrow Festival have any age restrictions?
faqs.answer: Yes, this is a 14+ event. Anyone under the age of 16 must be accompanied by a responsible adult.

title: In It Together Festival
title_location: Old Park Farm Margam in Port Talbot

faqs.question: When is In It Together 2023?
faqs.answer: In It Together takes place on Friday 26th to Sunday 28th May 2023. There will also be an exclusive campers party on Thursday 25th May.

faqs.question: Can you camp at In It Together Festival?
faqs.answer: Yes, camping is a big part of the In It Together experience. As well as the usual amenities, the sites have camping convenience stores, a selection of breakfast food traders as well as access to showers, toilets and a dedicated BBQ area. You can also upgrade your camping experience by booking one of the Boutique Camping packages.

faqs.question: What happens if I bought a ticket and cannot attend?
faqs.answer: Unfortunately we can’t issue you with a refund if you can’t make the event due to work commitments or your mates have dropped out. In these circumstances, we advise passing on your tickets privately to avoid losing out on the money spent. Refunds can only be offered if the event is cancelled or postponed, as agreed upon purchase.

faqs.question: Will there be coaches to In It Together?
faqs.answer:
Big Green Coaches are proud to be the official coach travel provider for In It Together Festival. Choose weekend or day return services from:

  • Bath
  • Birmingham
  • Bridgend
  • Bristol
  • Cardiff
  • Cheltenham
  • Gloucester
  • London
  • Newport
  • Reading
  • Swansea

Seats start from just £20 return.

faqs.question: Accessibility
faqs.answer: In It Together is held at Old Park Farm and as such there is some uneven ground. Whilst every precaution is being made, the weather conditions can dramatically affect the ground conditions so wherever possible please try to consider what preparations you may need to make and equipment you may need to bring along.

faqs.question: Where is In It Together?
faqs.answer: In It Together takes place at Old Park Farm, Water Street, Margam, Port Talbot SA13 2TG and is easily located by car, train or coach.

faqs.question: What time does the campsite open and close?
faqs.answer: The campsite opens at 9am on Friday 26th May and will close at 12pm on Monday 29th May. There will be an early access add on you can purchase for Thursday entry to the campsite from 12pm. The add on includes an exclusive campers party.

faqs.question: Bookable access facilities
faqs.answer: After significant feedback from In It Together 2022, the festival are working hard behind the scenes to provide improved accessible features within the festival for 2023. As a result, they are currently reworking their Access Requirement form to be more suited in order for them to provide these improved features. Once complete, you will need to pre-book using the Access Requirement form, please email accessibility@escaperecords.co.uk to receive this. This form and the required evidence must be sent to them once you have purchased a ticket.

faqs.question: What is the difference between VIP and General Release?
faqs.answer: Club Miami is their dedicated VIP area and is the perfect way to experience In It Together. You will be given access to the exclusive VIP area which boasts a cocktail bar & upgraded toilets for VIP use only, which also avoids queuing. A viewing garden and a chance to rub shoulders with some of the country’s most influential people. If you’d like to purchase VIP tickets or upgrade and need a little more information and support, please drop an email at vip@escaperecords.co.uk and include your phone number and the VIP team will give you a call to assist.

faqs.question: Can I park at In It Together?
faqs.answer: Yes, there is parking on site. Passes are available at a cost of £20 per vehicle. Please be aware parking will be allocated on a first come first served basis so we recommend booking in advance. The car park will be open from 9am on Friday 3rd June and will close at midday on Monday 6th June.

faqs.question: What are In It Together's opening times?
faqs.answer: The campsite will open at 9am on Friday 26th and will close at Midday on Monday 29th May 2023. The festival site will be open from 11am until 2am on Friday and Saturday and 11am-11pm on Sunday.

faqs.question: Can I upgrade to camping tickets?
faqs.answer: Yes you can please email custcare@skiddle.com who will be able to assist.

faqs.question: Can I reserve my pitch?
faqs.answer: General campsite pitches are allocated on a first come first served basis. However you can purchase a pre-pitched tent in the VIP campsite hosted by Pink Moon. Please visit Pink Moon Camping

faqs.question: 2 for 1 Tickets for Personal Assistant
faqs.answer: There is a 2:1 ticket scheme for individuals who would be unable to attend our events without bringing a personal assistant. Once you have bought a full price ticket, please fill in the access requirement form (email accessibility@escaperecords.co.uk to receive this) and provide a form of evidence as listed on the form to receive your personal assistant ticket.

faqs.question: Can I leave and re-enter In It Together car park?
faqs.answer: There will be two car parks, one for Weekend Camping and one for day visitors. All those with Non Weekend camping will park with the day tickets. Please note you will need to purchase a parking ticket.

faqs.question: What tickets should I purchase if I am staying in a campervan?
faqs.answer: You will need to purchase camping tickets as well as a campervan pitch. You will also need to purchase a parking pass for any towing vehicles.

faqs.question: Can I bring my motorhome or caravan?
faqs.answer: Yes you can – the allocated pitch size for camper vans and caravans is 8m x 6m. Due to uneven ground in some areas, please take precautions to ensure that your vehicle is securely stationed. Please note for those with caravans and trailer tents, please note that towing vehicles must be removed from the Campsite and parked in the public car park. Please note you must purchase a Motorhome pitch in addition to the cost of your weekend camping tickets.

faqs.question: Are there any age restrictions at In It Together?
faqs.answer: Can I bring my children?In It Together is open for all ages. All children under the age of 15 must be accompanied by a responsible adult. Any adult is responsible entirely for the safety and welfare of any Infant and/or Child and/or Teenager in their party. We do not accept any parental or supervisory duty of care or liability for any under 18s on site.A Challenge 25 policy will be in place on all bars and may be asked to provide evidence of your age with valid photographic ID (Driving License or Passport.) I am under 18, can I attend without an adult?Yes we have a designated Teen campsite for 16-17 year olds. No alcohol is permitted on this site and strict searches will be conducted. Can I bring my grandparents?Yes everyone is welcome at In It Together and we want you to bring the grandparents for free!

faqs.question: Accessible Toilets
faqs.answer: There will be a number of accessible toilets located on the festival site and within the campsite.

faqs.question: Can I go back to my car once I'm in the campsite?
faqs.answer: In It Together does not allow pass outs to the car park during the festival. However, you will be allowed multiple trips when unloading / loading your car.

faqs.question: Do motorhomes include electrical hook up?
faqs.answer: Yes all motorhomes include electrical hook up. But please be aware that no hookups are available for water within the Campsite.

faqs.question: Can I bring my own alcohol and food into the main arena?
faqs.answer: No. You are not allowed to bring your own alcohol or food into the main arena at the festival, this is to only be consumed within the campsite. Bins will be provided at the gates to dispose of any items before entering the main arena. There are several standpipes that contain free, clean drinking water in the campsites and main arena. Please bring a container that you can refill during the weekend. Bottled water will also be available to purchase at the catering units and bars throughout the site. Please identify yourself with these points and ensure you stay hydrated across the weekend. In It Together has a wide variety of food and drink facilities available with various cuisines on offer, there’s something for everyone at this summer’s event.

faqs.question: Accessible Camping Wristband
faqs.answer: On arrival, there will be an Access Information Point where customers can collect further information on access within the festival site. It is also here that additional pre-agreed wristbands can be collected.The accessible campsite will be cordoned off from general camping. There will be a number of accessible toilets and showers. Please assist with planning by letting the festival know if you intend to use this service when completing the Access Requirement Form.Near to the Accessible Campsite there are village services (bar, concessions, information point and welfare).

faqs.question: How far is it from the car park to the campsite?
faqs.answer: The car park is a short walk to the campsite.

faqs.question: Can we have a tent or awning next to our motorhome?
faqs.answer: In It Together do not allow separate tents to be erected alongside your campervan/ motor homes. However, if you wish to erect an awning, this is possible. You must allow 2m of space between your own awning and your neighbours plot and any awning must fit within your 8m x 6m pitch size. Please note, all awning is erected at the discretion of the campsite manager, and you may be asked to remove it if it deemed obstructive to the surrounding pitches.

faqs.question: Can I bring my own alcohol to In It Together?
faqs.answer:
here is a wide selection of beer, cider, wine and cocktails available across the main arena for you to enjoy during the weekend. If you are camping you are permitted to bring in your own alcohol. When unloading your camping equipment from your car, you are only permitted to bring alcohol in on the FIRST trip, all other attempts to bring in alcohol will not be allowed. Please see below on what you can and can’t bring and thank you for your understanding: You can bring the following into the campsite PER PERSON:
  • EITHER 10 x cans of beer or lager or cider
  • OR 10 premixed spirit cans (max 250ml)
  • OR 1 bottle of wine decanted into a plastic bottle
Please note
  • Strictly no spirits or hard liquor are permitted
  • No glass is permitted on site
  • Searches will be undertaken upon entry to ensure this is complied with
  • Any alcohol above this allocation will be confiscated
  • This alcohol may only be consumed within the campsite
  • Sealed bottles of water and soft drinks are allowed, but will be checked on entry to the site. There will be no limit on soft drinks
  • No pass-outs or readmission will be permitted for the duration of the festival
  • A wide selection of beer, wine and cocktails will be available in the main arena across the weekend

faqs.question: Facilities in the accessibility campsite
faqs.answer:
• Accessible showers and toilets
  • Fresh water points
  • Waste disposal point

faqs.question: Can I park my car and Campervan alongside tents?
faqs.answer: In the general campervan area, cars and campervans will be parked in a designated area and cannot be parked alongside tents.

faqs.question: What time can I get breakfast at In It Together?
faqs.answer: The campsite food stalls will be open from 8AM. There will be a wide range of teas, coffees, smoothies and delicious food to start your day the right way!

faqs.question: Accessible Parking Pass
faqs.answer: An Accessible Car Park is located within the Accessible Campsite perimeter. Customers are allowed to park their cars near their tent in a designated car park, but not directly next to their tent.

faqs.question: Will there be somewhere to charge my phone?
faqs.answer: Yes. Phone charging stations will be available at an additional cost in the campsite at In It Together. You can prebook yours here: https://chargecandy.com/festivals/in-it-together/

faqs.question: Will there be family activities on site?
faqs.answer: Yes we have teamed up with Junior Jungle to provide a daily programme of incredible family activities.

faqs.question: Restricted items
faqs.answer: The following list is prohibited from In It Together:Glass items, candles, gas canisters, flares, knives, illegal substances, drugs, ‘legal highs’, laser equipment/pens, megaphones, nitrous oxide, animals, fireworks, smoke canisters, poles, drones, gazebos and any items which in the absolute discretion of the Promoter are considered to be a risk to the safety of the audience and/or affect the enjoyment of the audience and/or the running of the Festival are prohibited.Everyone will be searched on entry and management reserve the right to confiscate prohibited items.

faqs.question: I have another camping question
faqs.answer: Please see full terms at In It Together here: https://inittogetherfestival.com/info-faq/#date-times

title: The Gathering
title_location: Inverness Northern Meeting Park in Inverness

faqs.question: When is The Gathering 2023?
faqs.answer: The one-day festival, The Gathering returns to Inverness on  Saturday 27th May 2023 celebrating the very best of The Highlands and Scotland.

faqs.question: How much are The Gathering tickets?
faqs.answer: Adult tickets are priced £45, with 6-15-year-old tickets available priced £33. Children under the age of 5 are entitled to free entry but must have a ticket with a barcode to attend. Family tickets are also available to purchase, allowing 2 adults and 2 6-15-year-olds to attend for £120.

faqs.question: Disabled Access Information
faqs.answer: Carer/Personal Assistant Ticket InformationCarer/Personal Assistant tickets are for those needing to accompany a paying customer are available for this event, subject to providing one of the following documentation dated within the past 12 months or with valid date covering the event:-*The front page of DLA letter with PIP letter*The front page of Attendance Allowance letter*Evidence of being registered as severely sight impaired (blind)*Recognised Assistance Dog ID card*Valid Access Card showing you require a +1 to accompany youIf this applies to you then, please book the tickets you require (not including your PA / Carer Ticket) and contact the Skiddle Customer Care team with your documentation and 16-digit order reference number by submitting a support request here: https://help.skiddle.com/hc/en-us/requests/new

faqs.question: Where is The Gathering?
faqs.answer: The Gathering takes place at The Northern Meeting Park which is located in the centre of Inverness. The postcode for the site is IV3 5NN.

faqs.question: What happens If I bought a ticket and cannot attend?
faqs.answer: Unfortunately, we can’t issue you with a refund if you can’t make the event due to work commitments or your mates have dropped out. In these circumstances, we advise passing on your tickets privately to avoid losing out on the money spent.Refunds can only be offered if the event is cancelled or postponed, as agreed upon purchase.

faqs.question: How do I get to The Gathering?
faqs.answer:
By Car - It's recommended that if travelling by car, you use the parking available within the city centre.

By Train - The nearest train station to the site is Inverness Station which is located on Academy Street, IV2 3PY

By Bus - Inverness Bus Station is the nearest bus station and this is located on Margaret Street, IV1 1LTBy Air - Flights are available from various locations around the UK and internationally to Inverness Airport.

faqs.question: My unwanted e-ticket – how do I transfer it to someone?
faqs.answer: If you would like to change the name on your order then please head to www.skiddle.com/orders/ to change your details free of charge instantly. Alternatively please call Skiddle on 03333 010101 during office opening hours. (Mon – Fri 0900 – 1800; Sat 1000 – 1700)

faqs.question: Does The Gathering have onsite camping?
faqs.answer: No, The Gathering is a one day festival with no camping available.

faqs.question: My e-ticket doesn’t have my name on it – does it matter?
faqs.answer: If the e-ticket was bought for you as part of a multiple order by one person, try to arrive with that person or have their telephone contact details with you in case there are problems with scanning your ticket at the gate. It could mean you don’t get into the festival if the ticket won’t scan at the gate and your ID doesn’t tally with the name on the ticket. If you have acquired the ticket from someone else, see above

faqs.question: Does The Gathering have any age restrictions?
faqs.answer: The Gathering is a family festival with no age restrictions - everyone is invited to attend. However, all under 18s must be accompanied by an adult aged 21 and over at all times.

faqs.question: I’ve printed my e-ticket but the colour is odd?
faqs.answer: Don’t worry – so long as it can scan you will be fine.

faqs.question: Other FAQs
faqs.answer:
ALCOHOL

Can I take it into the event?

No

ANIMALS

Can I bring them?

No, but of course guide dogs are allowed

ARENA

Can I bring in a small trolley/ collapsible chair/ umbrella/ rugs?

No- if you bring these to the gate you will not be allowed to take them in, and items will be

disposed of

Can I bring in food?

Yes, but only small unopened snacks

Can I bring in soft drinks & water?

Soft drinks cannot be brought in but we do allow small, unopened plastic bottles of water

What are the gate times?

Gates open at 11.30am and the first act is on the main stage at midday

The festival closes at 10.30pm

Admission:

You must have a valid e-ticket either on your phone or printed out. Your purchase of a ticket

and admission to the event signify your acceptance of the terms and conditions on the

ticket and on the event web site.

How late can I arrive?

Last entry at 9.30pm

Can I leave and return?

We will confirm this in due course after discussions with local authority

CASH/CONTACTLESS PAYMENT

We will have contactless payment across the majority of the site, and this will be

encouraged

There may be a small number of traders where only cash is accepted

Please ensure that you have sufficient cash/contactless available

CHILDREN

Do I need I.D for my 16 or under? 

Yes, if your child looks older than 16 but has a 16 & under ticket you will need to provide a

valid I.D

What constitutes a valid I.D?

 

We accept as I.D: Passports, Driving Licences, Young Scot Cards, Citizen Cards or any other

photo I.D with a PASS logo

Can I bring my buggy into the Festival?

Yes

Can I bring in baby food, baby milk to the Festival?

Yes

What do I do if I lose my Child at the festival?

Make contact with the nearest steward and/or welfare team

Is there a lower age limit on children attending the festival?

No

Do I need a Ticket for a babe in arms or toddler?

Yes you need a 5 and under ticket which are free but if you don’t have one, we’re not going

to send you away

Can I bring my children during the day and have them collected by a friend/family

member in the evening?

Yes this will be allowed. Details on location/passouts to be confirmed

DISABLED

Is there disabled parking?

There is no festival parking, please use city centre parking

Are all areas of the festival accessible by wheelchair?

Yes, and there is a disabled viewing area in front of the main stage; however please bear in

mind this is an outdoor event and conditions could become muddy and slippery

Are there disabled toilets?

Yes there will be disabled toilets on site

DRONES

Can I fly a drone at the event?

No unauthorised drones will be allowed to be flown anywhere over the festival as they pose

a hazard. Any unauthorised flights will be reported to Police Scotland

DRUGS

Are legal highs allowed?

No drugs or New Psychoactive Substances previously known as ‘legal highs’ other than

prescription drugs are allowed at the festival. Drug enforcement laws are as applicable on

site as anywhere else in the country. Police officers will be on site and will deal with drug

offences in accordance with national guidelines. If you engage in the unlawful supply of

drugs, it is likely that you will be arrested. Neither anti-social nor illegal behaviour will be

tolerated and participants will leave themselves liable to eviction from the site

 

GLASS

Is it allowed anywhere on site?

No glass is allowed anywhere on the festival site. Your bags will be searched on entry and

any found will be disposed of

Are medicines in glass allowed?

Yes

LOST PROPERTY

How do I get my lost property back during the event/ where do I hand in lost property?

Please make your way to the box office and they will be able to help you

How do I get my lost property back after the event?

All unclaimed lost property will be retained by Police Scotland in Inverness. Contact them by

phone on 101 or 0845 600 5703 or in person at the reception area of Burnett Road police

station, Inverness

MUSIC

Can I get details of stages and times for bands?

Times will be posted on social media on the run up to the festival and will be on signs within

the arena during the festival

What time does the music start?

Music starts at midday

What time does the music end?

Music ends at 10.30pm

PARKING

Can I park at the festival?

No- please use city centre parking

PROHIBITED ITEMS

What am I not allowed to bring to the festival?

Alcohol, glass, food, Chinese lanterns, flares, fireworks, drugs, nitrous oxide, drones,

weapons and dangerous objects

STROBE LIGHTING

Will strobe lighting be used?

Yes, please be aware strobe lighting will be used during some of the music sets

TELEPHONES

Is there mobile coverage?

As we are in the city centre there is good network coverage. However, during the event

signal may become slow due to overloading

Do you have mobile phone charging facilities?

No

UNDER 18'S

Can an under 18 with an Adult ticket enter the festival alone?

No, in order to enter the festival under 18s must be accompanied by someone 21 or over

As an Adult how many under 18s can I accompany to the festival?

There is a limit of 2 under 18’s per accompanying over 21’s

What constitutes a valid I.D?

We accept as I.D: Passports, Driving Licences, Young Scot Cards, Citizen Cards or any other 

photo I.D with a PASS logo

faqs.question: Does Dream Valley have any age restrictions?
faqs.answer: Yes you must be 18 or over to attend Dream Valley. You may be asked to show photo ID. There will be a number of bars onsite selling alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks. Dream Valley operates the ‘Challenge 25’ policy. If you look under 25 please do not be offended if we ask you for proof of age when you buy alcohol. Please bring proof of ID to show you are over 18. The following forms of Identification will be accepted:• Current UK Passport• Current Driver’s License or Provisional License Please enjoy alcohol responsibly. Do not buy alcohol for persons under the age of 18, if you do you risk being ejected from the event.

faqs.answer: DrivingIf you are planning to drive to Dream Valley, you MUST use one of the festival's official dedicated park and ride facilities. Details of their park and ride locations will be announced closer to the event date. Restrictions and parking enforcement will be in place on roads surrounding the venue and if you park illegally your vehicle will be ticketed and may be towed. We STRONGLY advise travel by public transport, from London use our cheap and easy Shuttle Bus service from North Greenwich. More information coming soon.

faqs.question: What items are prohibited at Dream Valley?
faqs.answer:
The following items are prohibited at Dream Valley:
  • Alcohol
  • Soft drinks
  • Food
  • Any glass containers
  • Potential harmful fluids (for example paint stripper)
  • Weapons – bladed or pointed
  • Umbrellas or chairs
  • Flags or banners
  • Marker pens
  • Laser pens
  • Non-prescription drugs, including the previously described ‘legal highs’
  • Professional photography or recording equipment sound systems
  • Fireworks/Flares/Laser candle lights/Gas canisters/BBQ’s/
  • Sparklers
  • Any other type of explosive
  • Windbreakers/tents
  • Dogs (except guide/service dogs)
  • Bicycles
  • Aerosols, gas canisters or air horns
  • Drones
If the above items are found either of the following may take place:
  • Allow the person to leave the site of their own accord
  • Refuse entry
  • The person to surrender the items and allows to remain on site
  • The person has the items confiscated and is also evicted from site

faqs.answer: The main Summer Love entrance will be situated opposite Mote Park Café, with Mote Park’s main entrance off Mote Avenue being the best way toaccess the site. Address: Mote Ave, Maidstone ME15 7RN.

faqs.question: What is accessibility like?
faqs.answer: The event is fully wheelchair accessible.

faqs.question: What can I bring into Summer Love?
faqs.answer: - All food and drink (except 1×500 bottle of water per person – MUST BE SEALED) is not permitted to be brought into the event. There will be a variety of delicious food available for purchase inside the event, as well as fully stocked bars.- The only animals that are permitted on site are registered guide dogs.- you’re welcome to bring your own seating (folding, camping chairs) and blankets to sit on, however please be aware that these cannot beplaced directly in front of the stage because it creates a hazard. You must be behind the barriers, which will be clearly signposted.

faqs.question: Will there be a disabled viewing area?
faqs.answer: Unfortunately there will not be a specific disabled viewing area, however please show your blue badge upon arrival and our marshals will do their best to locate you as close to the stage as possible.

faqs.question: Can I pay via cash or card at Summer Love?
faqs.answer: You won’t be able to purchase any food or drink at the event without tokens. After using tokens at a number of our events last year, we foundthat using tokens for food and drink significantly speeds up service, which results in more time for you all to enjoy the event and less timequeueing for food and drinks. When purchasing food/drink with cash, staff will take money, get your items, go to the till and count your change out and then return with youritems and change, which take on average 2/3 minutes. With tokens, this is dramatically sped up, with tokens being taken and itemsbeing passed to the customer, which takes around 20/30 seconds. Our token system also minimises the risk of COVID-19 transmission.

faqs.question: Is there disabled parking?
faqs.answer: There will be parking available for disabled customers in Mote Park’s over-flow car park.

faqs.question: What's included in a Lets Rock Wales VIP ticket?
faqs.answer: 2023 will see the ever popular and totally cool, funky 80s themed CLUB TROPICANA VIP enclosure. As well as entry to the event, VIP tickets include fast track entry, luxury loos, meal and welcome drink, PLUS exclusive DJ sets. Sit back and relax in this exclusive area with comfy seating and chairs and a full bar serving quality brands and 80’s cocktails, plus of course the all-important VIP luxury loos – essential at any festival! Fancy dress is recommended, but not compulsory! For any group or company bookings (10 or more) please email uklcs@uk-live.co.uk

faqs.question: How do I apply for a personal assistant ticket?
faqs.answer: Disabled ticket holders are offered, subject to availability, a free ticket for a personal assistant. This offer is open to those who hold a current higher rate of DLA or other UK government approved supporting evidence of their requirement for a personal assistant. Carer tickets can only be issued against general entry tickets. IMPORTANT: This offer is only available to those people that would be unable to attend the festival without a full time assistant. Every application is looked at on an individual basis and if anyone is found to be making a fraudulent application, the festival reserve the right to cancel both the original ticket and personal assistant ticket, before and during the event. To apply for a personal assistant ticket, please follow the procedure below:– Buy a standard general admission ticket (must be online)– Email proof of purchase (the email from Gigantic) AND a copy of your letter of award for DLA (or equivalent) Please send your email to uklcs@uk-live.co.uk . Please ensure that any attachments do not exceed a file size of 1MB, and that you include your full postal address in your email. PERSONAL ASSISTANT TICKETS WILL BE EMAILED ONE WEEK BEFORE THE EVENT

faqs.question: What time does the event start/finish?

faqs.question: Will I be able to come and go during the day?
faqs.answer: This is a no re-entry event. Single use re-entry wristbands will also be available for disabled guests.

faqs.question: When is Cross The Tracks 2023?
faqs.answer: Cross The Tracks takes place on Sunday 4th June 2023.

faqs.question: Ticket Information?
faqs.answer:
NO RE-ENTRY

There is no re-entry to the site once you have entered the event. Please make sure you have everything you need with you. This is an outdoor event and we recommend that you come prepared for all weathers

AGE POLICY

This is an all ages event.Children of all ages are permitted. All children and young persons up to and including the age of 17 must be accompanied by an adult over the age of 26. This MUST be the parent, legal guardian or nominated guardian of the young person. An adult over the age of 26 can accompany a maximum of 4 young persons.Babies and children under 10 must be entered for a free ticket these will be available later in the year.Children aged 10 and over require their own ticket charged at 50% of the adult ticket price these will be available later in the year.The adult ticket price will apply from the age of 18. 

BAG POLICY

To make your entry to the site as quick as possible we recommend that you do not bring a bag. However small bags smaller than an A4 piece of paper are permitted if required. Any bags larger than A4 size are prohibited, there are no cloakroom facilities on site. You can leave your bags at one of Stasher’s hundreds of left luggage locations (within walking distance of festival), for more details visit www.stasher.comDiscretion will be taken by security on the gates for groups with young children (nappy / changing bags).

PROHIBTED ITEMS

Upon arrival at the festival all customers will be subject to a search.Various items are prohibited at Cross The Tracks to keep the event safe and to allow us to comply with the licensing objectives.The following items are prohibited at the event, we reserve the right to prohibit any other item if in the reasonable opinion of the organisers it could constitute a risk to safety or security.

Food and Drink

You may not bring any food or drink (including alcohol) to the event with the exception of sealed bottles of water up to 500ml in size. Water points are available on site. Empty re-useable water bottles are permitted.

Liquids

You may not bring any liquids into the event other than sealed bottles of water up to 500ml in size or tubes of suncream up to 50ml.

Drugs / Controlled Substances

A drugs search is in operation at the event entrances, any drugs will be found, you will be ejected and passed to the police. This included New psychoactive substances “legal highs”

Trolleys

Trolleys are prohibited from entering the site, however push chairs are aloud. If you have a wheelchair please see the access requirement section below to access the viewing platform.

Animals

Only registered assistance dogs are permitted at the event.

Filming equipment

Unauthorised professional photography or filming equipment is prohibited.

Large bags

Any bags larger than A4 size are prohibited and there are no cloakroom facilities at the event. You can leave your bags at one of Stasher’s hundreds of left luggage locations (within walking distance of festival), for more details visit www.stasher.comDiscretion will be taken by security on the gates for groups with young children (nappy / changing bags).

Glitter

The event organisers are committed to minimising the impact of the event on the park environment, containers of glitter will be confiscated on arrival.

Dangerous items

The following are considered dangerous and are not permitted, our security team reserve the rightto prohibited
  • Drones
  • Glass in any form (including perfume bottles)
  • Cans or metal containers
  • Spray cans, Gas canisters or compressed gas in any container
  • Fireworks, flares, smoke canisters, Chinese lanterns
  • Camping stoves or cooking apparatus, explosives
  • Hand held communication devices such as radios, radio jammers / scanners
  • Firearms, knives or blades, replica weapons of any sort
  • Large golf umbrellas
  • Balloons
  • Stools / camping sticks / chairs or other furniture - there is seating available around the site if you need to rest your legs
  • Gazebos or parasols
  • Sports equipment
  • Flags and banners
  • Megaphones, amplification equipment
  • Klaxons, airhorns or other similar items capable of making loud noise
  • Laser pens
  • Scooters, skateboards, bicycles, trolleys
  • Any other item which security may deem hazardous
 

DRUGS SEARCH

The organisers are working closely with the Met Police to make Cross The Tracks a safe and enjoyable experience for everyone. Our aim is for a crime and drugs-free event: you should expect to be searched as you enter the site.If found with drugs you will be ejected and may be passed to the police.New laws around so-called ‘legal-highs’ are now in force and if you are found with Nitrous Oxide or other psychoactive substances you can expect to be passed to the police, as well as being refused access to the event. See www.talktofrank.com for more info.

LEAVING THE EVENT

At the end of the event, think of our neighbours around the park and leave quietly.There are two exit’s out of the event, one to Brixton Station and one for Herne Hill Station.All park gates will be secured with the exception of Brixton Water Lane gate and Herne Hill gates.Please follow signage and instructions of security who are there to help you.

ON SITE FACILITIES

Box Office

If you are collecting tickets or have any ticketing queries please visit our on-site box office which will be open from 12:00-8:15pm on Sunday 7th June 2020.

Food and Drink

There are a variety of food traders at the festival with a wide variety of bars.

Toilets

Toilets are located through ought the site and clearly signed.

Welfare and First Aid

There is a Welfare and First Aid provision on site, services are open during event hours and all visits are logged and recorded.

Nappy Changing

Our Welfare Area will be able to assist with any areas required for nappy changing and breast feeding. Please visit our Welfare area and ask staff for assistance.

Free Drinking Water

There are free drinking water points available throughout the event. We encourage you to bring your own re-useable water bottle to refill at these points.

Seating and Shade

This is a full standing show, however we do offer some seating around food concession areas within the site so you can enjoy your meal. We recommend customers prepare for all weathers.

Recycling

In an effort to reduce the use of plastic on site the event will be implementing a ban on all single use plastic bottles sold on site. A cup deposit scheme will operate at the bars in order to increase our recycling. For more information please visit our bars.

ATMS

There will be ATMs available on site. There will be a small charge for these transactions.

faqs.question: Disabled Access Information
faqs.answer:
Personal Assistant / Essential Companion Information:For this event, we're using the Skiddle Access Scheme by offering Personal Assistant tickets for customers who need to be accompanied. A Personal Assistant ticket is to be offered for free or discounted when somebody with a disability requires a carer to be in attendance with them. To automatically be eligible, please provide a copy of one of the following pieces of documentation listed below.- Front page of DLA / PIP (no specific rate)
- Front page of Attendance Allowance letter (no specific rate)
- Evidence that registered severely sight impaired (blind)
- Recognised Assistance Dog ID card
- Credability's Access CardIf this applies to you then, please book the tickets you require (not including the Personal Assistant ticket) and contact the Skiddle Customer Care team with your documentation along with your 16-digit order reference number by submitting a support request here: https://help.skiddle.com/hc/en-us/requests/new
