title: NASS Festival
title_location: The Royal Bath and West Showground in Bath

faqs.question: When is NASS Festival 2023?
faqs.answer: NASS Festival takes place Thursday 6th July - Sunday 9th July 2023.

faqs.question: How to get to NASS Festival
faqs.answer: Head towards The Showground, Shepton Mallet BA4 6QN.As you get closer, you’ll see yellow road signs which will direct you to the right car park. Getting dropped off?Follow signs for Blue Gate / Blue Car Park. Parking at NASS – Camping Ticket HoldersIf you’re parking at the show follow signs for Green Car Park. Parking at NASS – Day  Ticket HoldersFollow signs for Blue Gate / Blue Car Park. Parking at NASS – Campervan Pass HoldersFollow signs for Purple Gate / Campervans.

faqs.question: Is there camping available at NASS Festival?
faqs.answer: Yes there is on-site camping available at NASS Festival.

faqs.question: Can I leave and re-enter the festival if I have a camping ticket?
faqs.answer: No, re-entry is not allowed at NASS Festival. If camping you will be able to return to your car only once, and any alcohol you want to bring can only be brought in on your first entry to the festival.

faqs.question: Accessibility information
faqs.answer: For all the information on accessibility at NASS Festival, please see https://www.nassfestival.com/info/accessibility/.

faqs.question: Where is NASS Festival?
faqs.answer: NASS Festival is located at the Bath and West Showground in Shepton Mallet.

faqs.question: What campsite facilities are available at NASS Festival?
faqs.answer:
The following facilities will be available:
  • Multiple toilets (and fancy ones for VIP and Glamping)
  • Drinking water (free, please bring a reusable water bottle)
  • Showers (free in VIP and Glamping sites, small charge in general camping)
  • Bar
  • Caterers / Traders
  • Supermarket

faqs.question: Can I watch the skate/BMX competition without a festival ticket?
faqs.answer: No, sporting events are held in the festival arena and you will require a ticket to enter. You won't need an additional pass for this once you're in the festival.

faqs.question: Are there any age restrictions at NASS Festival?
faqs.answer: All ages are welcome, but you must be aged 16 or over to attend without an adult.   Anyone aged 15 or under will need to be accompanied by an adult aged 21 or over. One adult can look after up to 2 under 15s.   You may require valid photo ID to enter. College ID or photocopies do NOT count, you will need an original Drivers/Provisional License / Passport / Photo ID with a PASS logo.

faqs.question: What camping options are available at NASS Festival?
faqs.answer:
• Locarno (for the partiers, close to the action and open late)
  • Creation (not as hectic as Locarno, a quieter option)
  • Campervan Field
  • Glamping
  • VIP
  • Camplight Pre-Pitched Tents

faqs.question: Can I bring my skateboard or BMX to NASS Festival?
faqs.answer: Yes! There is lots of concrete to ride and a custom-built public park.

faqs.question: What is included in a Glamping ticket?
faqs.answer:
• A bell tent / bedouin tent / pre-pitched tent
  • Private site
  • Free hot showers
  • Plumbed-in toilets
  • Pamper tent (hairdryers / straighteners / mirrors)
  • Free Wi-Fi
  • Fast-track entry to the main arena
  • 24 hour reception and concierge
Note: you will need to purchase a festival ticket in addition to your glamping ticket.

faqs.question: Can I bring my dog or other pets?
faqs.answer: No, with the exception of guide dogs.

faqs.question: What is included in a VIP camping ticket?
faqs.answer:
• Private site
  • Entry to the festival from Thursday 7th July
  • Free hot showers
  • Luxury toilets
  • Free Wi-Fi
  • Fast-track entry into the main arena
  • Fast-track entry into venues
  • Free parking

faqs.question: What is included if I purchase the Camplight Pre-Pitched Tent option?
faqs.answer: Camplight offers you a pre-pitched tent for the duration of you stay for just £55. Y Note: you will need to purchase a festival ticket and have a camping ticket.

faqs.question: Can I bring my campervan?
faqs.answer: Yes, campervans have their own separate site.

faqs.question: What time do the campsites open?
faqs.answer: Campsites open at 9am on Thursday 6th July. They close at 2pm on Monday 10th July (so you should definitely leave by then!)

faqs.question: Can I park next to my tent?
faqs.answer: No. All vehicles must be left in the car park. One small tent will be allowed next to each campervan / motorhome but they must be in the campervan field.

faqs.question: Can I bring my cooker
faqs.answer: No, no cooking equipment, BBQs, or gas / paraffin lamps are allowed due to fire risk.

faqs.question: When does Mad Cool Festival take place?
faqs.answer: Mad cool festival takes place between the Thursday 6th - Saturday 8th July 2023.

faqs.question: I would like to upgrade my ticket to VIP, what should I do?
faqs.answer: Upgrades are managed directly by the ticketing agents. Please get in touch with the ticketing agent you bought the ticket from or send an email to info@madcool.es and we will sort it out for you.

faqs.question: Do you have to be of legal age to gain access to Mad Cool?
faqs.answer: If you are over 16 you will be able to enter the site without having to be accompanied. But if you are between 16 and 17, you will be required to register your bracelet online once you receive it at home.If you are under the age of 16 you will have to be accompanied by an adult. Also, either a parent or legal guardian will be required to complete the online registration of your bracelet.Entrance is free for children under the age of 8 (always accompanied).

faqs.question: Can you camp at Mad Cool Festival?
faqs.answer: Unfortunately, Mad Cool is not a camping festival, so there is no official or on-site camping. However, accommodation can be booked as an add on.

faqs.question: Are payment plans available?
faqs.answer: Yes, payment plans are available for the festival.

faqs.question: What are the easiest and greenest ways to get to Noisily?
faqs.answer:
Cycling

Noisily encourages you to ride your bike and we have added a wonderful bike park in the MBS to keep them safe. Please let us know you are coming, the festival might want to speak to you about your trip to the event. Get in touch with them via facebook. Details of where to go when you arrive and where the bike park is will be in the handbook sent out with tickets. 

Trains

One of the easiest and greenest way to reach the festival is to hop on the train to Market Harborough, which only takes one hour to reach from London Kings Cross. If you are planning on using this train in rush hour it is strongly advisable to book in advance as these fares can shoot up. From Market Harborough, it is a short 15-minute cab journey to the festival site. www.nationalrail.com

Car Sharing 

Yes, if you are coming by car, then please use our friends over at Go Car Share. If you are a driver, sue this site to fill your car or find a space if you are a passenger without wheels. Using Go CarShare you can make some new friends, save money on petrol and reduce your negative environmental impact all in one. https://gocarshare.com/festival/noisily

faqs.question: I have access needs, is the site accessible? Do you offer a free carers ticket?
faqs.answer: Yes, the festival have implemented various measures to make the site more accessible, please visit the Accessibility Info Pages on their website for details and how to apply for either free carer ticket or access to the accessible campsite.

faqs.question: Is there camping available at Noisily Festival?
faqs.answer: Yes, there are camping and glamping options available at Noisily Festival. See their website for further information.

faqs.question: When is Noisily Festival?
faqs.answer: Noisily Festival takes place Thursday 6th July - Sunday 9th July 2023.

faqs.question: How do I get from Market Harborough to the Festival Site?
faqs.answer: When you get to the station, you need to jump in a taxi, they are usually waiting outside. There is also a list of numbers on the wall just outside.

faqs.question: Where is Noisily Festival?
faqs.answer: Set in the rolling hills of the Leicestershire countryside, 20 minutes from Market Harborough.  Ticket buyers will be sent the postcode with their tickets.

faqs.question: Are there any public buses that go past the festival site?
faqs.answer: There are no public bus services running to, from or near the site. All public busses and coaches normally drop off to Leicester or sometimes Market Harborough. For info on local busses around the area and to Market Harborough, check out the Arriva Busses Website for timetable detailshttps://www.arrivabus.co.uk/midlands/places/market-harborough/

faqs.question: What is the site like at Noisily?
faqs.answer: Noisily is in a beautiful wooded valley, it’s a bit rough around the edges and hilly, which it makes it a little difficult to get around but the festival organisers love it and they think you will too. The festival has constructed lots of roads and more easily accessible areas, which you can find out more about in our accessibility info.

faqs.question: What’s open on Thursday?
faqs.answer: The Mind Body Soul area will be open from 4pm, with activities continuing until 10pm and an opening party going on until 4am that night.(The main arena and stages will open at 12pm on Friday 12th July.)

faqs.question: Are there coach services to the Festival Site?
faqs.answer:
No, but you can take National Express Coach to Leicester. If you want to travel by coach National Express provide a fairly regular cheap and accessible service from most cities in the UK. For example, travelling from Bristol to Leicester takes between 3 and 4 hours, with a return journey priced from £31.10. 

https://www.nationalexpress.com/en

faqs.question: Can I stay off site and travel in each day?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can – please make sure you read the info pack sent out with your tickets; in it will contain advice about where to park and when you can re-enter.  Please note there is no local public transport.

faqs.question: Do you run any Shuttles from Market Harborough?
faqs.answer: The festival do not currently have any Noisily Festival Shuttles Planned but they are looking into it. The festival will update their website and FaceBook if they decide to offer any or if they have any further information. A decision will be on this March, 2019.

faqs.question: Can I bring my pet?
faqs.answer: Although the festival loves animals as much as anyone, they are not allowed on site. If you have a guide dog, let the festival know on the access application when you apply.

faqs.question: I’m driving my car, is there parking or a green tax?
faqs.answer: Yes, there is a car park. If you are driving, please register for the GoCat Share scheme. If you bring your car, as in previous years, cars with 2 or fewer people inside will be subject to a compulsory £10 carbon tax payable in cash upon entry to the site. This will go towards the festival's in house tree planting scheme, wherein they invest in saplings and plant them throughout the historic parkland, knowing that in future years they will absorb and offset carbon released into the atmosphere by both the festival itself, and those driving to reach it. If you only have a two-seater vehicle you will still need to pay.

faqs.question: Can I bring my campervan or live in vehicle?
faqs.answer: Yes, you need to purchase an extra pass.

faqs.question: Where is the nearest airport?
faqs.answer: The closest airports are Nottingham East Midlands, London Luton and London Stansted, all between 60 and 90 minutes of the festival site by car. Direct trains run from Stansted to Leicester, and Luton Airport Parkway to Market Harborough. For those of you flying to other London airports like City, Gatwick and Heathrow, the best thing to do it hop on a train from London St Pancras and head to Market Harborough from there.

faqs.question: What type of music is at Noisily?
faqs.answer: Noisily is an electronic music festival and cover all flavours: Techno, Psytrance, Drum and Bass, Glitch Hop, House, Disco, Desert Techno, Slo Mo and everything in between.

faqs.question: When is TRNSMT Festival?
faqs.answer: TRNSMT Festival takes place on Friday 7th July - Sunday 9th July 2023.

faqs.question: Travel information
faqs.answer: There is no festival parking. Glasgow Green is located within a residential area and there will be road closures in place during the festival weekend. By trainThere are last minute cancelations and extremely limited rail services across Scotland at the moment. Please plan ahead and don’t rely on trains to get you to and from TRNSMT, check the ScotRail website for the latest information, and look at alternative travel options. If you have no other way of travelling, please be aware you will need to leave the event early to catch the last available train. by subwayGlasgow Green can be accessed from three Subway Stations all within a fifteen-minute walk -  Bridge Street, Buchanan Street and St Enoch.  by busGlasgow Green can be accessed by Buchanan Bus Station, which is around a twenty-minute walk. Happy Bus is running services from across Scotland to and from cinch presents TRNSMT. This service must be pre-booked at www.happybus.co.uk. by uberGo to cinch presents TRNSMT Festival with Uber! It's festival season.Request a ride and let Uber take you to and from the event. Follow the directions in the app for a smooth pickup and drop off experience. by carIf you are being dropped off, please head for Glasgow Green Football Centre. If you are being picked up, we have identified four key locations depending on which direction you are approaching the city. Please click here to familiarise yourself with these locations. Pick Up Points What3Words:West – Broomielaw at Kingston bridge ///trail.locate.uponSouth – Caledonia Road ///space.repair.briefEast – London Road ///tour.mobile.shineNorth - Duke St at Tennents Brewery ///vibrates.itself.wavingThere are 8 car parks nearby. Please visit the specific car parking operators website for more information – Q Park, NCP, and City Parking.

faqs.question: Is there camping available at TRNSMT Festival?
faqs.answer: no there is not camping available at TRNSMT festival.

faqs.question: Accessibility information
faqs.answer: Blue badge parking must be pre-arranged in advance with the Access Co-Ordinator on access@trnsmfest.com  At cinch presents TRNSMT we aim to create an event that’s truly accessible for all, which is why –since the festival’s creation we have been working in close partnership with Attitude is Everything to achieve this goal. TRNSMT Festival are proud to have been awarded the Gold level of Attitude is Everything’s Charter of Best Practice.A charity set up to help improve deaf and disabled people’s access to live music, as well as to support the music industry in making live music events more accessible. You can find out more about them here http://www.attitudeiseverything.org.uk/cinch presents TRNSMT has a dedicated Access Team working all year round to constantly improve the experience for access customers.  Medical Facilities, First Aid, Welfare, and a Wellbeing Area are available to all at cinch presents TRNSMT‘CAN’T WAIT’ cards. Accessible Platform Wristband Accessible platforms are controlled by a wristband system and customer list managed by the Access Manager and Stewards. To ensure they run smoothly, eachlocation has its own team of stewards and security. As platforms have a limited capacity these are strictly for access customers, plus one (1) companion. Main Stage Accessible platform accessMain Stage Accessible Platform has a Wheelchair Charging PointKing Tut's Stage accessible platform accessUnisex Accessible Toilets (including mobile changing places unit ‘Pamiloo’ located at Main Stage Access Platform)Blue Badge ParkingStore Medication in Fridge on requestAccessible Platform Food & Drink ServiceAccessible platform Merchandise Purchase SupportPersonal Assistant TicketAccessible Facilities Wristband (no platform access) Unisex Accessible Toilets (including mobile changing places unit)Blue Badge ParkingStore Medication in FridgePersonal Assistant TicketBSL INTERPRETING SERVICES BSL Performance Interpreters are available on request in advance. Please send advance requests to access@trnsmtfest.com At least 60 day notice is advised.ASSISTANCE DOGS  We welcome any assistance dogs, If you require dog spending area on site please email your request within a reasonable time frame to access@trnsmtfest.com Accessible Platform Wristband which includes access to the accessible platform at the main stage and King Tut's stage, unisex accessible toilets, blue badge parking, store any medication in our fridges and Personal Assistant's ticket. Accessible Facilities Wristband includes access to the unisex accessible toilets, blue badge parking, store any medication in our fridges and Personal Assistant's ticket. Please note that this does not gain access to the accessible platform. Personal Assistant (PA)/Companion Ticket If a customer is unable to attend the festival without the support from a PA, then we will provide an additional PA ticket,  This ticket can only be approved by the Access Team. The (PA) ticket is subject to registering and our confirmation. Please refer to Event and Special Event Terms & Conditions on PA tickets.

faqs.question: How much are TRNSMT Festival?
faqs.answer: Weekend tickets are from £145 + BF.

faqs.question: Where is TRNSMT Festival?
faqs.answer: Glasgow Green in Glasgow.

faqs.question: What happens If I bought a ticket and cannot attend?
faqs.answer: Unfortunately we can’t issue you with a refund if you can’t make the event due to work commitments or your mates have dropped out. In these circumstances, we advise passing on your tickets privately to avoid losing out on the money spent.Refunds can only be offered if the event is cancelled or postponed, as agreed upon purchase.

title: The Tidyland Weekender Festival

faqs.question: When is The Tidyland Weekender 2023?
faqs.answer: The Tidyland Weekender takes place from Friday 7th to Monday 10th July 2023.

faqs.question: How to get to The Tidyland Weekender
faqs.answer: Venue address: Pontins Southport Holiday Park. Shore Rd, Southport PR8 2PZBy Car: We recommend you plan your travel to the event via Googlemaps, https:// www.google.com/mapsBy Train: There is a local Train Station in Southport located approximately 10 minutes drive from Pontins. We recommend you use https://www.thetrainline.com/ or https:// www.nationalrail.co.uk/to plan your travel.The nearest Airports to Southport are https://www.liverpoolairport.com/ or https:// www.manchesterairport.co.uk/. Various trains run indirectly to Southport from both these airports. Please see the above train provider websites for more details.

faqs.question: Is there any camping at The Tidyland Weekender?
faqs.answer: No, but it takes place at Pontins Holiday Resort so there will be chalets available.

faqs.question: Ticket info for The Tidyland Weekender 2023
faqs.answer: All tickets for the Tidyland Weekender are purchased via SKIDDLE. The Tidy Weekender runs an e Ticket system so all ticketing and group organisation is fully electronic. No printed tickets will be posted out. Each individual ticketholder will be given a unique QR code which will be checked on entrance. You need to be 18 years or over to attend. EVERYONE MUST PRESENT VALID ID THAT MATCHES THE CORRESPONDING NAME REGISTERED IN THEIR WEEKENDER ACCOUNT UPON ARRIVAL. To avoid issues with mobile phone coverage please makes sure your Ticket & QR code is already downloaded and saved to your phone or device. Alternatively bring a print out of your e Ticket QR code.For further information on ticketing, please visit SKIDDLE here: https://help.skiddle.com/en/

faqs.question: Principle Bookers
faqs.answer: All chalets will have a principle booker / group leader, who is responsible for the booking and the chalet for the entire duration of your stay at the event. It's their responsibility to make sure the booking info is complete. The principle booker is the only point of contact for any questions, queries or issues needed to be raised regarding the booking. If you need to change the principle booker's details, please contact the SKIDDLE customer support team here: https://help.skiddle.com/en/

faqs.question: Where is The Tidyland Weekender?
faqs.answer: The Tidyland Weekender is held at Pontins Southport Holiday Resort, Southport.

faqs.question: Chalets
faqs.answer: All chalets are self-catering and include a lounge with TV, kitchen with cooker and cooking/ dining utensils, a bathroom with either a shower or bath plus a sink and toilet.The size of the chalet will depend on the berth size as will the number of beds / bedrooms. Most of the chalets include a double sofa bed in the lounge which counts as 2 of the total beds. The rest of the beds will be singles.There are 2 types of chalet class - VIP and classic. VIP a feature free electric and a patio door. Classic chalets require electricity cards available from reception at £5 each. Pontins only provide duvets and pillows but no linen (bed sheets, pillow cases, duvet covers). Linen is charged for by the holiday park so we recommend bringing your own if possible. The holiday park charges £5 for a single linen pack and £8 for a double linen pack. The park also don't provide towels so please bring your own if possible although you can buy towels from the park.

faqs.question: What happens If I bought a ticket and cannot attend?
faqs.answer: Unfortunately we can’t issue you with a refund if you can’t make the event due to work commitments or your mates have dropped out. In these circumstances, we advise passing on your tickets privately to avoid losing out on the money spent. Refunds can only be offered if the event is cancelled or postponed, as agreed upon purchase.

faqs.question: What's the line up and running times for The Tidyland Weekender?
faqs.answer: The DJ line up will be announced shortly. Open arrival to the event you will be issued with an event lanyard that will include all the running times and set times for the full weekends entertainment program.

faqs.question: I have booked a room but want to upgrade / downgrade. Is this possible?
faqs.answer: Yes - please contact us at https://www.skiddle.com/contact/

faqs.question: I want to book but I can't afford it - can you help?
faqs.answer: Yes we can. All you need to do is place a minimum booking of £50 (+ £5 Booking Fee) deposit per person in your apartment to confirm that they are going. The rest of the ticket money can then be split over month payments through until May 2023. For more details on the payment plans go to: https://help.skiddle.com/en/collections/2982905-paymentplan

faqs.question: Does my ticket include accommodation AND access to all venues & entertainment across the weekend?
faqs.answer: All chalet tickets include all accommodation & venue access. Day passes just include venue access.

faqs.question: I have booked a room but want to upgrade / downgrade. Is this possible?
faqs.answer: Yes - please contact us at https://www.skiddle.com/contact/

faqs.question: When will a receive my tickets for The Tidyland Weekender?
faqs.answer: You will not receive a physical ticket, but you will receive a digital ticket via email from SKIDDLE. You will need to bring this to the event along with a form of ID (passport, driving license etc)

faqs.question: Will I be charged for any damages to my chalet?
faqs.answer: Yes, there will be a damage waiver form in every chalet and given to one to the principal booker upon check in. It is essential that you check all items listed on the form and report any damage as soon as you can.All chalets will be checked on the Monday afternoon with a member of Pontin's staff.

faqs.question: Can I pay - then get my friends to pay separately?
faqs.answer: Sorry, no. One person has to be responsible for making the payment for each booking (the minimum being two in a party). It's just like going on holiday, one person has to take responsibility for either collecting and paying the deposit, or collecting all the money and paying in full.

faqs.question: Will I be charged for any damages to my chalet?
faqs.answer: Yes, there will be a damage waiver form in every chalet and given to one to the principal booker upon check in. It is essential that you check all items listed on the form and report any damage as soon as you can.All chalets will be checked on the Monday afternoon with a member of Pontin's staff.

faqs.question: Is there a Thursday night at The Tidyland Weekender this year?
faqs.answer: Yes! If you book and pay in full before 30th September you get this additional night for free. Tickets for the Thursday go on sale 01st October and are priced at £35 per person.

faqs.question: What time does check-in begin at The Tidyland Weekender?
faqs.answer: Doors open for main check in 12 Noon on Friday 7th July 2023. Please note - if you are coming on the Thursday night you will be emailed specific details.

faqs.question: What time does The Tidyland Weekender officially close?
faqs.answer: Everyone will be expected to leave the site by 10am Monday 10th July 2023 Should you want to check out early than this is possible. Please advise main reception and hand your keys back in.

title: Lets Rock Southampton - The Retro Festival
title_location: The Common Southampton SO15 in Southampton

faqs.question: When is Lets Rock Southampton 2023?
faqs.answer: Lets Rock Southampton takes place on Saturday 8th July 2023.

faqs.question: What's included in a Lets Rock Southampton VIP ticket?
faqs.answer: 2023 will see the ever popular and totally cool, funky 80s themed CLUB TROPICANA VIP enclosure. As well as entry to the event, VIP tickets include fast track entry, luxury loos, meal and welcome drink, PLUS exclusive DJ sets. Sit back and relax in this exclusive area with comfy seating and chairs and a full bar serving quality brands and 80’s cocktails, plus of course the all-important VIP luxury loos – essential at any festival! Fancy dress is recommended, but not compulsory! For any group or company bookings (10 or more) please email uklcs@uk-live.co.uk

faqs.question: How do I apply for a personal assistant ticket?
faqs.answer: Disabled ticket holders are offered, subject to availability, a free ticket for a personal assistant. This offer is open to those who hold a current higher rate of DLA or other UK government approved supporting evidence of their requirement for a personal assistant. Carer tickets can only be issued against general entry tickets. IMPORTANT: This offer is only available to those people that would be unable to attend the festival without a full time assistant. Every application is looked at on an individual basis and if anyone is found to be making a fraudulent application, the festival reserve the right to cancel both the original ticket and personal assistant ticket, before and during the event. To apply for a personal assistant ticket, please follow the procedure below:– Buy a standard general admission ticket (must be online)– Email proof of purchase (the email from Gigantic) AND a copy of your letter of award for DLA (or equivalent) Please send your email to uklcs@uk-live.co.uk . Please ensure that any attachments do not exceed a file size of 1MB, and that you include your full postal address in your email. PERSONAL ASSISTANT TICKETS WILL BE EMAILED ONE WEEK BEFORE THE EVENT

faqs.question: Does Lets Rock Southampton have onsite camping?
faqs.answer: No, Let's Rock Southampton is a non-camping festival so camping equipment is not needed.

faqs.question: Where is Lets Rock Southampton?
faqs.answer: Lets Rock Southampton! is located at The Common, Southampton.

faqs.question: What time does the event start/finish?
faqs.answer: The gates open at 11.00am and we recommend that you get there early, so that you don’t miss any of the action! The Festival starts at midday and finishes at 10:30pm.

faqs.question: Does Lets Rock Southampton have any age restrictions?
faqs.answer: No, Lets Rock Southampton is a family-friendly festival.

faqs.question: Will I be able to come and go during the day?
faqs.answer: This is a no re-entry event. Re-entry to the Festival is not permitted, with the sole exception of parents/guardians accompanying children under the age of 16. Single use re-entry wristbands will only be issued on-site at the Festival to parents/guardians who are in possession of a Child Ticket and this pass allows for re-entry to the festival with or without your child. Adults not accompanying children to the Festival will not be allowed re-entry. Single use re-entry wristbands will also be available for disabled guests.

faqs.question: When is Beat-Herder Festival?
faqs.answer: Beat-Herder Festival takes place on Thursday 13th July - Sunday 16th July 2023.

faqs.question: How to get to Beat-herder festival?
faqs.answer:
Address:

If driving, the postcode for use with a SatNav or GPS device is BB7 4LH.The nearest towns to Beat-Herder Festival are Skipton and Clitheroe - if using public transport it's advisable to make your way to one of those by bus and get a taxi to the festival:

Local Taxis

There will be a taxi rank on site - look out for the yellow caravan!Minibuses and coaches 01254 672338Clitheroe Taxis 01200 444444Burnley Taxis 01282 777247Accrington Taxis 01254 388888If you need any information or have any problems with any of the above please call 07435972251There is a regular bus service that passes the festival gates, the X80. This runs along the A59 from Preston in the West to Skipton out East. More info and timestables in the links below:http://www.lancashirebus.co.uk/times.jsp?routeID=146http://www.dalesbus.org/x80.html There is a regular bus service that passes the festival gates, the X80. This runs along the A59 from Preston in the West to Skipton out East. More info and timestables in the links below:http://www.prestonbus.co.uk/services/280-180-X80-Preston-Skipton_469.html

faqs.question: Can we bring a gas heater for our tent?
faqs.answer: Due to a recent spate of devastating carbon monoxide poisonings in tents around the UK, the festival now has a complete ban on gas bottles being used inside any tents. This applies for both heating or cooking.Please ensure all cooking is done in a well ventilated porch or gazebo or, better still, completely outside your tent.A much safer solution to the problem of keeping warm at night would be a decent thick duvet or sleeping bag and a roll mat. These options are often cheaper than buying a gas heater and are definitely safer and permitted at the festival.

faqs.question: Are carer's tickets available?
faqs.answer: Yes, through prior arrangement. Please get in touch with Nicola@beatherder.co.uk, who will sort it out. The festival requires proof of DWP DLA benefit, and request that you leave it no later than the end of May to get in touch. Beat-Herder will do its best to arrange any special requirements.

faqs.question: Where can I find tickets?
faqs.answer: Check out https://beatherder.co.uk.

faqs.question: Where is Beat-Herder Festival?
faqs.answer: The Ribble Valley in Lancashire The Beat-Herder Festival Site off A59, Sawley Brow, Clitheroe BB7 4LH

faqs.question: Is there a family camping area?
faqs.answer: Not specifically. We try to encourage those who prefer things a bit quieter to head towards the furthest fields. These areas generally have a bit more room too as they require a bit more effort to get there. (it's not miles away though - maybe a few hundred metres further).

faqs.question: Accessibility information
faqs.answer: As always, there will be disabled toilets in the main arena and camping areas. This year there is a separate camping area with a charging tent for wheelchairs and mobility scooters. This area is close to the arena entrance and will be for both tents and campervans, users can have their cars close by. If you would like to use this area, or have any other requirements, please get in touch with Nicola@beatherder.co.uk before the end of May.

faqs.question: Is Beat-Herder a family festival?
faqs.answer: No, it's a music festival!Having said that, they have a large, well equipped and properly staffed children's area within the festival, as well as plenty to entertain children of all ages across the whole site.Many people bring children along and have a great time, but please remember that you need to be over 25 if you are bringing anyone under 18 with you (up to a max. of 2 U18s).Please also remember that adults making the most of a music festival can sometimes be a bit intimidating to the young and uninitiated, especially later in the evening.

faqs.question: Are there any 'boutique' camping options?
faqs.answer: Yes. Beat-Herder has teamed up with close friend Mr (Tommy) Thompson. He's a local tent maker and is offering the use of his bell tents and yurts as boutique accommodation at the festival - sited in their own exclusive compound, accessed only by those with special wristbands. The area will have hot showers and flushing toilets. Prices vary - depending on size and requirements.For more info on other Camping Under the Stars options please get in touch with Tommy directly by emailing tommy@campingunderthestars.com or on 07966392381. You can see some of Tommy's work by visiting his website.

faqs.question: What time does the Beat-Herder start?
faqs.answer: It depends on what ticket you have bought... For Thursday Entry (4 DAY TICKET) ticket holders, the festival site will be open from 10am on Thursday 13th July 2023. For Friday Entry (3 DAY TICKET)ticket holders, the festival site will be open from 9.00am on Friday 14th July 2023.

faqs.question: Can I bring a caravan or campervan?
faqs.answer: Yep, although you'll need a specific pass, depending on what you're bringing. There are passes for campervans up to 6 meters long, passes for those over 6 meters long and passes for cars towing caravans. You can get the pass that you need when you buy your tickets.

faqs.question: Are there restrictions on bringing alcohol?
faqs.answer: You can bring as much alcohol as you like into the camping areas. Alcohol brought from the campsite/live-in vehicle and boutique camping areas into the main arena will be limited to 4 cans or a reasonable equivalent in other vessels.The festival doesn't restrict the amount of trips you make back and forth with alcohol, but please don't forget, Beat-Herder is self funded and bar sales contribute hugely to the continuation of the event. Alcohol prices are reasonable - no more than in your local pub. Oh, and drinks are served cold, not like your tent-warmed four pack!Glass is NOT ALLOWED in the main arena.

faqs.question: Are there showers onsite?
faqs.answer: Yes. There are a few options, including 'the more fun showers' (cold) and some primo hot showers, which are cleaned between uses (there's a small charge for these).

faqs.question: When is Revival in the Park 2023?
faqs.answer: Revival in the Park takes place Friday 14th July - Saturday 15th July 2023.

faqs.question: How to get to to Revival in the Park by car
faqs.answer: If you’re looking to arrive by car, you will need to purchase a parking ticket from our ticket page.If you’re camping, you will need to purchase a parking ticket for both days. The car park situated within Mote Park’s main entrance is for park users only. Please note, we strongly advise that you do not park in and around residential areas surrounding the parkand doing so will run the risk of you receiving a parking ticket.

faqs.question: Can you camp at Revival in the Park?
faqs.answer: You can! If you hold a weekend ticket and would like to enhance your festival experience – you can add a camping ticket to your order! Please note camping tickets are required per person – not per tent! If you would like to park your car over the weekend while camping – you will also need a camping parking ticket!

faqs.question: What is accessibility like at Revival in the Park?
faqs.answer: The event is fully wheelchair accessible.

faqs.question: How much is a ticket for Revival in the Park?
faqs.answer: Adult general admission tickets are from £49.50 + booking fee for a full weekend ticket or £24.50 + booking fee for a day ticket.

faqs.question: How to get to to Revival in the Park by train
faqs.answer: Maidstone West Station – 1.3 miles from Mote Park  Maidstone Barracks Station – 1.7 miles from Mote Park  Maidstone East Station – 1.4 miles from Mote Park

faqs.question: Where is Revival in the Park?
faqs.answer: Revival in the Park is located in MoteMote Park in Maidstone, Kent Park in Maidstone, Kent  The main Revival in the Park entrance will be situated opposite Mote Park Café, with Mote Park’s main entrance off Mote Avenue being the best way to access the site.

faqs.question: What time does the campsite open at Revival in the Park?
faqs.answer: The campsite will open at 12:00 on Friday 14th July and closes for entry / re-entry at midnight.The campsite then reopens at 08:00 and closes for entry/re-entry at midnight onSaturday 15th July 2023. The campsite will then close at 15:00 on Sunday 16th July.

faqs.question: Will there be accessible toilets at Revival in the Park?
faqs.answer: Yes, there will be numerous accessible toilets on site.

faqs.question: What happens if I bought a ticket and cannot attend?
faqs.answer: Unfortunately we can’t issue you with a refund if you can’t make the event due to work commitments or your mates have dropped out. In these circumstances, we advise passing on your tickets privately to avoid losing out on the money spent. Refunds can only be offered if the event is cancelled or postponed, as agreed upon purchase.

faqs.question: How to get to to Revival in the Park by bus
faqs.answer: The Mall Bus Station is located approximately one mile from Mote Park.

faqs.question: What facilities are available when camping at Revival in the Park?
faqs.answer:
Standard camping facilities include: 
  • Luxury Toilets
  • Campsite Bar
  • Token Booth
  • Showers
  • Campsite Food Vendor
  • Phone Charging Stations

faqs.question: Does Revival in the Park offer complimentary carers tickets?
faqs.answer: Yes, customers are required to purchase a ticket for themselves, and then send the order confirmation, as well as a photo of their DLA/PIP letter to customer@lucuslive.com, where they will then process the documents and email you a carer pass free of charge.

faqs.question: Can I leave and re-enter Revival in the Park?
faqs.answer: No, re-entry to the arena site is not allowed.

faqs.question: What does a VIP ticket for Revival in the Park include?
faqs.answer:
A VIP ticket includes everything included in a standard ticket plus...
  • Fast track entry
  • An amazing viewing area of the main stage
  • Private bar
  • Luxury loos
  • Chill out area with seating

faqs.question: Can I bring a motorhome / camper van to Revival in the Park?
faqs.answer: Yes they welcome camper vans / motorhomes into Revival!You will have the option to purchase your camper van tickets with an electricity supply or without. IMPORTANT: camper vans cannot exceed 24 feet Camper Van Ticket w/ Power: £90.00 + Booking FeeCamper Van Ticket w/o Power: £50.00 + Booking Fee Please note camper van tickets are per vehicle, not per person. Each camper will also require a weekend festival ticket to attend the show. Camper van users will have access to the same facilities as those within the standard campsite.

faqs.question: Will there be a disabled viewing area at Revival in the Park?
faqs.answer: Yes, there will be a designated viewing platform for disabled guests.

faqs.question: Can I bring food & drink into Revival in the Park?
faqs.answer: You are not permitted to bring any food or drinks onto the site, apart from one 500ml sealed bottle of water per person.

faqs.question: Is there a glamping option available at Revival in the Park?
faqs.answer:
Yes, you can choose from either glamping or go all out with the luxury glamping option! Enhance your camping experience & stay in one of the festival's brand-new Glamping tents!Less stress! Choose from a 4m, 5m or 6m pre-pitched bell-tent and let them do the hard work for you!With the optional extra of adding bedding, camping essentials & homely touches to your bell tent,all you’ll need to bring is yourself! Each glamping pod will have it’s own extension lead (for mobile phone charging only). Glamping tickets also include free parking for the weekend. Glampers will have access to the same facilities as those within the standard campsite. STANDARD GLAMPINGStandard glamping bell-tents remove the stress of having to erect your tent upon arrival.The spacious bell tents are pre-pitched for you prior to your arrival, so you can move your belongings in and start enjoying the campsite features and the event immediately! Please note, standard glamping tickets do not allow access to the festival site, and each glamper must purchase a weekend ticket, together with their group glamping ticket. INTRODUCTORY GLAMPING OFFERTo celebrate the introduction of glamping to the event, Revival is offering the following pricing to the first 10 standard glamping customers!FOUR PEOPLE: Standard Glamping Ticket (4m): £200.00 + Booking FeeFIVE PEOPLE: Standard Glamping Ticket (5m): £300.00 + Booking FeeSIX PEOPLE: Standard Glamping Ticket (6m): £400.00 + Booking FeeStandard Glamping also includes free weekend parking, saving you £24.00 per vehicle! LUXURY GLAMPINGThe luxury glamping bell-tents are the top-tier glamping option. Let Revival take the stress out of camping and sort everything for you. The spacious bell tents will not only be pre-pitched for you prior to your arrival, they will be fully furnished, so you can enjoy the campsite features and the event immediately! Facilities will include:
  • Air bed for each person
  • Extension lead / mobile phone charging
  • Rug carpet
  • Mirror
  • Fizz on arrival
  • Bedding for each person
  • Camping chairs for each person
  • Towel
  • Light
  • Free parking
 Please email customer@lucuslive.com to let them know which bed orientations you would prefer (single/doubles). Please note luxury glamping tickets do not allow access to the festival site, and each glamper must purchase a weekend ticket, together with their group glamping ticket. FOUR PEOPLE: Luxury Glamping Ticket (4m): £560.00 + Booking FeeFIVE PEOPLE: Luxury Glamping Ticket (5m): £600.00 + Booking FeeSIX PEOPLE: Luxury Glamping Ticket (6m): £640.00 + Booking Fee

faqs.question: Is there disabled parking at Revival in the Park?
faqs.answer: Yes, purchase your parking ticket from our ticket page. Show your blue badge upon arrival to the car park and the marshals will direct you to the disabled parking bays.

faqs.question: Can I bring my pet to Revival in the Park?
faqs.answer: No, please leave your pets safely at home. Registered guide dogs only.

faqs.question: What is not allowed on the campsites at Revival in the Park?
faqs.answer:
The following is prohibited in campsites at Revival:
  • Glass of any kind (this includes food / drink bottles & perfume etc)
  • Alcohol which exceeds the allowed PP amount
  • Aerosols over 250ml
  • Air horns / Megaphones
  • Animals (other than registered hearing / guide dogs)
  • Blow torches
  • Drones
  • Firewood
  • Fireworks
  • Illegal substances (drugs) and legal / herbal highs
  • Nitrous Oxide and any items associated with the taking of
  • Petrol burners

faqs.question: Can I bring a chair of a blanket to Revival in the Park?
faqs.answer: You’re welcome to bring your own seating (folding, camping chairs) and blankets to sit on, however please be aware that these cannot be placed directly in front of the stage because it creates a hazard. You must be behind the barriers, which will be clearly signposted.

faqs.question: Can I bring my BBQ / camping stove?
faqs.answer: This year disposable BBQ’s and camping stoves will be allowed into the camp site, should you wish to cook for yourselves rather than visit the campsite street food vendors. There will be ample fire extinguishers situated throughout the campsite for your safety.

faqs.question: Can I bring my perfume or cosmetics to Revival in the Park?
faqs.answer: Cosmetics are allowed to be brought into the event, however please note that all glass vessels will be confiscated and will not be returned. Please leave all glass cosmetics at home.

faqs.question: Is there a limit on the food / alcohol I can bring with me?
faqs.answer: Camping Ticket Holders can bring the following into the campsite area only.No food or drink can be taken into the main arena from the campsite. 8x cans of beer / cider per person OR 1x bottle of wine per person (for the whole weekend, not per day) FoodSoft drinks

faqs.question: Can I pay via cash or card at Revival in the Park?
faqs.answer: Unfortunately not, you won’t be able to purchase any food or drink at the event without tokens. Please see our other FAQs for information on tokens.

faqs.question: Is there anything else I should know about camping at Revival in the Park?
faqs.answer: You can leave the campsite to go back to your car, or to visit the Sainsbury’s which is approx 10min walk away.You will be searched by security on re-entry each time. No food or drink from the campsite can be taken into the main arena. There are no official pitch sizes, but we ask that campers are considerate to others when considering their tent sizes There will be no power at your pitch, however there will be extension leads within the campsite where you can charge your mobile phone (this is left to charge at your own risk & Revival hold no responsibility for lost or stolen items whilst being charged).

faqs.question: Token information for Revival in the Park
faqs.answer: HOW CAN I PURCHASE TOKENS?You can purchase your tokens on the day with both cash and card at the on-site token booth. WHY IS IT TOKENS ONLY?Despite the possibility of having to queue at the token booth to purchase your tokens when you arrive on-site, once you have them you can be sure that the overall speed of service at both the bar and street food vendors is faster in comparison to accepting cash/card. It can take 2-3 minutes per cash/card transaction when you take into account: card machine input, till input, card verification, which is also subject to atmospheric conditions (thr Wi-Fi is satellite based due to the event site location). A token transaction takes a matter of seconds. This speeds up service at the bar and ensures you are never waiting long for your food and drink throughout the entirety of the event. HOW MANY TOKENS SHOULD I BUY?As you can purchase tokens in denominations of £5, and excess tokens are non-refundable, we would encourage you to only purchase what you need,  and return to the token booth later in the day should you need more tokens. CAN I BUY TOKENS IN ADVANCE?Unfortunately you can only buy tokens on site on the day of the event.

faqs.question: What drink prices can I expect at Revival in the Park?
faqs.answer:
• Beer / Cider (Pint) - 6/7 Tokens
  • Spirit + Mixer (Single) - 6/7 Tokens
  • Spirit + Mixer (Double) - 10/11 Tokens
  • Wine / Prosecco - 8/9 Tokens
  • Soft Drinks - 3/4 Tokens
 Please note, all food vendors are independent and therefore charge their own prices.

faqs.question: When is Kubix Festival - Pop & Dance?
faqs.answer: Kubix Festival - Pop & Dance takes place on Saturday 15th July 2023.

faqs.question: Tickets availability and info
faqs.answer: Tickets are emailed electronically to you immediately after your purchase, so please enter your email address accurately. Tickets for Kubix Festival 2023 will be released in tiers containing a pre-determined allocation of tickets.  Early Birds are the first, with the cheapest price, followed by First Release and then Second Relase. When each release sells out, the following release becomes available at a new higher price so the sooner you buy, the more you save.  There will be announcements on the website and social media before each release is due to sell out. We can guarantee that the initial Early Bird price launched first are THE cheapest tickets available at any time for 2023's Kubix Festival. We expect Kubix Festival 2023 to sell-out in advance, as it did in 2022.

faqs.question: Where do the shuttle buses for Kubix Festival - Pop & Dance run from?
faqs.answer:
All bus ticket options can be found in the tickets section, and each ticket reserves a set for return bus travel to and from the festival. Buses will depart at a set pick-up time and return from the festival at 11pm, after all the music has finished. Buses will return to the same pick-up / drop-off point. Exact times and addresses are below:Saturday 15th July 2023
  • 10.50 Middlesbrough, Bus Stop outside Domino's Pizza, Linthorpe Road, TS1 3RB & 11.30 Hartlepool, The National Museum Royal Navy Hartlepool, Jackson Dock, Maritime Avenue, Hartlepool, TS24 0XZ - Coach Park
  • 11.40 Newcastle, Bewick Street & 12.00 Gateshead, Bus Stop at bottom of Jackson Street (High Street end) outside The Metropole
  • 12.00 Durham, Sutton Street bus stop opposite Domino’s
  • 12.00 Sunderland, Cowan Terrace (adjacent to Park Lane Interchange)
  • 11.15 Darlington, Outside Dolphin Centre
For further details and maps, please visit https://www.kubixfestival.com/event-info/

faqs.question: Does Kubix Festival - Pop & Dance have onsite camping?
faqs.answer:
YES! Kubix Festival's pop and dance day on Saturday 15th July 2023 will have camping right next door to the music arena, for tents, motorhomes and caravans. The vehicle parking will be next door, so there'll be no long walks with your camping gear or to the music arena. Camping tickets are in addition to the music entry tickets and are for tent camping, per person. If you are camping in a caravan, motorhome or camper van, you will also require a Live-In Vehicle Permit (one permit per vehicle). Campsite times and dates are for: The camp site will open from 9am on Saturday 15th July, until 2pm on Sunday 16th July 2023. There will be 4 main camping sections which will all be very close together and next door to the music arena, so no long walks:
  • Tents
  • Motorhomes and caravans
  • Car parking for campers with tents
  • Disabled camping section, located at the closest point of the camp site, to the music arena.

faqs.question: Accessibility information
faqs.answer: It is very important to the organisers that the event is accessible to everyone, and all aspects are being reviewed to make further improvements in 2023. This includes the availability of accessible disabled parking, toilets, including disabled toilets which will be separately located in a secure stewarded area, and designing the site so that it utilises hard standing routes to make the event as accessible as possible for wheelchair users. There will also be a dedicated viewing area for wheelchair users to view the event, though it does have a capacity and will be first come first served to wheelchair users and one companion. Any person with additional needs who requires a free ticket for a carer or assistant, can email Kubix Festival at info@kubixfestival.co.uk with the ticket order reference number and copy proof of PIP. The free Disabled Facilities Access Permit is for those who require accessible facilities or additional support to accommodate disabilities only, and can be accessed by booking the free Disabled Facilities Access Permit, in addition to all normal purchased tickets (per person). Kindly note the Disabled Permit is NOT an entry ticket and is additional to the entry tickets per person. If you have any other specific requirements, please contact info@kubixfestival.co.uk for more details.

faqs.question: Where is Kubix Festival - Pop & Dance?
faqs.answer: Kubix Festival - Pop & Dance is located at Herrington Country Park in Sunderland, Tyne & Wear, DH4 7EL.

faqs.question: What happens if I bought a ticket and cannot attend?
faqs.answer: Unfortunately we can’t issue you with a refund if you can’t make the event due to work commitments or your mates have dropped out. In these circumstances, we advise passing on your tickets privately to avoid losing out on the money spent. Refunds can only be offered if the event is cancelled or postponed, as agreed upon purchase.

faqs.question: What facilities are there on the camp site?
faqs.answer:
The camp site facilities will include:
  • 24/7 security
  • Toilets, showers and drinking water supplies
  • ELSAN waste disposal point

faqs.question: Directions travelling on the A1 from the North
faqs.answer: Travelling southbound on the A1, take the turnoff for the A1231 (Washington, Sunderland). At the 1st roundabout, take the 3rd Exit (A1231, Washington, Sunderland).  At the next Roundabout, take the 3rd Exit (A182). At the next Roundabout take the 1st Exit to continue on the A182.  At the next Roundabout, take the 2nd Exit onto the A183 (Sunderland). Continue on this road until you reach Herrington Country Park.

faqs.question: Is Kubix Festival - Pop & Dance safe and family friendly?
faqs.answer: Certainly! Kubix Festival - Pop & Dance is a family friendly event and children of all ages are welcome!  Junior tickets allow access, at a reduced price, for children aged 15 and under. Under 18s are welcome, provided they are accompanied by a responsible ticket-holding Adult over the age of 21.  Children 5 and under are free and do not require a ticket. Kubix Festival - Pop & Dance's Security Provider are specialists in Live Music Events and supports its provider in ensuring that their zero-tolerance approach to anti-social or disruptive behaviour maintains a calm and enjoyable atmosphere for everyone. Also available on-site are a team of professional medical staff to assist with any problems. The festival also have comprehensive safeguarding policies including a professional approach to dealing with lost children to ensure that all possible steps are taken to keep everyone as safe as possible.

faqs.question: What does a VIP Ticket include?
faqs.answer:
Kubix Festival's 2023 VIP option is being arranged by a new bespoke team of independent hospitality experts, to ensure the very best VIP experience possible, with a host of further changes and improvements implemented, to make the VIP experience the very best it can be. For 2023 there will be: 
  • A top-quality BBQ, offering a range of meat, vegetarian and vegan options, accompanied by a variety of accompaniments and salads plus a range of sweet choices.
  • Posh toilets for exclusive use of VIP only.
  • Separate parking and a fast track separate entrance.
  • Dressed marquee, heated, with table seating and soft furnishings.
  • Dedicated cocktail bar with trained mixologists and premium drinks (ice buckets, etc.).
  • Welcome drink of your choice included on arrival.
  • Various special drink packages available to buy on the day. Details of these will be posted here at least 2 months before the event.
  • Guest DJ in the VIP marquee.
  • Beer garden seating area (expanded in size from 2021’s) with excellent stage views.
This VIP experience will be for very limited numbers only on each day and a VIP ticket can be purchased including the standard entry ticket, or as a VIP upgrade, if you have already bought a standard ticket. If you have any queries about VIP just email info@kubixfestival.com

faqs.question: Can I park my car next to my tent?
faqs.answer: For safety reasons, to avoid the risk of vehicles driving between tents, the cars will be parked in a separate car park next door to the tents area.

faqs.question: Directions travelling on the A1 from the South
faqs.answer: Travelling northbound on the A1, take the turnoff for the A690 (Sunderland). Continue on the A690 until you reach the A19.  At the Roundabout take the 1st exit onto the A19. Take the next exit signposted A183 (Sunderland). Take the 1st Exit at the Roundabout and follow the road until you reach Herrington Country Park.

faqs.question: What Food & Drink and other items can I bring into the festival?
faqs.answer: Each attendee can bring a small bottle of water or soft drink up to 500ml, if it remains sealed, as bought.  Free drinking water will be available at points throughout the festival, so you can bring an empty reusable plastic or aluminium bottle to the event for water refills. Alcohol cannot be brought into the event. Any person with specific dietary requirements can inform the festival organisers in advance and, where suitable options aren’t available on site, they will give dispensation to bring suitable food to the event. Please email INFO@KUBIXFESTIVAL.CO.UK if you have specific dietary requirements.  Personal picnics are also permitted into the event, upon arrival, but no metal/glass utensils, glass bottles (including perfume bottles), or cool boxes, for safety and security reasons can be brought into the event. Further take away food cannot be brought in during the event.  There will be a wide choice of caterers who will be very reasonably priced. Please note, to allow time for security bag searches, a 'no big bags policy' will be in operation, so no large rucksacks or bags are permitted. Only small rucksacks/bags with length/width dimensions no larger than a piece of A4 paper can be brought into the music arena.

faqs.question: Can I use a ticket from last year's event that I didn't use?
faqs.answer: Unused Tickets from the 2022 festival cannot be used for the 2023 event.

faqs.question: What is the difference between the Live-In Vehicle Camping and Tent Camping Add-Ons?
faqs.answer: The Camping Add-On tickets are PER PERSON wishing to camp, and allow TENTS CAMPING (plus car parking) on Saturday. They must be purchased in addition to a standard music entry ticket, per person. If you wish to camp in a motorhome, caravan or camper van, you will also need a LIVE-IN VEHICLE PERMIT (one permit per live-in vehicle).

faqs.question: Directions travelling on the A19 from the North
faqs.answer: Travelling on the A19, take the turnoff signposted A183 (Sunderland). At the roundabout, take the 3rd Exit onto the A183 (Herrington) and follow the road until you reach Herrington Country Park.

faqs.question: Do children need tickets?
faqs.answer:
• Children aged 6-15 qualify for a ticket at a reduced price.
  • Children ages 5 and under are free and do not require a ticket.
  • Under 18s must be accompanied by a responsible ticket-holding adult aged 21+.

faqs.question: Is there a quiet family camping area?
faqs.answer: There will be a quiet family area of the camp site located further away from the music arena. This section does not have to be pre-booked and you can choose to pitch up in this area when you arrive. The stewards will direct you to this area.

faqs.question: Directions travelling on the A19 from the South
faqs.answer: Travelling on the A19, take the turnoff signposted A183 (Sunderland). At the roundabout, take the 1st Exit onto the A183 (Herrington) and follow the road until you reach Herrington Country Park.

faqs.question: Can we leave and come back in?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can.  Once you have entered the event, you can leave any time you wish and re-enter (further picnics cannot be brought in on re-entry) by showing your wristband, which you will be given. There will, however, be a last entry time to the event of 8pm, after which time you will not be able to re-enter the event.  This is to ensure that as much attention as possible to paid to the running of the event at its busiest times and the site can be made ready for the exit of all of the attendees in a safe manner.

faqs.question: Can I pitch up next to my friends?
faqs.answer: The camp sites are filled sequentially on arrival, so if you'd like to pitch up next to friends, please arrive together. Tents and accompanying vehicles, for safety reasons, are in separate areas of each camp site to motorhomes and caravans. Campers are able to socialise with friends in any other areas of the camp site.

faqs.question: Where can I park?
faqs.answer: There is a large car park within Herrington Country Park which will be manned by our stewards. There is NO CHARGE for this car parking at Kubix Festival. If you have a VIP ticket, you will have access to a further car park right at the door of the event, included in the price of your VIP ticket.

faqs.question: Can we bring folding chairs, blankets, etc in?
faqs.answer: There is a small amount of seating and tables around the bar area. If you would like to bring your own folding chairs or blankets, please feel free.  There will, however, be an area immediately in front of the stage which will be marked as standing only and no chairs/blankets will be permitted in that area for safety reasons. Kubix is an open-air 'music in the park' style event with great views from all areas of the park and video screens for enhanced viewing enjoyment.

faqs.question: What Food & Drink can I bring into the camp site?
faqs.answer: Campers can bring personal food and drink onto the site for consumption by campers, in the camp site only. Free drinking water will be provided so you can bring in an empty reusable plastic or aluminium bottle for refills. NO GLASS or metal utensils are allowed anywhere on site due to Health & Safety restrictions.

faqs.question: Are dogs allowed into the event?
faqs.answer: Unfortunately, for safety reasons, dogs are not allowed, except for guide or assistance dogs, who will be permitted.

faqs.question: What are the rules on BBQs/Fires/Stoves?
faqs.answer:
• Open fires are permitted only in fireproof containers clearly raised from the ground (fire pits etc) and should only be used when supervised by persons sober and sensible.
  • BBQs are permitted only when clearly raised from the ground (fire pits etc) and should only be used when supervised by persons sober and sensible.
  • Camping Stoves are permitted, you are encouraged to use either solid or liquid fuelled options which are not only much safer but more environmentally friendly too.
  • If you use a gas canister supplied stove (butane etc) please ensure that you bring only the minimum amount of gas required for your stay and both always use and store these items appropriately.
  • All fires / stoves must always be used an appropriate distance from any tents.  At least 1m is essential and over 2m for any form of open fire or BBQ.
  • Security will prevent any improper use of fires, BBQs or stoves and person who fail to follow these basic safety steps risk their items being seized and/or being ejected from the Festival.
Please enjoy, but do so sensibly and safely, thank you.

faqs.question: Are there any rides and attractions?
faqs.answer: Kubix Festival aims to be much more than just the live music and there will be various other activities within the event, including fairground rides, lots of new children's entertainment, novelty attractions and a variety of traders exhibiting items for sale along the theme of the event.

faqs.question: Which camp site will my tickets be for?
faqs.answer:
Camping pitches will be filled sequentially on arrival, so you will be directed to the correct camp site for your camping pitch, by stewards, as you arrive. There will be dedicated sections for:
  • Tents
  • Car Parking
  • Motorhomes/caravans/live-in vehicles
  • Disabled camping section, located at the closest point in the camp site to the music arena.

faqs.question: Is there a cash withdrawal facility in the event?
faqs.answer: Confirmation on this will be made at a later date. All the bars will accept credit and debit cards, including contactless in 2023.

faqs.question: Is there a Disabled camp site?
faqs.answer: There will be a Disabled Camping Section close to the music arena for ease of access, clearly signposted on the weekend, and this does not need to be pre-booked in advance.

faqs.question: When is Colour Clash?
faqs.answer: Colour Clash returns to Tredegar Park, Newport on Saturday 15th July 2023.

faqs.question: Does Colour Clash have onsite camping?
faqs.answer: No, as Colour Clash is a single-day event, camping isn't an option. Alternatively, there are accommodation options close by in the City of Newport. Furthermore, Cardiff is a little bit further out which also has lots of accommodation in the form of hotels too.

faqs.question: What happens if I bought a ticket and cannot attend?
faqs.answer: Unfortunately we can’t issue you with a refund if you can’t make the event due to work commitments or your mates have dropped out. In these circumstances, we advise passing on your tickets privately to avoid losing out on the money spent. Refunds can only be offered if the event is cancelled or postponed, as agreed upon purchase.

faqs.question: Where is Colour Clash?
faqs.answer: Colour Clash is located in Tredegar Park, which is situated off Cardiff Road, close to the Junction 28 exit of the M4 motorway. The postcode is NP10 8TW.

faqs.question: Does Colour Clash have any age restrictions?
faqs.answer: Yes, attendees of Colour Clash must be 18 or over. You may be asked to provide valid photo ID.

title: Lets Rock Shrewsbury - The Retro Festival

faqs.question: When is Lets Rock Shrewsbury 2023?
faqs.answer: Lets Rock Shrewsbury takes place on Saturday 15th July 2023.

faqs.question: What's included in a Lets Rock Shrewsbury VIP ticket?
faqs.answer: 2023 will see the ever popular and totally cool, funky 80s themed CLUB TROPICANA VIP enclosure. As well as entry to the event, VIP tickets include fast track entry, luxury loos, meal and welcome drink, PLUS exclusive DJ sets. Sit back and relax in this exclusive area with comfy seating and chairs and a full bar serving quality brands and 80’s cocktails, plus of course the all-important VIP luxury loos – essential at any festival! Fancy dress is recommended, but not compulsory! For any group or company bookings (10 or more) please email uklcs@uk-live.co.uk

faqs.question: How do I apply for a personal assistant ticket?
faqs.answer: Disabled ticket holders are offered, subject to availability, a free ticket for a personal assistant. This offer is open to those who hold a current higher rate of DLA or other UK government approved supporting evidence of their requirement for a personal assistant. Carer tickets can only be issued against general entry tickets. IMPORTANT: This offer is only available to those people that would be unable to attend the festival without a full time assistant. Every application is looked at on an individual basis and if anyone is found to be making a fraudulent application, the festival reserve the right to cancel both the original ticket and personal assistant ticket, before and during the event. To apply for a personal assistant ticket, please follow the procedure below:– Buy a standard general admission ticket (must be online)– Email proof of purchase (the email from Gigantic) AND a copy of your letter of award for DLA (or equivalent) Please send your email to uklcs@uk-live.co.uk . Please ensure that any attachments do not exceed a file size of 1MB, and that you include your full postal address in your email. PERSONAL ASSISTANT TICKETS WILL BE EMAILED ONE WEEK BEFORE THE EVENT

faqs.question: Does Lets Rock Shrewsbury have onsite camping?
faqs.answer: No, Let's Rock Shrewsbury is a non-camping festival so camping equipment is not needed.

faqs.question: Where is Lets Rock Shrewsbury?
faqs.answer: Lets Rock Shrewsbury will be held at The Quarry, Shrewsbury.

faqs.question: What time does the event start/finish?
faqs.answer: The gates open at 11.00am and we recommend that you get there early, so that you don’t miss any of the action! The Festival starts at midday and finishes at 10:30pm.

faqs.question: Does Lets Rock Shrewsbury have any age restrictions?
faqs.answer: No, Lets Rock Scotland is a family-friendly festival.

faqs.question: Will I be able to come and go during the day?
faqs.answer: This is a no re-entry event. Re-entry to the Festival is not permitted, with the sole exception of parents/guardians accompanying children under the age of 16. Single use re-entry wristbands will only be issued on-site at the Festival to parents/guardians who are in possession of a Child Ticket and this pass allows for re-entry to the festival with or without your child. Adults not accompanying children to the Festival will not be allowed re-entry. Single use re-entry wristbands will also be available for disabled guests.

faqs.question: When is Electric Castle 2023?
faqs.answer: Electric Castle takes place Wednesday 19th July - Sunday 23rd July 2023.

faqs.question: Where is Electric Castle?
faqs.answer: Electric Castle is located at the Transylvanian domain of Bánffy Castle, near Cluj-Napoca in Romania.

faqs.question: How do I get to Suncebeat Festival?
faqs.answer:
Getting there by Car - Car hire in Tisno is not necessary as the festival site is just a short walk from the town. But if you do want to explore more of the country then we can recommend Budget Car Rental and Uni Rent.

 

Getting There By Air - Tisno is a small Dalmatian town on the island of Murter, situated half on the island, half on the mainland, and linked with 20m bascule-bridge. It is located 45km south of Zadar airport and 65km north of Split airport so is ideally situated for those of you flying in. We’ll be listing the available flight options from across Europe as soon as they are released by the airline companies.

 

Airport Transfers

Our friends at Shuttle Tours offer discount coach transfers for from most Croatian airports to the festival site. Visit their website here to check latest prices and availability.

faqs.question: Does Suncebeat have onsite camping?
faqs.answer: Onsite accommodation options are available as a separate booking through the Suncebeat website including bell tents, mobile homes and apartments.

faqs.question: disabled access information
faqs.answer: for information on disabled access at Suncebeat Festival please contact damo@tandempr.co.uk

faqs.question: When is Suncebeat 2023?
faqs.answer: TBA

faqs.question: How much are Suncebeat tickets?
faqs.answer: Tickets for Suncebeat start at £141.

faqs.question: Where is Suncebeat?
faqs.answer: Suncebeat takes place at The Garden Tisno in Croatia.

faqs.question: Are pre-payment plan tickets available?
faqs.answer: Payment Plan tickets are not currently available through Skiddle however there are options for group bookings.

faqs.question: What happens If I bought a ticket and cannot attend?
faqs.answer:
Unfortunately, we can’t issue you with a refund if you can’t make the event due to work commitments or your mates have dropped out. In these

circumstances, we advise passing on your tickets privately to avoid losing out on the money spent.

 

Refunds can only be offered if the event is cancelled or postponed, as agreed upon purchase.

faqs.question: Can I bring my own food and drink into Suncebeat?
faqs.answer: You are not allowed to bring your own food and drink into Suncebeat.

faqs.question: Does Suncebeat have any age restrictions?
faqs.answer: SunceBeat is a child-friendly event we love having the kids at the party all children under 16 go free of charge.

faqs.question: When is Latitude Festival 2023?
faqs.answer: Latitude Festival takes place Thursday 20th July - Sunday 23rd July 2023.

faqs.question: How to get to Latitude Festival
faqs.answer:
Coach

Big Green Coach are once again the OFFICIAL and EXCLUSIVE coach travel provider to cinch presents Latitude. Take the hassle out of planning your journey and get yourselves dropped inside the festival gates –no one gets you closer.

WEEKEND CAMPERS –Picking up from 18 locations across the UK. Services arrive on Thursday (with the option to arrive on Friday from London) and take you home on Monday morning (still covered in last night’s glitter!).

Pick up locations for weekend campers: Basingstoke, Birmingham, Brighton, Bristol, Cambridge, Chelmsford, Colchester, Coventry, Ipswich, Leeds, London (Victoria), Manchester, Norwich, Nottingham, Portsmouth, Reading, Sheffield and Southampton.

DAY TICKETS –If you don’t fancy camping but are coming in to see your favourite act for the day; there are day return coaches on Friday, Saturday & Sunday. You’ll arrive before the action starts and they will get you back to your own bed at theend of the night. Party hard and sleep all the way back!

Pick up locations for day ticket holders: Colchester, Ipswich, London (Victoria) and Norwich.

Return journeys from just £37 return –book now before prices go up!

Deposit scheme available. Secure your seat now for the lowest possible price and clear balance later in 2022. 

Car

Please do not use a Sat Nav system to get to the festival as there are different routes into the site depending on which direction you are approaching from and whether you are being dropped off, a family ticket holder, a weekend camper, bringing a campervan, a day ticket holder or a guest. Instead, please refer to the temporary festival road signage on your way to the festival site.

Parking

Weekend and day car parking is separate to the campsites in adjacent or nearby fields. Car parking is included in the price of your ticket. No sleeping, camping or fires are allowed in the car parks.

Tow-away vehicles will remove any illegally parked cars. There will be a local recovery service based onsite on Monday morning. Suffolk Police will be enforcing the speed limits approaching the site, please comply with them!

Drop off/Pick up

There is a drop off and pick up point at yellow gate.

Distances from local villages

Blyford – 6 mins, 3 miles

Blythburgh – 1.8 miles, 4 mins

Frostenden – 3.7 miles, 7 mins

Halesworth – 6.1 miles, 13 mins

Lowestoft – 13.8 miles, 26 mins

Reydon – 3.9 miles, 8 mins

Southwold – 11 mins, 5 miles

Uggeshall – 3.1 miles, 8 mins

Walberswick – 5.2 miles, 12 mins

Wangford – 1.9 miles, 4 mins 

Train

The most convenient station to arrive into is Diss if attending on Thurs/Fri/Sat/Sun.Please visit abelliogreateranglia.co.uk for more train information.

faqs.question: campsite opening times
faqs.answer:
The campsite opens at 8:00am on Thursday 21st July 2022 and closes at 13.00 on Monday 25th July 2022. The campsite is staffed 24 hours a day and you can arrive at any time during this period. 

Campervan and caravan fields (General and Family) will be open from 2pm on Wednesday 20th July. Please note this will be access to the campervan and caravan fields ONLY – the rest of the site including the Village will not be accessible until Thursday.

faqs.question: Accessibility information
faqs.answer:
Latitude aims to create an event that’s truly accessible for all, which is why – for the past 15 years – Festival Republic (who own and operate Latitude Festival) have been working in close partnership with Attitude is Everything to achieve this goal.

A charity set up to help improve deaf and disabled people’s access to live music, as well as to support the music industry in making live music events more accessible, Attitude is Everything started life as a pilot project in 2000, growing into a fully independent charity which is now part of the Arts Council England’s National Portfolio of organisations. 

Latitude has a dedicated Access Team working all year round to constantly improve the experience for access customers. The team can be found at the festival itself, working alongside Attitude is Everything volunteers who run the information tent within the Access Campsite

faqs.question: Latitude Festival ticket information
faqs.answer: For information on tickets head over to https://www.latitudefestival.com/tickets/

faqs.question: Where is Latitude Festival?
faqs.answer: Latitude Festival is located at Henham Park in Beccles.

faqs.question: weekend campsites
faqs.answer:
All Weekend Tickets include camping onsite. There are a number of colour-coded campsites around the site. There is plenty of space in the campsites for the capacity attending and so you should be able to find a space which is comfortable for you.

On arrival at the campsites, please ask the gate staff if you would like to camp in less-crowded area. If a campsite zone is full, they will direct you to an alternative campsite.

Once camped, take a note of a nearby fixed point or mark your site with a flag so that you can find your way back. Say hello to your neighbours so you can watch out for each other throughout the festival.

You cannot drive into the campsites at any time due to fire regulations. 

Zone Managers will be working 24 hours in each zone. Their bases are by each area’s fire tower. There are also teams of security and Campsite Assistance Teams (CATs) in each zone who are there if you need any help.

faqs.question: family campsite
faqs.answer:
The Family Campsite is our dedicated area for families with children 16 or under at the festival to camp out. The site features dedicated toilets, showers, washing up facilities and food traders.

The campsite is situated right next to the family activity areas and has its own arena entrance, meaning you can get into the festival in a hop, skip and a jump.

To stay in the Family Campsite, you will need to purchase the Family Camping version of your tickets. Please be sure to choose the correct option when purchasing.

Those with the Family Camping version will have access to our Family Car Park, located close to the Family Campsite to minimise your journey from car to tent.

No single or groups of adults will be permitted in the Family Campsite unless accompanied by children 16 or under. Due to limited space, the Family Campsite area is restricted to relatives and guardians of children. 

Groups of friends and other family members who arrive without children should camp in the regular campsites.

faqs.question: day campsite
faqs.answer:
We appreciate that sometimes getting home at the end of your day at a festival is not always easy, especially from our lovely site in Suffolk. Day ticket holders may therefore choose to stay overnight and travel the following morning.

For anyone wishing to camp in the Day Campsite, there will be a charge of £5.00 per person, payable on the day only. Basic facilities (toilets and drinking water) will be made available. 

To access the Day Campsite you must also be in possession of a Day Ticket for the event. Access will be from 10:00hrs on the chosen day and you must vacate the event site by no later than 09:00hrs the following day.

faqs.question: Campervan, Caravan & Motorhome Passes
faqs.answer:
You need a campervan, caravan or motorhome pass for each vehicle, and each occupant, including the driver, must also have a Weekend Ticket. You must buy a campervan, caravan or motorpass for your vehicle when tickets go on sale. 

If you have a campervan, caravan or motorhome pass, you can arrive on site from 2pm on Wednesday 20th July. Please note: there will be no access to the festival village, arena, or food traders until Thursday afternoon. Basic toilet facilities and water points will still be available.

faqs.question: When is bluedot 2023?
faqs.answer: bluedot returns to Jodrell Bank Observatory from Thursday 20th July to Sunday 23rd July 2023.

faqs.question: How much are bluedot tickets?
faqs.answer: Adult weekend camping tickets start from £158, with 11-15 years starting from £87 and 6-10 years at £27.50. Children under 5 go free.

faqs.question: How do I get to bluedot?
faqs.answer:
By Car - The festival site is approximately 30 minutes from Manchester City Centre and 50 minutes from Liverpool city Centre.
