By Coach - Tuned In Travel is the partner travel company, supplying coaches from Manchester, Sheffield, Stockport, Chester, London – Friday Only, Chorlton, Fallowfield – Friday Only, Liverpool, Macclesfield and Warrington. 

 

By Rail - We recommend travelling to Macclesfield train station, from Manchester the journey will take 20 minutes and London 1 hour and 45 minutes.

faqs.question: Accessibility information
faqs.answer:
bluedot Festival are proud to have been awarded the Silver level of Attitude is Everything’s Charter of Best Practice, demonstrating their commitment to improving the live music experience for their deaf and disabled customers.If you would like more information on the access facilities at the event please email access@discoverthebluedot.com. The festival will respond to all enquiries within 5 working days.If you need to send anything by post, please send it to this address:Bluedot Access Team
Office 102
19 Lever Street
Manchester
M1 1ANBluedot is a four-day festival set in the beautiful Cheshire countryside. The festival work closely with Attitude is Everything to provide an event site, which is accessible.Please note: The accessibility facilities are reserved to festival goers with disabilities so unfortunately broken legs, recent injuries, recent operations, elderly and pregnant women do not qualify.

faqs.question: Does bluedot have onsite camping?
faqs.answer:
Yes, bluedot has on-site camping. There are varied options of camping available to suit all needs.

bluedot is made up of six campsites consisting of:

  • Standard Camping

  • Family Camping (a family-only area located within the standard campsite)

  • Tangerine Fields (pre-pitched dome tents located with the standard campsite)

  • Live-In Vehicles

  • Accessible Camping

  • The Colony – Boutique Camping

Camping is only available with a weekend ticket and standard campsites are included in the price of your ticket. For all campsites excluding pre-bookings (boutique, Tangerine Fields and live in vehicles) spaces are on a first come first served basis.

faqs.question: Where is bluedot?
faqs.answer: Bluedot is located in Cheshire as part of Manchester University, The Jodrell Bank Observatory. The postcode to take you directly to the site is SK11 9DW.

faqs.question: What happens If I bought a ticket to bluedot and cannot attend?
faqs.answer:
Unfortunately, we can’t issue you with a refund if you can’t make the event due to work commitments or your mates have dropped out. In these circumstances, we advise passing on your tickets privately to avoid losing out on the money spent.

 

Refunds can only be offered if the event is cancelled or postponed, as agreed upon purchase.

faqs.question: Does bluedot have any age restrictions?
faqs.answer: Bluedot Festival is suitable for all ages with plenty of science and art activities for the family to enjoy. You may be asked to show photo ID.

faqs.question: How do I access my bludot tickets?
faqs.answer: Depending on your delivery method (RaidScan or Posted) you can view your order at any time in your order history or the 'my tickets' section of the Skiddle app. From here you will be able to check the status of your delivery or access your RapidScan tickets.

faqs.question: Can I bring my own food and drink into bluedot?
faqs.answer: You are allowed to bring food and drink to the campsite however you are not allowed to bring your own food and drink into the festival site. There will be a wide variety of food and drink stalls inside the festival, serving up organic, vegetarian and vegan options.

faqs.question: What are the set times at bluedot?
faqs.answer: The set times are generally released on the first day of the festival.

faqs.question: When is Craic by the Creek 2023?
faqs.answer: Craic by the Creek takes place over three days from Friday the 21st of July to Sunday the 23rd of July 2023.

faqs.question: What happens if I bought a ticket and cannot attend?
faqs.answer: Unfortunately we can’t issue you with a refund if you can’t make the event due to work commitments or your mates have dropped out. In these circumstances, we advise passing on your tickets privately to avoid losing out on the money spent. Refunds can only be offered if the event is cancelled or postponed, as agreed upon purchase.

faqs.question: Can I park at Craic by the Creek?
faqs.answer: Yes, the post code for the car park is SK6 5HH and will code £20 per car for the whole weekend. Please note this is a cash only car park. The car park is a 15 minute walk through Etherow Country Park to the festival site, which is the quickest route. There is also a shuttle bus in operation throughout the weekend although the drive can get congested so you may need to wait.

faqs.question: What is 'Pitch Up Thursday'?
faqs.answer: Cars are not allowed on the lane up to the festival site or on Whitebottom Farm itself on the festival weekend. Unfortunately, this is a security issue. However, campers and Motorhome festival goers have the option of driving onto the festival site on the Thursday to pitch up their tent with all of their camping gear. 'Pitch Up Thursday' will take place between the hours of 5pm and 8pm. Any belongings left on the festival site at this time are left at the risk of the owner. If you would like to put your name down for this service, please fill out the form at https://craicbythecreek.co.uk/pitch-up-thursday. Please be aware, cars must NOT be left on site and must be removed by 8pm. If you are using a car to tow a caravan, you must remove your car as this cannot be left next to your caravan over the festival weekend as per the site rules. There won't be any entertainment on Thursday and no food vendors, but the bar will be open and you can bring your own food. The shower and toilet facilities will of course be open too.

faqs.question: Disabled access information
faqs.answer: A limited number of disabled parking spots are available to those who hold a valid blue badge and valid weekend tickets. Spaces are limited and must be booked in advance at https://craicbythecreek.co.uk/disabled-access.

faqs.question: Where is Craic by the Creek?
faqs.answer: Craic by the Creek is located at Whitebottom farm in Etherow Country Park, Compstall, Stockport SK6 5JQ. Use postcode SK6 5HZ and then follow festival signs to the Festival Car Park on Compstall Road, SK6 5HH/

faqs.question: How do I get to Craic by the Creek using public transport?
faqs.answer: The nearest railway stations are Marple and Romiley. Stockport station is also nearby with buses every 15 minutes.

faqs.question: Can I park my Motorhome / Caravan near friends?
faqs.answer: If you want to park next to your friends at the festival, you will need to turn up at the same time. You will not be able to reserve areas as space is restricted.

faqs.question: Do I need cash or tokens for the food vendors at Craic by the Creek?
faqs.answer: All food vendors and festival market stalls will be cash / card only. They do not use the token system - this is exclusive to the bar.

faqs.question: Is there an electric hook up?
faqs.answer: No, however you can access charger points for phones and the shower facilities include sockets for hairdryers and straighteners.

faqs.question: What time can I access the festival site at Craic by the Creek?
faqs.answer: The Craic by the Creek site will be accessible from midday on the Friday morning. The entertainment won't begin until the evening but campers,  glampers, Motorhomes / Campervans and Caravan ticket holders can arrive and pitch their tents / get settled from 12pm. The festival bar will be open from midday and food vendors will be on site. If you are a general admission ticket holder (and are not camping / glamping etc.) you can still turn up from midday if you wish. The bar will be open for you to get a head start on the masses/

faqs.question: Can I access drinking water?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can access free drinking water, situated in the shower area.

faqs.question: What time does the entertainment start and end at Craic by the Creek?
faqs.answer: Entertainment at Craic by the Creek will begin from 6pm on Friday evening and will end on Sunday at 9pm. The full music schedule by day will be released closer to the festival weekend.

faqs.question: Are glamping options available at Craic by the Creek?
faqs.answer: Yes, please see https://craicbythecreek.co.uk/glamping-2 for further details.

faqs.question: What time do I have to leave Craic by the Creek?
faqs.answer: We kindly ask that all festival goers leave the festival site on Monday. If you're a camper, glamper, or bringing your motorhome, you are welcome to stay on the Sunday night and keep the party going until the early hours. There will be plenty of food and drink to keep you going!

faqs.question: I am staying over at Craic by the Creek, what is allowed and what is not allowed?
faqs.answer:
Allowed:
  • Small camping stove
  • Tent
  • Sleeping bag and extra blankets
  • It gets chilly at night
  • Wellies
  • Torch
  • Water proofs – Fingers crossed they won’t be needed
  • Sun cream
  • Medication – (prescription only)
  • Spare clothes
  • First aid kit
  • Money
  • Soft Drinks
  • Food or Snacks
Not Allowed:
  • No alcohol to be brought onsite – This is strictly in accordance with the rules of our alcohol license
  • No glass allowed
  • No illegal substances or legal highs
  • No fires or BBQs
  • No sound system
  • All children under 14 must be accompanied by an adult
  • Unruly behaviour is not accepted
  • No rucksacks in the barn / stage area - trip hazard
  • No public cars on site

faqs.question: When is Truck Festival 2023?
faqs.answer: Truck Festival is held on Friday 21st July - Sunday 23rd July 2023.

faqs.question: How to get to Truck Festival by Coach
faqs.answer: Truck Festival is working in conjunction with National Express to offer dedicated coaches that can take you and your luggage / camping gear straight to the festival site. You can purchase tickets here: https://truckfestival.seetickets.com/event/truck-festival-2023/hill-farm/2377743?pageofferid=55699754#op3

faqs.question: Is there camping available at Truck Festival?
faqs.answer: Yes, there a several camping options available at Truck Festival so you can make the most of your weekend.

faqs.question: Accessibility at Truck Festival
faqs.answer: Truck Festival is hugely dedicated to making their event as accessible as possible for everyone. They have a PA ticket scheme, accessible viewing areas and dedicated parking and camping areas, accessible facilities and hearing loops. For further info, have a look at the Truck Festival website.

faqs.question: Where is Truck Festival?
faqs.answer: Truck Festival is located at Hill Farm, Oxford.

faqs.question: How to get to Truck Festival by Train
faqs.answer: The nearest railway station to the festival is Didcot Parkway Station. From there you can take a connecting shuttle bus or taxi direct to the festival site. The shuttle bus will be run by Thames Travel and an adult return will cost just £5.

faqs.question: What camping options are available at Truck Festival?
faqs.answer:
There are loads of camping options at Truck Festival including:
  • General camping
  • Family camping
  • Luxury camping
  • Glamping / Boutique camping
  • Pre-pitched 
See the Truck Festival website for more information.
  • Accessible camping
  • Campervan & Caravan

faqs.question: What are the opening times at Truck Festival?
faqs.answer: Thursday 20th JulyGates for Early Entry Ticket holders open at 1pm. Box Office closes at 11pm. Friday 21st JulyGates open at 10am.Box Office closes at 11pm. Saturday 22nd July - Sunday 23rd JulyGates open at 9am.Box Office closes at 11pm. Monday 24th JulyCampsites have to be clear by midday.

faqs.question: Is there parking available at Truck Festival?
faqs.answer: Yes, although there is a charge. It is cheaper to book in advance than on the day. The car park you are assigned will depend on the camping area you have booked, so please check Truck Festival's website for further details on this. The address is: Hill Farm, Church Lane, Steventon, Oxon, OX13 6SW. Signs will be around the area directing you to the site.

faqs.question: Does Truck Festival have any age restrictions?
faqs.answer: There are no age restrictions at Truck Festival, however you may be asked to show valid photo ID (passport, driving/provisional license, citizen card). Photocopies will not be accepted. Weeknd tickets are for those 13 and above. Children aged 12 and under go free but will need an entry ticket added to your booking. Anyone age 16+ is allowed to attend on their own but will be asked for ID on entry. Under 16s must be accompanied by an adult (21+) at all times. All alcohol sales on site will be operating the Challenge 25 policy. If you look under 25, you will need a valid photo ID in order to be served alcohol.

faqs.question: Can I leave Truck Festival and come back?
faqs.answer: Yes, although be aware that you will only be allowed to bring alcohol into the campsites on your first entry. If you are driving each day please keep hold of your parking ticket as proof of purchase.

faqs.question: Can I take alcohol into the arena at Truck Festival?
faqs.answer: No. Only refillable water bottles will be permitted and free water will be available on site and in the campsites.

faqs.question: When is Junction 2?
faqs.answer: Junction 2 returns to Boston Manor Park Friday July 21st and Saturday July 22nd 2023.

faqs.question: What happens If I bought a ticket and cannot attend?
faqs.answer: Unfortunately we can’t issue you with a refund if you can’t make the event due to work commitments or your mates have dropped out. In these circumstances, we advise passing on your tickets privately to avoid losing out on the money spent.Refunds can only be offered if the event is cancelled or postponed, as agreed upon purchase.

faqs.question: How do I get to Junction 2?
faqs.answer: By Car - Public transport is recommended to travel to Junction 2 as there is limited parking. By Rail - Hadley Wood station or Oakleigh Park station are the nearest train stations to Trent Country Park.By Tube - The closest tube station with a 5 minute walk to the festival site is Cockfosters Tube Station.

faqs.question: Where is Junction 2?
faqs.answer: Junction 2 is located in Boston Manor Park in London. Postcode TW8 9JX.

faqs.question: Do I need to print my ticket?
faqs.answer: No, you can access your ticket(s) at any time in your order history or the 'my tickets' section of the Skiddle app.

faqs.question: Does Junction 2 have onsite camping?
faqs.answer: No, Junction 2 is a non-camping festival so camping equipment is not needed, however, there is plenty of alternative accommodation to choose from.

faqs.question: Does Junction 2 have any age restrictions?
faqs.answer: Yes, you must be 18 or over to attend Junction 2 Festival. You may be asked to show photo ID.

faqs.question: Can I bring my own food and drink into Junction 2?
faqs.answer: You are not allowed to bring your own food and drink into Junction 2. There will be a wide variety of food and drink stalls inside the festival, serving up organic, vegetarian and vegan options.

faqs.question: What are the set times?
faqs.answer: The set times are generally released on the first day of the festival.

faqs.question: When is Kubix Festival - Rock & Indie 2023?
faqs.answer: Kubix Festival - Rock & Indie takes place on Saturday 22nd July 2023.

faqs.question: Does Kubix Festival - Rock & Indie have onsite camping?
faqs.answer:
YES! Kubix Festival's rock and indie day on Saturday 22nd July 2023 will have camping right next door to the music arena, for tents, motorhomes and caravans. The vehicle parking will be next door, so there'll be no long walks with your camping gear or to the music arena. Camping tickets are in addition to the music entry tickets and are for tent camping, per person. If you are camping in a caravan, motorhome or camper van, you will also require a Live-In Vehicle Permit (one permit per vehicle). Campsite times and dates are for: The camp site will open from 9am on Saturday 22nd July, until 2pm on Sunday 23rd July 2023. There will be 4 main camping sections which will all be very close together and next door to the music arena, so no long walks:
  • Tents
  • Motorhomes and caravans
  • Car parking for campers with tents
  • Disabled camping section, located at the closest point of the camp site, to the music arena.

faqs.question: Tickets availability and info
faqs.answer: Tickets are emailed electronically to you immediately after your purchase, so please enter your email address accurately. Tickets for Kubix Festival 2023 will be released in tiers containing a pre-determined allocation of tickets.  Early Birds are the first, with the cheapest price, followed by First Release and then Second Relase. When each release sells out, the following release becomes available at a new higher price so the sooner you buy, the more you save.  There will be announcements on the website and social media before each release is due to sell out. We can guarantee that the initial Early Bird price launched first are THE cheapest tickets available at any time for 2023's Kubix Festival. We expect Kubix Festival 2023 to sell-out in advance, as it did in 2022.

faqs.question: Where do the shuttle buses for Kubix Festival - Rock & Indie run from?
faqs.answer:
All bus ticket options can be found in the tickets section, and each ticket reserves a set for return bus travel to and from the festival. Buses will depart at a set pick-up time and return from the festival at 11pm, after all the music has finished. Buses will return to the same pick-up / drop-off point. Exact times and addresses are below:Saturday 22nd July 2023
  • 09.35 Middlesbrough, Bus Stop outside Domino's Pizza, Linthorpe Road, TS1 3RB & 10.15 Hartlepool, The National Museum Royal Navy Hartlepool, Jackson Dock, Maritime Avenue, Hartlepool, TS24 0XZ - Coach Park
  • 10.25 Newcastle, Bewick Street & 10.45 Gateshead, Bus Stop at bottom of Jackson Street (High Street end) outside The Metropole
  • 10.30 Durham, Sutton Street bus stop opposite Domino’s
  • 10.45 Sunderland, Cowan Terrace (adjacent to Park Lane Interchange)
  • 09.45 Darlington, Outside Dolphin Centre
For further details and maps, please visit https://www.kubixfestival.com/event-info/

faqs.question: Accessibility information
faqs.answer: It is very important to the organisers that the event is accessible to everyone, and all aspects are being reviewed to make further improvements in 2023. This includes the availability of accessible disabled parking, toilets, including disabled toilets which will be separately located in a secure stewarded area, and designing the site so that it utilises hard standing routes to make the event as accessible as possible for wheelchair users.

faqs.question: Where is Kubix Festival - Rock & Indie?
faqs.answer: Kubix Festival - Rock & Indie is located at Herrington Country Park in Sunderland, Tyne & Wear, DH4 7EL.

faqs.question: What happens if I bought a ticket and cannot attend?
faqs.answer: Unfortunately we can’t issue you with a refund if you can’t make the event due to work commitments or your mates have dropped out. In these circumstances, we advise passing on your tickets privately to avoid losing out on the money spent. Refunds can only be offered if the event is cancelled or postponed, as agreed upon purchase.

faqs.question: What facilities are there on the camp site?
faqs.answer:
The camp site facilities will include:
  • 24/7 security
  • Toilets, showers and drinking water supplies
  • ELSAN waste disposal point

faqs.question: Directions travelling on the A1 from the North
faqs.answer: Travelling southbound on the A1, take the turnoff for the A1231 (Washington, Sunderland). At the 1st roundabout, take the 3rd Exit (A1231, Washington, Sunderland).  At the next Roundabout, take the 3rd Exit (A182). At the next Roundabout take the 1st Exit to continue on the A182.  At the next Roundabout, take the 2nd Exit onto the A183 (Sunderland). Continue on this road until you reach Herrington Country Park.

faqs.question: Is Kubix Festival - Rock & Indie safe and family friendly?
faqs.answer: Certainly! Kubix Festival - Rock & Indie is a family friendly event and children of all ages are welcome!  Junior tickets allow access, at a reduced price, for children aged 15 and under. Under 18s are welcome, provided they are accompanied by a responsible ticket-holding Adult over the age of 21.  Children 5 and under are free and do not require a ticket. Kubix Festival - Rock & Indie's Security Provider are specialists in Live Music Events and supports its provider in ensuring that their zero-tolerance approach to anti-social or disruptive behaviour maintains a calm and enjoyable atmosphere for everyone. Also available on-site are a team of professional medical staff to assist with any problems. The festival also have comprehensive safeguarding policies including a professional approach to dealing with lost children to ensure that all possible steps are taken to keep everyone as safe as possible.

faqs.question: What does a VIP Ticket include?
faqs.answer:
Kubix Festival's 2023 VIP option is being arranged by a new bespoke team of independent hospitality experts, to ensure the very best VIP experience possible, with a host of further changes and improvements implemented, to make the VIP experience the very best it can be. For 2023 there will be: 
  • A top-quality BBQ, offering a range of meat, vegetarian and vegan options, accompanied by a variety of accompaniments and salads plus a range of sweet choices.
  • Posh toilets for exclusive use of VIP only.
  • Separate parking and a fast track separate entrance.
  • Dressed marquee, heated, with table seating and soft furnishings.
  • Dedicated cocktail bar with trained mixologists and premium drinks (ice buckets, etc.).
  • Welcome drink of your choice included on arrival.
  • Various special drink packages available to buy on the day. Details of these will be posted here at least 2 months before the event.
  • Guest DJ in the VIP marquee.
  • Beer garden seating area (expanded in size from 2021’s) with excellent stage views.
This VIP experience will be for very limited numbers only on each day and a VIP ticket can be purchased including the standard entry ticket, or as a VIP upgrade, if you have already bought a standard ticket. If you have any queries about VIP just email info@kubixfestival.com

faqs.question: Can I park my car next to my tent?
faqs.answer: For safety reasons, to avoid the risk of vehicles driving between tents, the cars will be parked in a separate car park next door to the tents area.

faqs.question: Directions travelling on the A1 from the South
faqs.answer: Travelling northbound on the A1, take the turnoff for the A690 (Sunderland). Continue on the A690 until you reach the A19.  At the Roundabout take the 1st exit onto the A19. Take the next exit signposted A183 (Sunderland). Take the 1st Exit at the Roundabout and follow the road until you reach Herrington Country Park.

faqs.question: What Food & Drink and other items can I bring into the festival?
faqs.answer: Each attendee can bring a small bottle of water or soft drink up to 500ml, if it remains sealed, as bought.  Free drinking water will be available at points throughout the festival, so you can bring an empty reusable plastic or aluminium bottle to the event for water refills. Alcohol cannot be brought into the event. Any person with specific dietary requirements can inform the festival organisers in advance and, where suitable options aren’t available on site, they will give dispensation to bring suitable food to the event. Please email INFO@KUBIXFESTIVAL.CO.UK if you have specific dietary requirements.  Personal picnics are also permitted into the event, upon arrival, but no metal/glass utensils, glass bottles (including perfume bottles), or cool boxes, for safety and security reasons can be brought into the event. Further take away food cannot be brought in during the event.  There will be a wide choice of caterers who will be very reasonably priced. Please note, to allow time for security bag searches, a 'no big bags policy' will be in operation, so no large rucksacks or bags are permitted. Only small rucksacks/bags with length/width dimensions no larger than a piece of A4 paper can be brought into the music arena.

faqs.question: Can I use a ticket from last year's event that I didn't use?
faqs.answer: Unused Tickets from the 2022 festival cannot be used for the 2023 event.

faqs.question: What is the difference between the Live-In Vehicle Camping and Tent Camping Add-Ons?
faqs.answer: The Camping Add-On tickets are PER PERSON wishing to camp, and allow TENTS CAMPING (plus car parking) on Saturday. They must be purchased in addition to a standard music entry ticket, per person. If you wish to camp in a motorhome, caravan or camper van, you will also need a LIVE-IN VEHICLE PERMIT (one permit per live-in vehicle).

faqs.question: Directions travelling on the A19 from the North
faqs.answer: Travelling on the A19, take the turnoff signposted A183 (Sunderland). At the roundabout, take the 3rd Exit onto the A183 (Herrington) and follow the road until you reach Herrington Country Park.

faqs.question: Do children need tickets?
faqs.answer:
• Children aged 6-15 qualify for a ticket at a reduced price.
  • Children ages 5 and under are free and do not require a ticket.
  • Under 18s must be accompanied by a responsible ticket-holding adult aged 21+.

faqs.question: Is there a quiet family camping area?
faqs.answer: There will be a quiet family area of the camp site located further away from the music arena. This section does not have to be pre-booked and you can choose to pitch up in this area when you arrive. The stewards will direct you to this area.

faqs.question: Directions travelling on the A19 from the South
faqs.answer: Travelling on the A19, take the turnoff signposted A183 (Sunderland). At the roundabout, take the 1st Exit onto the A183 (Herrington) and follow the road until you reach Herrington Country Park.

faqs.question: Can we leave and come back in?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can.  Once you have entered the event, you can leave any time you wish and re-enter (further picnics cannot be brought in on re-entry) by showing your wristband, which you will be given. There will, however, be a last entry time to the event of 8pm, after which time you will not be able to re-enter the event.  This is to ensure that as much attention as possible to paid to the running of the event at its busiest times and the site can be made ready for the exit of all of the attendees in a safe manner.

faqs.question: Can I pitch up next to my friends?
faqs.answer: The camp sites are filled sequentially on arrival, so if you'd like to pitch up next to friends, please arrive together. Tents and accompanying vehicles, for safety reasons, are in separate areas of each camp site to motorhomes and caravans. Campers are able to socialise with friends in any other areas of the camp site.

faqs.question: Where can I park?
faqs.answer: There is a large car park within Herrington Country Park which will be manned by our stewards. There is NO CHARGE for this car parking at Kubix Festival. If you have a VIP ticket, you will have access to a further car park right at the door of the event, included in the price of your VIP ticket.

faqs.question: Can we bring folding chairs, blankets, etc in?
faqs.answer: There is a small amount of seating and tables around the bar area. If you would like to bring your own folding chairs or blankets, please feel free.  There will, however, be an area immediately in front of the stage which will be marked as standing only and no chairs/blankets will be permitted in that area for safety reasons. Kubix is an open-air 'music in the park' style event with great views from all areas of the park and video screens for enhanced viewing enjoyment.

faqs.question: What Food & Drink can I bring into the camp site?
faqs.answer: Campers can bring personal food and drink onto the site for consumption by campers, in the camp site only. Free drinking water will be provided so you can bring in an empty reusable plastic or aluminium bottle for refills. NO GLASS or metal utensils are allowed anywhere on site due to Health & Safety restrictions.

faqs.question: Are dogs allowed into the event?
faqs.answer: Unfortunately, for safety reasons, dogs are not allowed, except for guide or assistance dogs, who will be permitted.

faqs.question: What are the rules on BBQs/Fires/Stoves?
faqs.answer:
• Open fires are permitted only in fireproof containers clearly raised from the ground (fire pits etc) and should only be used when supervised by persons sober and sensible.
  • BBQs are permitted only when clearly raised from the ground (fire pits etc) and should only be used when supervised by persons sober and sensible.
  • Camping Stoves are permitted, you are encouraged to use either solid or liquid fuelled options which are not only much safer but more environmentally friendly too.
  • If you use a gas canister supplied stove (butane etc) please ensure that you bring only the minimum amount of gas required for your stay and both always use and store these items appropriately.
  • All fires / stoves must always be used an appropriate distance from any tents.  At least 1m is essential and over 2m for any form of open fire or BBQ.
  • Security will prevent any improper use of fires, BBQs or stoves and person who fail to follow these basic safety steps risk their items being seized and/or being ejected from the Festival.
Please enjoy, but do so sensibly and safely, thank you.

faqs.question: Are there any rides and attractions?
faqs.answer: Kubix Festival aims to be much more than just the live music and there will be various other activities within the event, including fairground rides, lots of new children's entertainment, novelty attractions and a variety of traders exhibiting items for sale along the theme of the event.

faqs.question: Which camp site will my tickets be for?
faqs.answer:
Camping pitches will be filled sequentially on arrival, so you will be directed to the correct camp site for your camping pitch, by stewards, as you arrive. There will be dedicated sections for:
  • Tents
  • Car Parking
  • Motorhomes/caravans/live-in vehicles
  • Disabled camping section, located at the closest point in the camp site to the music arena.

faqs.question: Is there a cash withdrawal facility in the event?
faqs.answer: Confirmation on this will be made at a later date. All the bars will accept credit and debit cards, including contactless in 2023.

faqs.question: Is there a Disabled camp site?
faqs.answer: There will be a Disabled Camping Section close to the music arena for ease of access, clearly signposted on the weekend, and this does not need to be pre-booked in advance.

faqs.question: When is Save The Rave: Outdoor 90s Festival 2023?
faqs.answer: Save The Rave: Outdoor 90s Festival hits Victoria Park in Southport on Saturday 22nd July 2023.

faqs.question: What happens If I bought a ticket and cannot attend?
faqs.answer: Unfortunately we can’t issue you with a refund if you can’t make the event due to work commitments or your mates have dropped out. In these circumstances, we advise passing on your tickets privately to avoid losing out on the money spent.Refunds can only be offered if the event is cancelled or postponed, as agreed upon purchase.

faqs.question: Does Save The Rave: Outdoor 90s Festival have onsite camping?
faqs.answer: No, Save The Rave: Outdoor 90s Festival is a non camping festival so camping equipment is not needed. It is however close to the City Centre so there is plenty of alternative accommodation to choose from.

faqs.question: How do I get to Save the Rave?
faqs.answer: Save the Rave are based in the stunning Victoria Park, Southport. Entrances to the event are off Victoria way, Southport. You can use https://what3words.com/ to locate both the event gates using the following 3 word codes: 1) belt.bake.exam or 2) remedy.limp.stop If you’re arriving by car, there is car parking available on site based at the Eco Center, Esplanade, Southport, Eco Centre post code is PR8 1RX, once you arrive, please follow the event signage to the car parks. The car park is less than a minute away from the event gate. If you’re a blue badge holder, there is a dedicated car parking space situated at the Eco Centre close to the festival for all blue badge holders. On arrival please simply show your badge and they’ll direct you to the parking bays.  If you’re arriving by taxi, drop off/pick up will be located in the car park Eco Centre. Please note Rotten Row Road will be closed for the event duration.

faqs.question: Accessibility information
faqs.answer: The site has disabled access and there is an accessible car park close to the entrance located at the Eco Centre, Esplanade, Southport, Eco Centre postcode is PR8 1RX. There are also disabled toilets situated on site.

faqs.question: Where is Save The Rave: Outdoor 90s Festival?
faqs.answer: Save The Rave: Outdoor 90s Festival takes place at Victoria Park, Rotton Row, Southport, PR8 2BZ. Entrances to the event are off Victoria way, Southport. You can use https://what3words.com/ to locate both the event gates using the following 3 word codes: 1) belt.bake.exam or 2) remedy.limp.stop

faqs.question: How much are Save The Rave: Outdoor 90s Festival tickets?
faqs.answer: Please see the tickets section for more info.

faqs.question: Where is the nearest railway station to Save the Rave?
faqs.answer: Southport Train Station, PR8 1BE.

faqs.question: Does Save the Rave offer free tickets for carers of people with disabilities?
faqs.answer: Yes, if a customer is unable to attend without the supervision of a care provider, Save the Rave would be happy to supply an extra ticket free of charge, however the customer must have purchased at least one standard ticket. It is also a requirement that you provide notice of this to their team in order to arrange a ticket beforehand, so as not to cause any disruptions or delays on the day of the event. Please contact hello@savetherave.co.uk to inform them of the need for an extra ticket and a member of staff will help provide this for you.

faqs.question: Does Save The Rave: Outdoor 90s Festival have any age restrictions?
faqs.answer: You must be 18 or older to attend Save The Rave: Outdoor 90s Festival. You may be asked to provide valid photo ID.

faqs.question: Are pre-payment plan tickets available?
faqs.answer: There are no payment plan tickets currently available.

faqs.question: What time does Save The Rave: Outdoor 90s Festival start and finish?
faqs.answer: The gates will open at 12pm, the first act will be on at 2pm, the event will finish at 10pm. Please note once you’re inside the festival and you decide to leave, there will be no re-admission. Last entry is 4:00pm

faqs.question: Is there seating available at Save the Rave?
faqs.answer: No, this is a standing event, but there will be break areas for you to sit around the festival. Gazebos, camping chairs, tents, and large sunshades are not permitted in the park.

faqs.question: Can I bring in my own food and drink to Save the Rave?
faqs.answer: There will be fully stocked bars and a range of street food vendors on site. Unfortunately, you’re not allowed to bring your own food & drink into the park. Please note the bar and the food vendors will be taking both cash and card payments. These will be adhering to Challenge 25, please bring ID.

faqs.question: What items are prohibited at Save the Rave?
faqs.answer:
Bag and body searching is a condition of entry, anyone found to be in possession of the below items will not be permitted to enter the event:
  • Opened water bottles or drinks bottles; guests will be allowed to bring in an empty reusable water bottle
  • Any bladed article
  • Fireworks or explosives
  • Any illegal drugs or narcotics, including drug paraphernalia and nitrous oxide
  • Alcohol, including alcohol in a sealed bottle
  • Needles or sharp objects, with the exception of medications such as epi-pens or insulin
  • Identity marker spray
  • Offensive weapons, including ‘pepper spray’
  • Glass in any form
  • Flares
  • Poles or flags
  • Air horns
  • Drones
  • Any articles that could cause harm to the public or property

faqs.question: Can I re-enter once I leave Save the Rave?
faqs.answer: Once you’re inside, you can’t go in and out of the site again. No re-admissions will be allowed.

faqs.question: What are the set times for Save the Rave?
faqs.answer: Set times of individual artists are not released in advance. We advise on arriving early to catch all the biggest acts!

faqs.question: Where is Maid of Stone Festival?
faqs.answer: Maid of Stone Festival will be held at Mote Park, Maidstone, Kent.

faqs.question: how to get to Hideout festival croatia?

By Plane

The closest airport to Pag is Zadar, which is an hour transfer to the Hideout site. Split is located 2 hours away from Pag, Zagreb 3 hours, Dubrovnik 5.5 hours, and then Trieste and Venice in Italy are 4.5 hours and 5.5 hours respectively. Any queries regarding transfers or any other travel aspect please feel free to contact info@hideoutfestival.com

The Island of Pag is located on the west coast of Croatia. It can be reached easily from a number of major UK airports arriving in Croatia and surrounding countries such as Italy and Hungary.

The closest airport to the Island of Pag is Zadar, which is an hour transfer to the Hideout site. Split is located 2 hours away from Pag, Zagreb 3 hours, Dubrovnik 5.5 hours, and then Trieste and Venice in Italy are 4.5 hours and 5.5 hours respectively.

faqs.question: Does Hideout festival croatia have onsite camping?

faqs.question: disabled access information

faqs.question: What do I get with a VIP Ticket?

faqs.question: When is Kendal Calling 2023?
faqs.answer: Kendal Calling returns to Lowther Deer Park 2023.

faqs.question: How do I get to Kendal Calling?
faqs.answer:
Location 

 Kendal Calling is held at: 
Lowther Deer Park, Hackthorpe, CA10 2HN By CarThere will be plenty of signs to the festival from all directions.From the South (M6): All ticket holders:?M6 Exit Junction 39?Turn L onto A6 at end of sliproad? Turn right at T Junction to follow A6 North?Keep on A6 through village of Shap?. Then, depending on your ticket type: Standard campsite ticket holders:?Look out for the A6 passing underneath the Motorway?Approx 1 mile after this turn left into the Lowther Estate? Follow driveway to main car parkCampervans, Emperors Fields and The Deer Lodge ticket holders:?For entrance to Emperors Fields, Campervans and The Deer Lodge please follow signs for All Camping.From the North (M6): Standard campsite ticket holders: Continue on M6 to J39 and follow directions from South Campervans, Emperors Fields and The Deer Lodge ticket holders: For entrance to Emperors Fields, Campervans and The Deer Lodge please follow signs for All Camping.The home of Kendal Calling is 25 minutes north of Kendal up the M6 and South down the A6 from Penrith.Manchester – 1 hour 30 mins (48 mins with Virgin Trains from Preston)Newcastle – 1 hour 30 minsLeeds – 2 hoursLiverpool – 2 hours (48 mins with Virgin Trains from Preston) Edinburgh – 2 hours 25 mins (1 hour 21 mins with Virgin Trains) By Shuttle BusKendal Calling is at Lowther Deer Park so just 15 minutes on the dedicated shuttle bus from Penrith Railway Station to the festival.Penrith to The Festival:Thursday 10am – 6:30pm
Friday 7am – 7pmThe Festival to Penrith:Monday 5:30am – 12noon Shuttle Bus tickets are available soon!  By TrainThe nearest train station to the festival site is Penrith which is a ten minute taxi journey from the site. A shuttle bus service will run from the station to the festival site. Virgin Trains operate a lightning fast service from Scotland, Birmingham, and London direct with hourly services and Manchester & North West when changing at Preston or Crewe. By Taxi - Taxi cost approximately £15-18 with many local services to choose from.

faqs.question: Does Kendal Calling have onsite camping?
faqs.answer: Yes there is plenty of on site camping options available.

faqs.question: How much are Kendal Calling tickets?
faqs.answer: Weekend tickets for adults camping start at £144. Adult Thursday additional add on tickets start from £38.50.

faqs.question: Is there disabled access at Kendal Calling?
faqs.answer: Kendal Calling is a 3 to 4 day festival set in the beautiful lake district with over 10 stages featuring regional, national and international talent. The festival works closely with Attitude is Everything to provide an event site which is accessible, and to that end the organisers are pleased to announce that they received the Silver Award in accessibility on site and are the first festival to be awarded the access starts online status.Please note: The accessibility facilities are only available to festival goers with permanent disabilities, so broken legs, recent injuries, recent operations, elderly and pregnant women do not qualify.CONTACT DETAILS FOR ALL ACCESS ENQUIRIES:If you would like more information on the access facilities at the event or to get in touch with the festival, please email access@kendalcalling.com or write to them at: Kendal Calling Access, Office 102, 19 Lever Street, Manchester, M1 1AN. Kendal Calling aim to respond to all enquiries within 2-3 days. ACCESS AROUND THE SITE:The festival is held at the Lowther Deer Park, Cumbria. The land is ancient woodland and farmland with grass and some uneven ground. There is a tarmac road running through the middle of the Main Arena. The Main Arena has a number of small hills inside its perimeter. There is a gravel road that runs around the edge of the Accessible Campsite. The Accessible Car Park is located within the Accessible Campsite. The ground leading from the accessible car park and campsite to the Main Arena entrance consists of gravel road and grass. The distance is approximately 400 metres. The Main Arena is 300 metres from the main gate to the furthest perimeter edge.Please note: The weather conditions can dramatically affect the ground conditions, so wherever possible please try to consider what preparations you may need to make and equipment you may need to bring along.BOOKABLE ACCESS FACILITIES:The following access facilities need to be pre-booked using the Access Requirement form. This form and the required evidence must be sent to Kendal Calling directly once you have purchased a ticket.1) 2 FOR 1 TICKETS FOR PERSONAL ASSISTANTSKendal Calling provide a 2:1 ticket scheme for individuals who would be unable to attend the festival without bringing a personal assistant. Once you have bought a full price ticket, please fill in the access requirement form and provide a form of evidence as listed on the form in order to receive your personal assistant ticket.2) VIEWING PLATFORM WRISTBANDA viewing platform with a stewarded accessible toilet is located near the stage in the Main Arena. In order to gain access to the viewing platform, you need a viewing platform wristband. This also comes with a lanyard that can be worn by a personal assistant or companion so that they can join you on the platform.3) ACCESSIBLE CAMPING WRISTBANDOn arrival Thursday and Friday, there will be an Access Information Point in the accessible campsite where customers can collect further information on access within the festival site. It is also here that additional pre-agreed wristbands can be collected.The accessible campsite will be cordoned off from general camping. There will be a number of accessible toilets and showers. The accessible campsite will include a covered, 24-hour charging point for power chair batteries. Please assist with planning by letting the festival know if you intend to use this service when completing Section 5 of the Access Requirement Form. Customers are free to leave batteries and chairs in this area overnight at their own risk as this service is not stewarded.Near to the Accessible Campsite, there are village services (bar, concessions, information point and welfare).Facilities provided in the accessibility campsite:Accessible unisex showers and toiletsStandard showers and toiletsFresh water pointsWaste disposal pointElectrical points for charging wheelchairs and scooters on a first-come-first-served basisThis campsite is available to customers who are unable to camp in the standard campsites or who need access to specialist facilities provided.4) ACCESSIBLE PARKING PASSAn Accessible Car Park is located within the Accessible Campsite perimeter. Customers are allowed to park their cars near to their tent in a designated car park, but not directly next to their tent.OTHER INFORMATION RELATED TO THE SITE:ACCESSIBLE TOILETS:There will be a stewarded accessible toilet located beside the viewing platform in the Main Arena. A viewing platform wristband is required to gain access to this toilet. There will be other non-stewarded accessible toilets in the Main Arena. There will be accessible toilets within the Accessible Campsite.ASSISTANCE DOGS:Kendal Calling welcome assistance dogs onto the site. There will be an area provided for toileting and drinking.STROBE LIGHTING:There will be general warning signs around the Main Arena if strobe lighting will be used. Due to the nature of the artists, it is likely that strobe lighting will be used throughout the performances. There will not be a warning immediately before a period of strobe lighting.MEDICAL SERVICES:There will be a First Aid tent located in the Main Arena that will be visible within the Main Arena. There will also be Medics and First Aiders on patrol around the event. You will be able to store medication with the medical team if refrigeration is needed. Please let the festival know in advance if you will be wishing to store medication here. If you require more information, please get in touch.HEARING LOOPSThe festival have Bob-on-Com hearing loops on site, these are available at the box office, the access reception which is located in the access campaign, the information point and at the Green gate which is the entrance for customers staying in the access camping field, the boutique camping and live in vehicles.ARRIVAL GUIDEOn arrival to site, please head to the gate as described in the information pack, these are broken down into coloured gates. The information pack provided in advance, usually via email, will explain which gate to head to, where to collect your wristband and the location of the access campsite.Don’t forget your festival tickets, these will be scanned on arrival and swapped for festival wristbands. The site will open from 9am Thursday, for those with Thursday tickets, and 9am Friday for all weekend ticket holders.

Unfortunately, we can’t issue you with a refund if you can’t make the event due to work commitments or your mates have dropped out. In these circumstances, we advise passing on your tickets privately to avoid losing out on the money spent.

  

Refunds can only be offered if the event is cancelled or postponed, as agreed upon purchase.
