faqs.answer: Kendal Calling does not have any age restrictions as it is a family festival.

faqs.question: Disability / Personal Assistant Tickets
faqs.answer: If you require a PA/Carer ticket to attend the festival, please contact custcare@skiddle.com with your order confirmation details of your purchased weekend ticket and provide them with the relevant documentation for your disability.To be automatically eligible for a Personal Assistant ticket, please supply one of the following documents, please ensure the documentation is valid and within date.- The front page of DLA letter with PIP letter- The front page of Attendance Allowance letter- Evidence of being registered as severely sight impaired (blind)- Recognised Assistance Dog ID card- Valid Access Card showing you require a +1 to accompany youIn the meantime, please also purchase the tickets you require from Skiddle, not including the Personal Assistant ticket.

faqs.question: How do I get to App Fest UK?
faqs.answer: The address for App Fest UK is Hillworth Farm, Yardbridge, Longdon Tewkesbury, Gloucestershire, GL20 6AX.

faqs.question: When is App Fest UK 2023?
faqs.answer: App Fest UK takes place on Thursday 28th July - Sunday 31st July 2023.

faqs.question: What happens if I bought a ticket and cannot attend?
faqs.answer: Unfortunately we can’t issue you with a refund if you can’t make the event due to work commitments or your mates have dropped out. In these circumstances, we advise passing on your tickets privately to avoid losing out on the money spent. Refunds can only be offered if the event is cancelled or postponed, as agreed upon purchase.

faqs.question: What time does the App Fest UK campsite open on Thursday?
faqs.answer: Camping will open from midday on Thursday, and the music will start at 5pm.

faqs.question: Where is App Fest UK?
faqs.answer: App Fest UK is located at Hillworth Farm, Yardbridge, Longdon Tewkesbury, Gloucestershire, GL20 6AX.

faqs.question: What time is a day ticket for App Fest UK valid for?
faqs.answer: Day ticket is valid for the daytime performances and then you are expected to be offsite by the end of the day. Roughly, this will equate to 11am in the morning to 23.30 in the evening, although this will be advised in full closer to the festival when the line-up has been finalised. This system will be policed using coloured wristbands and the security team reserves the right to escort daytime attendees offsite in line with your ticket purchase.

faqs.question: How far is the camping from the main festival site?
faqs.answer: The exact location, layout, and distances will be available in due course, however the general answer is “not far”. App Fest UK is a small festival with a limited number of tickets, located on a lovely rural farm site. The camping will be sited far enough away to be quiet enough to sleep, but close enough that you aren’t walking miles. There will also be a drop-off point closer to the camping and festival sites for those with mobility needs.

faqs.question: I am under 18, can I buy a teen ticket myself?
faqs.answer: No. Your teen ticket purchase will need to be made using an adult ticket account, and the adult purchasing your ticket will take full responsibility for that purchase.

faqs.question: What facilities are available in the camping area at App Fest UK?
faqs.answer: As App Fest UK is based on a rural farm and not on a converted campsite, the facilities are limited. There will be toilets, showers, lighting, running water, bins, and security, but no individual electricity points for motorhomes. Please make sure you plan for this before attending the festival.

faqs.question: Can I bring food & drink into App Fest UK?
faqs.answer: While some food & drink is permitted in the campsite, it is not permitted to take food or drink from the campsite into the arena. Exceptions are an empty water bottle for filling within the arena, or a sealed water bottle with an original shop-bought seal. No food is to be brought into the arena, but there will be an array of food stalls available on site, catering to lots of tastes and preferences. The only exception to this rule is for those with severe dietary needs which cannot be managed on site. If you believe that you have severe dietary needs, then please email info@app-fest.co.uk and they will grant special permission if appropriate.

faqs.question: I don't have a printer to print my e-tickets, what can I do?
faqs.answer: You can show your ticket on a smartphone and we recommend bringing your reference numbers with you in case they need to look your tickets up.

faqs.question: Does App Fest UK have pitches for Motorhomes / Caravans?
faqs.answer: Yes, they have some motorhome pitches available on site, but please note this is a farm location and not a campsite so there are not electricity points available. Due to the site suitability, these pitches are limited, so we advise booking early to secure a space for your motorhome. Please note, awnings and motorhome extensions are only permitted if they fit in the 8m x 5m pitch size.

faqs.question: What times are the different acts playing at App Fest UK?
faqs.answer: While there will be a rough guide to the running order and schedule for the acts, this can be subject to change on the day and of course natural variation as things overrun, or if there are issues with the weather or technical performances. On Thursday, the music starts from 17.00pm and continues throughout the weekend. Typically, the headliner finishes on the main stage around 11pm each day.

faqs.question: Will my child need a ticket for App Fest UK?
faqs.answer: Yes, children 3 and over will need a child's ticket for App Fest UK. Please see the ticket page for prices.

faqs.question: Do I need my own tent for App Fest UK?
faqs.answer: If you have purchased a camping ticket you must bring your own tent. There are no hire tents available.

faqs.question: Aside from the music, what will be on site for kids at App Fest UK?
faqs.answer: There will be a funfair, bouncy castles, inflatable assault courses etc. to keep all ages entertained.

faqs.question: I can't attend the whole weekend, but would still like to camp. Can I purchase day tickets for the right days then camp in between?
faqs.answer: Unfortunately, no. For reasons of health and safety, App Fest UK can’t manage individual arrivals and departures on the campsite for one night only. They have, however, tried to make the full weekend price very affordable for four days of music and camping. We advise that you buy a weekend pass, then they can allocate you a camping pitch on site, and you can turn up at a time and day to suit you for example missing the Thursday, or leaving early on the Sunday. Day tickets are reserved for daytime attendance only and we will require you to be offsite by the end of the day. If you choose to buy day tickets for multiple days, you will be expected to stay overnight elsewhere, before returning in the morning.

faqs.question: Can I pre-book my pitch at App Fest UK?
faqs.answer: Logistically, this is almost impossible to manage, so pitches will be allocated on a first-come, first-serve basis, apart from those people who have notified us of particular access needs. Camping will be done in two main areas: a Motorhome, caravan and live in vehicle area, and a tented area.

faqs.question: How do I pay at the App Fest UK site?
faqs.answer: All bars are cashless and payment will be made by contactless card through a secured 5G Wi-Fi network. Other food and craft vendors may offer cash or card payment options.

faqs.question: I can't attend the whole day - are half day tickets available?
faqs.answer: No. App Fest UK is one of the most affordable tickets in the country with some brilliant acts for a great low price, especially if you grab an early bird bargain/ You will need a full day pass, although you can come and go as you please.

faqs.question: Can I park next to my tent?
faqs.answer: Unfortunately, there isn’t space for parking or drop-off next to your tent. You will need to park in the carpark and walk to your pitch with your belongings.

faqs.question: Do we need to pay for bar cups as per other festivals?
faqs.answer: The bars will be charging £1.50 per festival cup on your first purchase. You must keep these cups with you at all times to avoid further charges. You can swap them at the bars if you need to. These will remain your property after the event as a memento of your time at App Fest UKt. As a gesture of goodwill there will be a special promotion on future tickets where you will get the value of your festival cup off future ticket pricing therefore for loyal festival goers the festival cup will be paid back to you.

faqs.question: Are dogs allowed at App Fest UK?
faqs.answer: Dogs are allowed with a valid dog pass bought with your ticket.1. Dogs must be kept on the lead at all times2. All dog mess but be cleared up straight away and put in the bins provided. App Fest UK and/or any Authorised Person may refuse entry to the venue to any Ticket Holder and their dog, or remove a Ticket Holder from the Venue with their dog that App Fest UK and/or any Authorised Person deem to be unruly or behaving in any way that is not appropriate to the event and venue, or who fouls the Venue. Any Ticket Holder who brings a dog into the venue is wholly responsible for the wellbeing and behaviour and all actions of their dog and takes full responsibility for all actions, injury, death, losses, costs, claims, expenses, and damages caused by their dog, whether in breach of these conditions or not and the Ticket Holder indemnifies us for any injury death losses costs claims expenses and damages as a result of their animal causing the same. App Fest UK accept no liability whatsoever so far as they are able to exclude for all actions of the Ticket Holder’s dog at the venue. Skiddle advises that you are mindful of your dogs' sensitive hearing at all times and that you NEVER, EVER leave your dog in either your car or your live-in vehicle or your tent unattended, or your vehicle may be damaged to release your dog and the dog confiscated by animal welfare.

faqs.question: How many minors am I allowed to supervise?
faqs.answer: App Fest UK ask that there is one paying adult per child under 9, to ensure on site health and safety. For children aged between 9 and 15, a maximum of two per paying adult is requested.

faqs.question: How far are the camping pitches from the parking?
faqs.answer: The exact location, layout, and distances will be available in due course, however the general answer is “not far”. App Fest UK is a small festival with a limited number of tickets, located on a lovely rural farm site. The camping pitches will be located within easy walking of the parking and there will be drop-off options for those with additional mobility needs. Cars will not be permitted in the actual camping area due to Health and Safety.

faqs.question: Can I buy tickets on the day?
faqs.answer: In theory, yes, but only if there are tickets available. App Fest UK have deliberately made their festival quite small to allow an intimate feel without crowding. This means they have very strict numbers for their license, and it is highly likely that it will be a sell-out as it is every year. If there are tickets left, they will be available on the day, but there is no guarantee of availability and they will be a slightly higher price too. We recommend purchasing a ticket at the early bird price to give you the flexibility to come and go as you please, without the full ticket price.

faqs.question: Is the parking fee a daily charge or a charge for the whole festival?
faqs.answer: There is a £10 flat fee per vehicle for the festival. This is the same whether you come for one day or four days.

faqs.question: Can I bring food & drink to the campsite?
faqs.answer: You can bring a reasonable amount of food & drink onsite into the camping area only, appropriate to the number of people on your booking. Please be sensible as the campsite has no electric facilities and you will not be able to plug in a mini fridge, so any food should be non-refrigerated. Please do not bring excess food onto the campsite as it may be confiscated. With regards to alcohol drinks, bring no more than a reasonable amount per person over 18. Please note, glass bottles, glass containers and any form of glass will not be permitted on site at any time. BBQs are also not allowed - this is a working farm and, to comply with fire safety risk assessment, BBQs (disposable or otherwise), fire pits, candles, and any item with a naked flame are not permitted onsite.

faqs.question: What are the entry times for Camp Bestival?
faqs.answer:
Start: 12:00pm 

End: 2:00am

faqs.question: Are pre-payment plan tickets available?
faqs.answer: No, there aren't any payment plans available for this event.

faqs.question: How to get to Camp Bestival?
faqs.answer: Located in the very heart of Dorset between Bournemouth, Dorchester, and Weymouth, Lulworth Castle is easily accessible by rail, coach or car...BY RAIL:Lulworth benefits from an excellent rail network linking the midlands, North, Scotland and London Waterloo with Wareham or Wool railway station. With some planning and advance purchase of tickets, it’s possible to make a journey by rail to Wareham or Wool from much of the country making it even more of a holiday experience. Check South West Trains special GroupSave discount (or call 0845 6000 650) where you can save up to 50% when 3 or 4 people travel together off-peak - you can also add up to 4 children for just £1 each!Local taxis will be available from Wareham and Wool Station to take you to the site, and also available from the site when you need to leave.BY CAR:To find your best route to Camp Bestival using an online journey planner or your SatNav please enter postcode BH20 5QS. Once you arrive near the site please follow the directions below and as soon as you see Camp Bestival event signage please turn off your SatNav off and follow these signs:From the East (via/near Bournemouth) - take the A35 towards Dorchester, turning left onto the A351 towards Wareham and then right onto the A352 signposted to Wool. Then follow event signage.From the West (via/near Dorchester) - From the A35 Dorchester bypass take the A352 signposted for Wool and Wareham. Then follow event signage.On approach to the event please follow the relevant signage which relates to your ticket type:General Camping tickets: Follow signs for Camping Car Parks, then enter site via YELLOW GATEBoutique Campers/Tangerine Fields Campers: Follow signs for Boutique Camping, enter site via YELLOW GATECampervans/Caravans/Trailer Tents: Follow signs for Camping Car Parks, then enter site via YELLOW GATECamping Plus: Follow signs for Camping Car Parks, then on approach to camping car parks enter site via GREEN GATEDisability Access Camping: follow signs for Camping car parks, then on approach to site enter via WHITE GATENB - Please do not follow your SatNav once you are on the A352 as there will be some road closures in place and please watch your speed as it is a rural location and likely to have heavier traffic than usual.Leaving Camp BestivalIf you are driving home, bear in mind that it is holiday time down in Dorset so there may be traffic unrelated to the event. The A31 will be busy 8am–11am and 5pm–9pm, so why not delay your departure by visiting one of the hundreds of attractions in Dorset.Advance Weekend Car Parking: £15 from www.ticketline.co.uk/camp-bestival-tickets (with no postage/booking fees if you add onto your existing order by calling Ticketline)Non-Advance Weekend Car Parking: £20 (Thurs/Fri arrival). Payable in cash on arrival.Day Car Parking: £5. Payable in advance or cash on arrival.NB: Weekend Ticket holders who are not camping should ensure they retain their ticket so it can be used for all 4 days.CAR SHARINGIf you are going to Camp Bestival by car, please fill it up with people. Even if you only have one space free in your car, please check out both options on Camp Bestival's Car Sharing page and get yourselves signed up. Likewise, of course, to anyone who is looking for a lift. What's more, these services are entirely free to use (you simply share the travel costs).BY FERRYWhite Motor Boats operate ferries between Weymouth and Lulworth Cove in the summer months. They land passengers on the beach in the Cove, and then it is a 5-minute taxi ride to the Castle. Arrive in style! Call 07749 732428 for more info.BY AIR:European and International visitors can benefit from the newly developed Bournemouth and Southampton International Airports.

faqs.question: Disabled Access Information?
faqs.answer: Getting AroundElectric wheelchairs can tackle most areas without too much hindrance but the ground can be quite uneven in places and is predominantly on grass. If it rains it may get muddy and access around the site (other than on the paths) may be very difficult. The terrain is predominantly short grass with firm soil so movement around the main arena and other stages is possible for fit wheelchair users in good weather.  Your personal assistant will need to assist you if it becomes difficult, which is why they receive a free pass to the festival.Chilling outThe festival recognise that some, particularly those with specific learning difficulties may need to find a space to step away from the crowds and noise.  The organisers do their best to provide this but it is difficult in a festival environment but they always aim to do their best.Camping - Disability Access CampsiteThe Disability Access Camping Area is positioned near to the main Lulworth Castle entrance and to the Main Stage. It is a few minutes from here to the main arena on relatively flat ground and is one of the quietest and closest to the arenas.  It is the best location we can achieve for all of the needs of people who the festival try to accommodate.  Please note that you should prepare to bring a tent or campervan that will fit in  7m x 5m space as that is very likely to be your allocation.  Of course, those who require a little more space will be helped if there is space available.NB: Your family and friends can camp with you in the Accessibility camping area but your group including the person with a disability, a personal assistant and children can be a maximum of 6 people. Other people with disabilities who are your friends and family should apply separately. ParkingThose in the Accessibility campsite will need to follow signs for Accessibility Camping - this is accessed via the Main Lulworth Castle Gates. Only vehicles with a blue badge (or similar) can park in the disability access camping area if there is available space and if your tent and car fit in the 7m x 5m space.  If not, you will be asked to park in the nearby car park.  Only one vehicle is allowed in the camping area and this includes motorhomes.If you are in General Admission Camping, Boutique camping, Campervan Field or camping Plus, they have separate car parks for you to use and there are no special allowances for Blue Badge holders as the car parks are first-come, first-served.A car park for the day visiting persons with a disability without a blue badge is close by and accessible throughout the weekend. Friends will have to park in the main car park, however. Day parking is also available. FacilitiesPlease note that the festival is in a field where normal home-type levels of facilities are just not possible. The organisers do their absolute best but sometimes vehicles get stuck in traffic, things break or don't work and we'll be doing our best to fix it, and of course look to improve each year with newer available facilities.* Please note that facilities for those with mobility difficulties such as showers and toilets should NOT be used by your other guests.  It's very important that we keep these facilities for those who need them most.  Those with disabilities are our priority in this campsite. - Charging points for electric wheelchairs are available - these are undercover but outdoors so can be affected by damp conditions so chargers are left at users risk- Certain medical support is available from the on-site medical centre but any specific medical needs should be discussed before purchasing a ticket. - On-site hospital.  We have a hospital on site but it is NOT a residential hospital.  No-one should be left in our on-site hospital overnight, or be left unattended by a personal assistant if in this environment.   - Accessible lavatories will be positioned at various places around the festival and we aim to protect them from public use.  Please check out where they are on site so you know where to go when you need to go.- In the Accessibility campsite, showers and toilets are provided- Stewards will be on hand to help with any issues that may arise during the weekend- We do not supply motability buggies or any other form of onsite transport so you will need to bring your own if it is needed- We do not supply medical equipment or essential medical supplies so you will need to bring these yourself or arrange delivery to Lulworth castle.- At the time of writing, we do not have viewing platforms at Camp Bestival as there are elevated positions for viewing If you have any pressing questions that are not answered here above, please email disabilityaccess@campbestival.net

faqs.question: When is Camp Bestival?
faqs.answer: Camp Bestival takes place on Thursday 27th July - Sunday 30th July 2023.

faqs.question: What happens If I bought a ticket and cannot attend?
faqs.answer:
Unfortunately we can’t issue you with a refund if you can’t make the event due to work commitments or your mates have dropped out. In these circumstances, we advise passing on your tickets privately to avoid losing out on the money spent. 

Refunds can only be offered if the event is cancelled or postponed, as agreed upon purchase.

faqs.question: Where is Camp Bestival?
faqs.answer:
Camp Bestival is located in Dorset.

Address:

Lulworth,

East Lulworth, 

BH20 5QS

faqs.question: When is Outook Origins 2023?
faqs.answer: Outook Origins takes place from Thursday 27th - Monday 31st July 2023.

faqs.question: How to get to Outlook Origins
faqs.answer:
TRAVELLING BY PLANE

Flying to Outlook Origins is easy. Both Zadar and Split airports are close to Tisno, around 60 minutes away.

faqs.question: Accommodation at the festival
faqs.answer:
There are several options on-site: camping spaces (very limited!), fully-equipped apartments, mobile homes, glamping tents and hostels. If booked more than 10 weeks before arrival you can pay a 50% deposit and the balance will be due 10 weeks before arrival. You can book on-site accommodation directly via The Garden here or contact enquiries@thegarden.hr

If you would prefer to stay off-site, have a look on Booking.com (popular in Croatia!) or Airbnb.

The Garden’s off-site accommodation manager is also on hand to help if you’re struggling – just reach out to them via enquiries@thegarden.hr. 

The nearby towns of Pirovac (where Barbarella’s is), Murter, Betina and Jezera are also good options if you can’t find anywhere suitable in Tisno. All these are a short taxi ride away.

faqs.question: Accessibility information
faqs.answer:
All disabled customers are welcome at Outlook. Please bear in mind that the site will have some areas with terrain that may make access challenging when booking for the event.

We would advise getting in touch regarding any specific accommodation or travel requirements before booking. 

Should you have any enquiries regarding the access and facilities at the festival, please email info@outlookfestival.com

faqs.question: What happens if I bought a ticket and cannot attend?
faqs.answer: Unfortunately we can’t issue you with a refund if you can’t make the event due to work commitments or your mates have dropped out. In these circumstances, we advise passing on your tickets privately to avoid losing out on the money spent. Refunds can only be offered if the event is cancelled or postponed, as agreed upon purchase.

faqs.question: Where is Outook Origins?
faqs.answer: Outook Origins is located The Garden, Tisno. The Garden Resort (Main Festival): Ul. Petria Glava 34, 22240, Tisno, Croatia

faqs.question: When is Belladrum 2023?
faqs.answer: Belladrum Tartan Heart Festival returns to Belladrum Estate Thursday 27th July - Saturday 29th July 2023.

faqs.question: Does Belladrum have onsite camping?
faqs.answer: Yes Belladrum has various options for camping and campervans across the site.

faqs.question: How do I get to Belladrum?
faqs.answer: By Car - It is recommended to arrive early to use the designated car parks, it can take between 5- 15 minutes to walk to your campsite. By Bus - Shuttle runs from Inverness Bus Station and regular bus services from Scottish Towns Transport are available. By Taxi - There are several local taxi firms to choose from.  By Air - Inverness Airport is 45 minutes drive from Belladrum. It takes approximately 1.5 hours to fly from London.

faqs.question: How much are Belladrum tickets?
faqs.answer: Tickets start from £88 plus booking fee for Saturday Adult Tickets, 3 Day Weekend Tickets start from £188 plus booking fee.

faqs.question: Is there disabled access at Belladrum?
faqs.answer:
BELLADRUM 2023 ACCESS SCHEME

 

PERSONAL ASSISTANT TICKETS

A Personal Assistant ticket (also known as a carer’s ticket) is offered free of charge when somebody with a disability requires a carer to be in attendance with them. Please note we have a fixed allocation of personal assistant tickets which are allocated on a first come first serve basis.

 

To be eligible, please provide a copy of one of the following pieces of documentation listed below.

> Front page of DLA / PIP (no specific rate)

> Front page of Attendance Allowance letter (no specific rate)

> Evidence that registered severely sight impaired (blind)

> Credability's Access Card

 

IF YOU ARE NOT A BLUE BADGE HOLDER:

You should book the tickets you require (not including the Personal Assistant ticket) through our tickets page.

For your free Personal Assistant Ticket, you should then apply to Belladrum with your documentation along with your 16-digit order reference number by emailing admin@tartanheartfestival.co.uk

 

MOBILITY CAMPING AND PARKING AREA

Blue Badge campers (higher rate mobility) can camp and/or park in the Mobility Camping & Parking Area. Persons without mobility issues should park in the appropriate area for where they want to camp (quiet/family/general)

 

IF YOU ARE A BLUE BADGE HOLDER (higher rate mobility):

You should book the tickets you require (not including any Live-In Vehicle or Personal Assistant tickets required) through our tickets page. For your free Personal Assistant Ticket and access to the Mobility Camping & Parking Area for your party you should then apply to Belladrum by emailing admin@tartanheartfestival.co.uk. (Parties restricted to 4 persons & 1 car per application).

Please supply evidence of being a Blue Badge holder (higher rate mobility), along with your 16-digit order reference number & the number of Mobility Area passes required. Assuming you qualify, we will issue you with your Mobility Camping Area passes and your Mobility Area Vehicle pass.

 

 

MOBILITY CAMPERVAN/CARAVAN AREA

The Mobility Campervan/Caravan Area is situated in an area closest to the main arena. You need to have tickets to this area and to have qualified for these as a blue badge holder. To get a campervan/caravan ticket for the Mobility Campervan/Caravan Area and an electrical hook-up if you require one, you should apply for these through Belladrum by emailing admin@tartanheartfestival.co.uk. (Do not buy these tickets through the normal tickets page.)

Please supply evidence of being a Blue Badge holder (higher rate mobility), along with your 16-digit order reference number & the number of Mobility Area Campervan Passes / Electric Hook Up Add Ons required.

faqs.question: Where is Belladrum?
faqs.answer: Belladrum is located on the Belladrum Estate, By Beauly, Inverness in the Highlands of Scotland. The postcode is IV4 7BA.

faqs.question: Where can I leave my car?
faqs.answer: Parking is free at Belladrum!

faqs.question: What happens If I bought a ticket and cannot attend?
faqs.answer: Unfortunately we can’t issue you with a refund if you can’t make the event due to work commitments or your mates have dropped out. In these circumstances, we advise passing on your tickets privately to avoid losing out on the money spent. Refunds can only be offered if the event is cancelled or postponed, as agreed upon purchase.

faqs.question: Where do I park as a blue badge (higher rate mobility) day visitor?
faqs.answer: If you have a Mobility Area pass and Mobility Area Vehicle pass, you can day park in the Mobility Parking & Camping area.

faqs.question: Does Belladrum have any age restrictions?
faqs.answer: Belladrum is a family festival, all ages welcome. You may be asked to show photo ID.

faqs.question: Are all areas of the festival accessible by wheelchair?
faqs.answer: Yes, and there are special viewing areas in many of the arenas; however, this is an outdoor event and conditions could become muddy and slippery.

faqs.question: What ID is accepted?
faqs.answer: The festival accepts Passports, Driving Licences and any other photo ID with a PASS logo.

faqs.question: Can I apply for my Personal Assistant ticket or Mobility Area pass later in the year?
faqs.answer: There is a limit for personal assistant tickets and a limit on mobility camping and parking capacity. Once these are reached we cannot accept any further applications.

faqs.question: Can I bring my own food and drink into Belladrum?
faqs.answer: You are allowed to bring food and drink to the campsite however you are not allowed to bring your own food and drink into the festival site. There will be a wide variety of food and drink stalls inside the festival, serving up organic, vegetarian and vegan options.

faqs.question: Can I leave and re-enter?
faqs.answer: Yes, until midnight. After midnight the gates won't re-open until 8am.

faqs.question: What are the set times?
faqs.answer: The exact timings are confirmed much closer to the festival. Once confirmed they will be available within the free programme and posted up by each stage.

faqs.question: What are the entry times?
faqs.answer: Start: 8:00amEnd: 1:00pm

faqs.question: When is Steelhouse Festival 2023?
faqs.answer: Steelhouse Festival takes place Friday 28th July - Sunday 30th July 2023.

faqs.question: How to get to Steelhouse Festival
faqs.answer: Festival Site Address: Hafod-y-Dafal Farm, Aberbeeg, Ebbw Vale NP13 2ER The site is less than 1 hour from Cardiff and Bristol. The nearest train station is Ebbw Vale Parkway, where a shuttle-bus is available to take you straight to site.

faqs.question: Accessibility information
faqs.answer: For in depth information on accessibility and information such as carer's tickets, please visit https://www.steelhousefestival.com/info/.

faqs.question: Is there camping available at Steelhouse Festival?
faqs.answer: Yes., there are a range of camping options available at Steelhouse Festival including adult camping, family camping accessible camping, glamping, and live-in vehicle options. Tickets for each of there is sold in addition to your festival entry ticket. See the festival website for further information.

faqs.question: Where is Steelhouse Festival?
faqs.answer: Steelhouse Festival is loactaed at Hafod-y-Dafal Farm, Aberbeeg, Ebbw Vale, Wales, NP13 2ER.

faqs.question: Are there any age restrictions at Steelhouse Festival?
faqs.answer: Steelhouse Festival is an all-ages event, however you are asked to use your discretion as this is a rock festival and some acts may be considered unsuitable for younger children. Anyone under the age of 18 must be accompanied by someone 18 or over, with a maximum of 4 under 18s to each adult. Reduced tickets are available for those aged 14 and under.You may be asked to show valid photo ID, and the venue will be operating a Challenge 21 policy.

faqs.question: When does the Steelhouse Festival site open?
faqs.answer: The festival site opens for camping on Friday 28th July 2023 from noon. The Festival Arena will be open for admission from 2.00pm until Midnight on Friday and 11.30am until midnight on the Saturday & Sunday - no admission to the festival arena outside of these times. All vehicles and campers must exit the site by 11am on Monday 31st July 2023.

faqs.question: When is Summer Sound Music Festival 2023?
faqs.answer: Summer Sound Music Festival takes place on Friday 28th - Sunday 30th July, 2023

faqs.question: Is there any parking at Summer Sound Music Festival?
faqs.answer: There is no car parking on site. We advise anyone travelling by car to park in the town centre. A free shuttle bus will be available from The Fox Inn which will take you directly to the entrance.

faqs.question: What happens if I bought a ticket and cannot attend?
faqs.answer: Unfortunately we can’t issue you with a refund if you can’t make the event due to work commitments or your mates have dropped out. In these circumstances, we advise passing on your tickets privately to avoid losing out on the money spent. Refunds can only be offered if the event is cancelled or postponed, as agreed upon purchase.

faqs.question: Where is Summer Sound Music Festival?
faqs.answer: Summer Sound Music Festival will be held at Guisborough Rugby Club, Belmangate, Guisborough, TS14 7BB.

faqs.question: Does Summer Sound Music Festival have any age restrictions?
faqs.answer: Over 16´s may attend but only when accompanied by an adult. One adult may bring in 2 over 16's. The bars will be operating a challenge 25 policy to prevent underage drinking. You may be asked for a valid photo ID. Sunday's event is all ages!

faqs.question: What can I bring into Summer Sound Music Festival?
faqs.answer: You are allowed to bring your own food and drink. A sensible alcohol limit will be in place at the discretion of the security. A one-hand limit will be in place so please only bring what you can carry in one hand. Any excessive amounts will be confiscated on entry and available to collect when you leave. Please note food and a licensed bar will be available on site.You can bring your own camping chairs but these need to be taken away at the end of the night.Same rules apply as previous years regarding food and drink. Only reasonable amounts are allowed in, 4-6 cans per person (recommended) and no crates or bottles of spirits. Glass is not allowed on site so plastic bottles and cans only.You can bring your own food but remember we have various traders on site offering a wide range of street food including hog roast, wood fired pizza, chinese noodles, traditional burgers, crispy chicken wraps, loaded fries, hot dogs and more.

faqs.question: Are there any other restrictions on what I can bring into Summer Sound Music Festival?
faqs.answer: Gazebos are only allowed if you have pre-booked a space. Spaces are limited and gazebo tickets can be purchased on this site. Gazebos can be no bigger than 3m x 3m and must be removed at the end of the night.Gazebo ticket holders can access the site 1 hour earlier to erect their gazebos. Anyone entering the site must have a valid ticket.Any chairs brought onto the site must be removed at the end of the night.Bags will be searched upon entry and any glass bottles will be retained.Portable/throw away BBQ’s are not allowed.Chinese lanterns are not allowed.No glass bottles, metal cutlery or crockery are allowed into the site. Please bring plastic containers, plastic cutlery and paper plates only.

faqs.question: What are the entry times?
faqs.answer:
Friday

Opens: 5:00pm

faqs.question: What drinks/alcohol is served at Summer Sound Music Festival?
faqs.answer: We have bars on site serving draught beers and lagers, wines, spirits and cocktails, so don't worry about not bringing enough.

faqs.question: When is Y Not Festival 2023?
faqs.answer: Y Not Festival takes place on Friday 28th July - Sunday 30th July 2023.

faqs.question: How do I get to Y Not Festival by car?

faqs.answer: Lollapalooza Chicago is located at Grant Park in Chicago, Illinois, USA.

faqs.question: What items are allowed / prohibited at Lollapalooza Chicago?
faqs.answer:
Allowed:
  • Clear bags no larger than 12" x 12" x 6" or clutch purses no larger than 4.5" x 5.5"
  • Baby strollers / prams
  • Frisbees
  • Binoculars
  • Blankets / towels
  • Basic cameras without accessories, tripods, or attachments (no selfie sticks)
  • EMPTY reusable water bottles / hydration packs, plastic or aluminium
  • Non-aerosol sunscreen, 3.4 ounces or less.
Prohibited:
  • Bags larger than the ones listed above.
  • Aerosols
  • Coolers / cool boxes
  • Framed backpacks or multiple pocket backpacks
  • Any and all professional audio recording equipment
  • Any and all professional cameras or video equipment
  • Drones / remote flying devices
  • Hammocks
  • Glass of any kind
  • Illegal / illicit substances of any kind
  • Outside food / drink (inc. alcohol)
  • Umbrellas
  • Pets (except service animals)
  • Selfie sticks
  • Skateboards / scooters / bicycles / wagons / carts / personal motorized vehicles
  • Tents / canopies / gazebos / shade structures
  • Unauthorized / unlicensed vendors
  • Weapons / explosives
  • Fireworks
  • Large chains / spiked jewellery
  • Chairs of any kind
  • Smoking, including vaping
All bags will be searched upon entry. Bags will be restricted to small purses, totes and drawstring bags. For speedy entry, leave your bags at home and take advantage of the festival's No Bag Express Lanes.

faqs.question: Can I leave and re-enter Lollapalooza Chicago on the same day?
faqs.answer: Yes, ticket holders can leave and re-enter 2 additional times after entering. You will have to scan your wristband each time.

faqs.question: Is there disability access and PA Tickets?
faqs.answer: We are committed to making Big Family Festival as accessible as possible and great efforts are being been made to achieve this where reasonable.There are of course still fields and areas where mobility can be difficult.  We have spaces to chill out and get away from it all as well, for those who need this.However, Big Family Festival is an outdoor festival utilising fields and farmland that could pose problems, particularly in wet weather for mobility, and large volumes of people and noise for those with learning difficulties. With a little help here and there though we feel that it is definitely manageable and we provide a 2 for 1 pass for Personal Assistants for those who may find they have physical and mental challenges across the weekend.Please read the following information carefully.2 FOR 1 – ONE FREE DISABILITY ACCESS PERSONAL ASSISTANT PASSIn our commitment to make Big Family Festival accessible to everyone, we may provide Deaf or disabled ticket holders that would be unable to attend without use of a personal assistant (PA), and are in receipt of one, or more of the following with a ticket at no additional cost for one PA:•    - Middle or Higher rate DLA for care and/or mobility•    - Receipt of Personal Independence Payment (PIP)•    - Evidence of being severely sight impaired•    - CredAbility Access Card – + 1 category requirement•    - A recognised Assistance Dog ID Card.HOW TO APPLY• - Please email angela@bigfamilyfestival.co.ukProviding proof of one of the above along with the your ticket order number, for the ticket already purchased.A assistance ticket will then be sent which is the same value/date/type as the one purchased.The deadline for assistance ticket requests is 15th July 2022.

faqs.answer: Weekend tickets give you access to the site from 12:00 noon on Friday 5th august until 12:00 noon on Monday 8th august. faqs.question: Are there any age restrictions at Good Vibrations Society?
faqs.answer: All ages are welcome into the Good Vibrations Society. Anyone under 18 must be accompanied by an adult 25 or older at all times. We recommend getting a wristband with your contact information to put on your child’s wrist so that in the event they get lost, we can contact you immediately. Anyone lost or missing someone should find a festival organiser or go to the welfare tent to seek help. The only forms of identification accepted are: Valid passportValid drivers licencePASS identification cardYou must have the original document, copies are not accepted.

faqs.question: How do I get to 51st State?
faqs.answer:
By Tube - by Tube (Mill Hill East on the Northern Line)By Car - Copthall Playing Fields are just 400 metres from Junction 2 of the M1, 12 minutes inside the M25 and right next to the North Circular Road. There is car parking space for 800 cars on a first come first serve basis, car park tickets are only available in advance here: 51stfestival.com/blogs/tickets The A1(M) runs from the North of England down into north London, via nearby towns such as Stevenage, Welwyn Garden City and Hatfield. The A406 (the North Circular Road) runs through north London and links west and east London together. The M1 runs from the North of England into north London, via Luton and Watford.
By Taxi - There will be a taxi rank for collections, this will be sign-posted on the day of the event. Please be aware that there are strict road closures in operation in the surrounding areas which only allow access to local residents.By Bus - The 221 route runs from Edgware bus station to Turnpike Lane station. Alight at the Copthall Sports Centre for the Copthall Playing Fields, which is a 5 minute walk away. The 113 Bus route runs from Edgware Bus Station to Marble Arch. Alight at Five Ways Corner for Copthall Playing Fields, which is a 10 minute walk away. By Train - The nearest train station is Mill Hill Broadway which is on Thameslink and a 5 minute taxi journey from Copthall Playing Fields. Mill Hill Broadway is only 17 minutes from King’s Cross St Pancras or 20 minutes from Farringdon.

faqs.question: Is there disabled access at 51st State Festival?
faqs.answer:
51st State provide a free ticket for a personal assistant to special access ticket holders who would be unable to attend or whose experience would be greatly impaired without their presence.Please follow the steps below to apply.

Application Process

Please purchase the tickets you require for 51st Festival via Skiddle, NOT including the Carer Ticket.We then ask you to supply us with one of the following documents dated within the past 12 months or with valid date covering the event:-The front page of the DLA letter with the PIP letter-The front page of Attendance Allowance letter-Evidence of being registered as severely sight impaired (blind)-Recognised Assistance Dog ID card-Valid Access Card showing you require a +1 to accompany you If you could email the supporting document and your Skiddle order ID number to custcare@skiddle.com we can add a Personal Assistant ticket to your order.

title: Lets Rock Northern Ireland - The Retro Festival

faqs.question: When is Lets Rock Northern Ireland 2023?
faqs.answer: Lets Rock Northern Ireland takes place on Saturday 27th May 2023.

faqs.question: What's included in a Lets Rock Northern Ireland VIP ticket?
faqs.answer: 2023 will see the ever popular and totally cool, funky 80s themed CLUB TROPICANA VIP enclosure. As well as entry to the event, VIP tickets include fast track entry, luxury loos, meal and welcome drink, PLUS exclusive DJ sets. Sit back and relax in this exclusive area with comfy seating and chairs and a full bar serving quality brands and 80’s cocktails, plus of course the all-important VIP luxury loos – essential at any festival! Fancy dress is recommended, but not compulsory! For any group or company bookings (10 or more) please email uklcs@uk-live.co.uk

faqs.question: How do I apply for a personal assistant ticket?
faqs.answer: Disabled ticket holders are offered, subject to availability, a free ticket for a personal assistant. This offer is open to those who hold a current higher rate of DLA or other UK government approved supporting evidence of their requirement for a personal assistant. Carer tickets can only be issued against general entry tickets. IMPORTANT: This offer is only available to those people that would be unable to attend the festival without a full time assistant. Every application is looked at on an individual basis and if anyone is found to be making a fraudulent application, the festival reserve the right to cancel both the original ticket and personal assistant ticket, before and during the event. To apply for a personal assistant ticket, please follow the procedure below:– Buy a standard general admission ticket (must be online)– Email proof of purchase (the email from Gigantic) AND a copy of your letter of award for DLA (or equivalent) Please send your email to uklcs@uk-live.co.uk . Please ensure that any attachments do not exceed a file size of 1MB, and that you include your full postal address in your email. PERSONAL ASSISTANT TICKETS WILL BE EMAILED ONE WEEK BEFORE THE EVENT

faqs.question: Does Lets Rock Northern Ireland have onsite camping?
faqs.answer: No, Lets Rock Northern Ireland is a non-camping festival so camping equipment is not needed.

faqs.question: Where is Lets Rock Northern Ireland?
faqs.answer: Lets Rock Northern Ireland will be held at Ward Park, Bangor, Northern Ireland.

faqs.question: What time does the event start/finish?
faqs.answer: The gates open at 11.00am and we recommend that you get there early, so that you don’t miss any of the action! The Festival starts at midday and finishes at 10:30pm.

faqs.question: Does Lets Rock Northern Ireland have any age restrictions?
faqs.answer: No, Lets Rock Northern Ireland is a family-friendly festival.

faqs.question: Will I be able to come and go during the day?
faqs.answer: This is a no re-entry event. Re-entry to the Festival is not permitted, with the sole exception of parents/guardians accompanying children under the age of 16. Single use re-entry wristbands will only be issued on-site at the Festival to parents/guardians who are in possession of a Child Ticket and this pass allows for re-entry to the festival with or without your child. Adults not accompanying children to the Festival will not be allowed re-entry. Single use re-entry wristbands will also be available for disabled guests.

faqs.question: Can we camp?
faqs.answer: Yes, camping tickets are available from our ticket page. Please note, you can only camp with Rock The Moat, if you’re in possession of a full weekend ticket.

faqs.question: Is there parking provided?
faqs.answer: Yes, parking tickets are available from their ticket page.

faqs.question: What will be there?
faqs.answer: The event will consist of arena standard staging, lighting and sound, as well as numerous fully licensed bars and street food vendors.

faqs.question: Are there any disabled tickets?
faqs.answer: Yes, disabled customers are required to purchase a ticket and then send the confirmation, as wellas a photo/copy of their DLA/PIP letter to info@rockthemote.com. We will then process thedocuments and provide them with a carer ticket free of charge.

faqs.question: How do i get to Rock the Mote?
faqs.answer: TRAVELING BY CARIf you’re looking to arrive by car, you will need to park in one of the many local car parks.Click here for locations.  Alternatively, if you wish to leave your vehicle overnight, we would recommend the car parksituated on Brunswick Street (maximum 24 hour stay).  The car park situated within Mote Park’s main entrance is for park users only.  Please note, we strongly advise that you do not park in and around residential areas surroundingthe park and doing so will run the risk of you receiving a parking ticket.  TRAVELING BY TRAINMaidstone West Station – 1.3 miles from Mote Park  Maidstone Barracks Station – 1.7 miles from Mote Park  Maidstone East Station – 1.4 miles from Mote Park  TRAVELING BY BUS The Mall Bus Station is located approximately one mile from Mote Park.

faqs.question: Where is Rock The Mote Festival located in mote park?
faqs.answer: The main festival entrance will be situated opposite Mote Park Café, with Mote Park’s main entrance off Mote Avenue being the best way to access the site.

faqs.question: Is there disabled parking?
faqs.answer: There will be parking available for disabled customers in Mote Park’s over-flow car park.

faqs.question: Can we leave and re-enter?
faqs.answer: You unfortunately cannot leave and re-enter the event.

faqs.question: Will there be a disabled viewing area?
faqs.answer: Unfortunately there will not be a specific disabled viewing area, however please show yourblue badge upon arrival and their marshals will do their best to locate you as close to the stage as possible.

faqs.question: Is it safe?
faqs.answer: Each customer will be searched and so too will their bags. There will be a zero tolerance approach implemented by our experienced and professional security team.  All food, drinks (500ml of sealed bottled water is permitted), glass and sharp objects will beconfiscated upon entry. We ask that you do not bring perfume or any other valuable cosmetics to the eventbecause it will be confiscated and there is no guarantee that you will get it back. We take no responsibility forany lost valuables at the entrance or inside the event.  There will also be a medical area on site, where trained first-aiders and paramedicswill be available at any time.

faqs.question: What is the accessibility like?
faqs.answer: The event is fully wheelchair accessible.

faqs.question: What happens is there is bad weather?
faqs.answer: The weather shouldn’t affect the festival too much because of the time of year, however, the groundmay become wet and soft, so if the weather up to and including the day of the festival is wet, we would advise wearing your wellies and waterproof jackets!

faqs.question: Will there be disabled toilets?
faqs.answer: Yes, there will be numerous disabled toilets on site.

faqs.question: Tokens
faqs.answer:
DO I HAVE TO PURCHASE TOKENS FOR FOOD AND DRINK?Yes, Rock The Moat event site is completely cashless, which means you will have to purchase tokens for both food and drink at the event.  HOW MANY TOKENS DO I NEED?This depends on how much food and drink you intend to buy, however you can purchaseextra tokens throughout the event, should you need more.  There will be token booths where you can purchase tokens situated throughout the event site but please note, these tokens must be purchased in denominations of £10.00.  WHAT DO I DO WITH ANY EXTRA TOKENS?Unfortunately all tokens are non-refundable and therefore we ask that you only purchase whatyou intend to spend at the event (all tokens must be purchased in £10.00 denominations).  HOW CAN I PURCHASE TOKENS?You can purchase your tokens on the day with both cash and card.  WHY IS IT TOKENS ONLY?After using tokens at a number of our events last year, we found that using tokens for foodand drink significantly speeds up service, which results in more time for you all to enjoy the eventand less time queueing for food and drinks.  When purchasing food/drink with cash, staff will take money, get your items, go to the till andcount your change out and then return with your items and change, which take onaverage 2/3 minutes. With tokens, this is dramatically sped up, with tokens being taken and items being passed to the customer, which takes around 20/30 seconds.  Our token system also minimises the risk of COVID-19 transmission. 

 For full FAQ's please visit: https://rockthemote.com/faqs

faqs.question: What time is the event?
faqs.answer:
Opens: 1:00pm
Closes: 10:00pm Last entry: 7:00pm

faqs.question: When is Rock the Mote 2023?
faqs.answer: Saturday 5 - Sunday 6 August, 2023

faqs.answer: Reload Festival will take place on Saturday 5th August 2023.

you can get to reload festival by train, bus or car. these are the lines and routes that have stops nearby:

faqs.question: How much are Reload Festival tickets?
faqs.answer: Head to the tickets section to find out the latest ticket prices.

faqs.answer: Reload Festival is located in Thoresby Park in Nottingham.

faqs.question: Are pre-payment plan tickets available?
faqs.answer: Payment plan tickets are currently not on sale.

faqs.question: Is there an age restriction at Reload Festival?
faqs.answer: Yes there is , you will need to be 18 or older. Reload operate a challenge-21 policy upon Entry and at All Bars, if you look younger than 21, bring ID.

faqs.question: What happens If I bought a ticket and cannot attend?
faqs.answer:
Unfortunately we can’t issue you with a refund if you can’t make the event due to work commitments or your mates have dropped out. In these circumstances, we advise passing on your tickets privately to avoid losing out on the money spent. 

Refunds can only be offered if the event is cancelled or postponed, as agreed upon purchase.

faqs.question: When is Coloursfest 2023?
faqs.answer: Colourfest returns to Braehead Arena, Saturday 5th of August 2023.

faqs.question: How much are Coloursfest tickets?
faqs.answer: Tickets start from £45 + booking fee.

faqs.question: How do I get to Coloursfest?
faqs.answer: By BusBraehead has its own dedicated bus station and travel information centre. In fact over 820 buses pass through here every day. There are direct services from many locations including Glasgow city centre, Paisley, Renfrew, Erskine and Glasgow Airport.To plan your journey by bus, please visit Transport Direct. If you are traveling by public transport within Scotland, you can also use the Traveline Scotland journey planner.By CoachIf you are coming by coach, then we also have our own dedicated coach park next to the bus station. Please contact the arena if you are arriving with a coach party as some events have specific coach drop off points.By CarBraehead Arena can easily be reached by road from the whole of central Scotland and beyond.The venue has over 6500 dedicated FREE parking spaces. We are based at junction 26 (eastbound) and junction 25a (westbound) of Glasgow's M8 motorway.Please visit Transport Direct to plan your journey by car.By TrainOur nearest railway station is Paisley Gilmour Street. From there, you can catch one of the many regular buses to Braehead. If you are traveling through Glasgow city centre, then it is best to catch a bus from the city centre.The closest underground stop to Braehead is Govan, from where there are frequent buses. The journey time is around 12 minutes.For train times please use the National Rail website.By AirBraehead Arena is conveniently situated just four miles from Glasgow International Airport. For more information on flights to Glasgow visit the Glasgow Airport website at www.glasgowairport.com. The First Bus 747 service offers a direct link from Glasgow Airport to Braehead and Xscape. It runs every 30 minutes for most of the day and the journey time to Braehead is around 15 minutes. For timetable details, please use our Braehead journey planner.

faqs.question: Where is Coloursfest?
faqs.answer: Coloursfest is located in Braehead Arena which is around 7 miles from Glasgow city centre. It takes about 20 minutes from the city centre by bus or car. The postcode is G51 4BN.

faqs.question: What happens If I bought a ticket and cannot attend?
faqs.answer:
Unfortunately we can’t issue you with a refund if you can’t make the event due to work commitments or your mates have dropped out. In these circumstances, we advise passing on your tickets privately to avoid losing out on the money spent. 

Refunds can only be offered if the event is cancelled or postponed, as agreed upon purchase.

faqs.question: Does Coloursfest have onsite camping?
faqs.answer: No, Coloursfest is a non camping festival so camping equipment is not needed. It is however close to Glasgow City Centre so there is plenty of alternative accommodation to choose from.

faqs.question: How do I get to Coloursfest?
faqs.answer:
By Car - The venue is just off the M8, if you’re heading from Glasgow come off at Junction 25A and follow the signposts to the Arena. 

By Bus - There are several regular bus services operated by, McGills, First Glasgow, Stagecoach (West Scotland) and Colchri.

By Rail - There are regular train services from Paisley Gilmour Street, Glasgow Central/Queen Street (National Rail), Partick (National Rail and SPT Subway), Govan (SPT Subway).

faqs.question: Does Coloursfest have any age restrictions?
faqs.answer: Yes you must be 18 or over to attend Coloursfest. You may be asked to show photo ID.

faqs.question: Can I bring my own food and drink into Coloursfest?
faqs.answer: You are not allowed to bring your own food and drink into Coloursfest. There will be a wide variety of food and drink stalls inside the festival, serving up organic, vegetarian and vegan options.

faqs.question: Where is Out East Festival?
faqs.answer: Out East Festival is located within the grounds surrounding the neoclassical country house - Dalkeith Country Park.

faqs.question: What happens If I bought a ticket and cannot attend?
faqs.answer: Unfortunately we can’t issue you with a refund if you can’t make the event due to work commitments or your mates have dropped out. In these circumstances, we advise passing on your tickets privately to avoid losing out on the money spent.Refunds can only be offered if the event is canceled or postponed, as agreed upon purchase.

faqs.question: I’m disabled, what help is there?
faqs.answer: We always aim to provide the best experience for everyone and strive to constantly improve.   Personal assistant - pa Their ticket is provided on the expectation that they are willing and able to assist you, throughout your visit and in the event of an evacuation they are your main point of assistance. Crowd management personnel located near the viewing platform will assist in moving everybody to a place of safety.  Pa tickets will not be posted out and will be available only on the day for collectionTo qualify for the free carer/pa ticket, it is mandatory to provide one of the following forms of supporting documentation as evidence of your requirements along with your ticket order confirmation number: - PIP (Personal independence payment) - DLA – care and/or mobility - D/deaf or blind registration - The Access Card or equivalent with a +1 Icon for PA tickets - Blue Badge – permitted for parking only requests  Please note, the name on the purchased festival ticket must match the name on the evidence of entitlement provided in order for a free carer pass to be granted.  BEFORE BOOKING Please note Out East Festival is largely a green-field site, with some tarmac paths on the entrances and exits. While there are some sheltered areas, it is mainly an open-air event, Ground conditions are therefore weather dependent, therefore mobility across the site may become compromised. We ask you to consider this before booking a ticket.  COMPANION TICKET SCHEME We operate a companion ticket scheme, at no extra cost, for eligible customers, available only on Adult and Teen Tickets. These can be applied for when booking.  How To Book  If you know you’ll be applying for a companion ticket then please do not book a ticket for them at your initial booking, as this will not be refunded if your application is approved. Book the required number of festival tickets you need, minus companion. Apply for your companion ticket and submit supporting documentation using our Accessibility Application Form. Please got to https://www.outeastfest.co.uk/accessibility to apply.Applications will close on Monday 5th July 2022, unless sold out earlier.  ACCESSIBLE CAR PARKING Only one car is permitted per party for the registered accessibility festival goer in the Accessibility Car Park. Blue badge parking spaces can be booked on our access form,Any other vehicles must be parked in the General Car Park.  ACCESSIBLE DROP OFF If you’re being dropped off at the festival, there’s a drop off / pick up point within close proximity to the Accessibility Check-In Point. From the drop-off point to the Main Arena is approximately 200m over a gravel pathway and green-field site.  ACCESSIBLE FACILITIES Viewing platform at Main Stage (unsheltered) Wheelchair-accessible loos at viewing platform and each of the main toilet blocks throughout the arena. Induction loops will be available from the Accessibility Check-In Point upon arrival. Medical Tent with trained First Aiders. Electric wheelchair charging point located at the viewing platform Assistance dog resting area located at the Welfare tent. Lowered bars, which will also have large-print men- us. Refrigerated storage of medication if necessary.  ASSISTANCE DOGS While we cannot allow pets of any kind into the festival, registered assistance dogs are permitted. If you plan on bringing an assistance dog, please let us know in advance via the Accessibility Application Form so that we are adequately prepared for this. Otherwise, we cannot guarantee entry of the assistance dog.  DEAF & HARD OF HEARING CUSTOMERS A Sign Language Interpreting Services will at Out East Festival Friday and Saturday providing BSL Interpreting services. If this is a service you require please fill out our Accessibility Application Form so you can make the most of these services. We’d like to know your suggestions on what we have interpreted, please send all suggestions to accessibility@outeastfest.co.uk  TICKET ARRIVAL Your wristbands and any applicable accessibility passes will be available to collect from the Accessibility Check-In Point on arrival. Please ensure you have your confirmation email or mobile ticket ready to collect these.For any further questions regarding accessibility at Out East Festival, please contact us via accessibility@outeastfest.co.uk

faqs.question: Does Out East Festival have onsite camping?
faqs.answer: Yes, Out East Festival has camping areas available for tent pitching. The festival also accommodates for live-in vehicles and electrical hookups. Camping Tickets on sale soon.

faqs.question: Does Out East Festival have any age restrictions?
faqs.answer: No, there are no age restrictions at Out East Festival, any ages are welcome.
