faqs.question: I pay for my tickets monthly, when are the tickets sent out?
faqs.answer: Your tickets will be sent out 1 month after your last payment. eg. If your last payment was the 1st of June, your tickets will be emailed to you after the 1st of July.

faqs.question: Does Party at the Palace have any age restrictions?
faqs.answer: No all ages are welcome at Party at the Palace - there are adult and children's tickets available.Please note children’s ticket are as follows:Children aged 0-5 – FreeChildren aged 6 – 15 years – Child ticket applies16 yeas and over – Adult ticket applies

faqs.question: How do I get to Party at the Palace by car?
faqs.answer: We would encourage customers to consider the environment and choose alternative modes of getting to Party at The Palace, however if you need to bring a car, there is limited onsite parking at the event WHICH MUST BE BOOKED IN ADVANCE here: https://partyatthepalace.co.uk/product/car-park-tickets/ Only use the designated car park and follow directions from our event stewards. The speed limit around the parking areas is 5mph and must be observed. NO OVERNIGHT PARKING PERMITTED. Disabled parking – display blue badge to be admitted to the disabled parking area.

faqs.question: Can I get a Carers Ticket for Party at the Palace?
faqs.answer: They are willing to send out a free ticket for any individual who requires a carer or personal assistant to attend the Party at the Palace. An access request can be submitted via this form: https://partyatthepalace.co.uk/carers-ticket/

faqs.question: Where can I get dropped off/picked up at Party at the Palace?
faqs.answer: If you are being dropped off by car, taxi/private hire or mini-bus, we recommend the lay by on Blackness Road. This is a drop off point only and cars must not wait or park here. The pick up point after the event is the car park to the rear of Tesco. Taxis and cars can wait here safely without blocking the roads around the event.

faqs.question: Can I give or sell my Party in the Palace tickets to someone else?
faqs.answer: Yes. But please seek advice on the various safe and ethical ways of disposing of unwanted tickets and acquiring them.

faqs.question: What should I bring to Party at the Palace?
faqs.answer:
Only bring what you REALLY need. Bringing the kitchen sink will delay your entry and everybody behind you will hate you as well! So with that in mind, here’s a list of things you can bring: Please bring:
  • Your tickets – download them onto your phone or print them off.
  • I.D. – we operate a Challenge 25 policy across all bars.
  • Sensible footwear.
  • An empty water bottle for filling up at our water stations.
  • It’s an outdoor event in Scotland so pack some sun cream and a poncho.
  • Chairs and brollies are allowed in the marked zones. Please only use them with consideration to other customers.
  • Cash – we accept cards however the wi-fi can be patchy so money is a safer bet.
  • Medication – make sure you have any medication you require with you.

faqs.question: What should I not bring to Party at the Palace?
faqs.answer:
Please do not bring:
  • Food and drink. We have a large number of food outlets catering for all dietary requirements.
  • Tents or gazebos.
  • Fireworks or pyro of any kind.
  • Pets / animals
  • Professional camera/video/audio equipment with removable lenses
  • Drones
  • Glass bottles or glassware of any kind.

faqs.question: What time does Party at the Palace start?
faqs.answer: Gates open 12:30pm. First act 1.00pm. Last act on stage 8.50pm. Finishes 10:30pm. Times are approximate.

faqs.question: Are camping chairs allowed at Party at the Palace?
faqs.answer: While many find it comfortable and convenient taking in a small folding chair to sit on, they are deemed an inconvenience by others. To strike a balance, Party at the Park does allow people to bring in camping chairs however they will not be allowed to be positioned directly in front of the stage. There will be a ‘chair free zone’ in a stewarded area around 50 metres from the stage. There is a very large area beyond that in which you are welcome to ‘park’ your seating for the whole day and you can then of course move closer to the stage when you fancy getting into the thick of it and retiring back to your seats again – just like at the dancin! We would also ask you to think of the environment and take your chairs home with you.

faqs.question: When can I arrive / when do I have to leave?
faqs.answer:
Thursday 18th August: Car parks will be open from 9am. Box Offices and Campsites open at 10am. Campervans and Caravans/Trailer Tents fields open at 10am. Accessible campsite opens at 9am.

Fri/Sat/Sun: Car parks and Campsite entrances open at 7am.

Thurs/Fri/Sat/Sun: No entry or re-entry into the festival site after midnight on any night. No entry into the festival site after 8.30pm on Sunday.Monday 22nd August: Campsites close at midday and car parks at 2pm.

faqs.question: Disabled Access Information?
faqs.answer:
The following info is taken from the Camp Bestival Shropshire website...Applications for Camp Bestival Shropshire 2022 Access Facilities will open in early 2022.Please do contact the access team if you need any assistance and we can help where possible: shropshireaccess@campbestival.net.Accessible CampsiteOur accessible campsite includes many facilities & features to make your stay the best possible camping experience!Some of the facilities are: 
  • •    A great location with flat ground
  • •    Space to relax in a quieter campsite with great facilities
  • •    A car park next to the campsite in a safe, secure, and private location to make unloading easier
  • •    Ticket scanning and wristbanding in the campsite 
  • •    A dedicated access team with years of experience, providing 24-hour cover 
  • •    A dedicated food vendor
  • •    A Changing Places unit within the campsite
  • •    Sensory/chill out area in the arena
  • •    An accessible viewing platform at the Main Stage
  • •    An accessible viewing area in the Big Top
  • •    Accessible toilets at toilet blocks across the arena
Please read all the information below before attending Camp Bestival Shropshire.

SITE DESCRIPTION

Camp Bestival Shropshire is an outdoor event utilising the grounds of Weston Park. The majority of the grounds are flat and are serviced by a network of paths, however mobility problems are posed on grass areas, particularly in bad weather conditions. If it rains it may get muddy and access around the site (other than on paths) may be very difficult. Electric wheelchairs can tackle most areas without too much trouble but the ground can be uneven in places. Please bear this in mind when attending the event and come prepared for all weather conditions.There are some pathways located in the arena areas, but the majority of the festival is on short grass with firm soil.Please note we do not offer any internal transport due to the limitations of moving around the site.There are around 15 different stages and performance areas, which are located in the main arenas.

BOOKABLE ACCESS FACILITIES

All of our Access Facilities can be booked online through the Camp Bestival Shropshire Accessibility Application form. Please purchase your ticket for Camp Bestival Shropshire, once purchased please complete our application form. Before booking/applying please read our accessibility information below. 

2 FOR 1 – PERSONAL ASSISTANT TICKET

Customers requiring assistance throughout the festival are entitled to apply for one free pass for their Personal Assistant/Support worker. Please note that the customer requiring assistance must have a valid festival ticket before applying. Once you have purchased your ticket please complete this application form and send it back to us with proof of disability. Here are a few of the documents we accept:
  • • Middle or Higher rate DLA for care and/or mobility
  • • Receipt of Personal Independence Payment (PIP)
  • • Evidence of being severely sight impaired
  • • CredAbility Access Card – + 1 category requirement
  • • A recognised Assistance Dog ID Card.
In the event the festival sells out and you haven’t applied for you PA ticket please do not worry. If you have a valid festival ticket we will ensure a PA ticket is made available for you. 

HOW TO APPLY

**APPLICATIONS FOR CAMP BESTIVAL SHROPSHIRE 2022 ACCESSIBLE FACILITIES WILL OPEN LATER THIS YEAR**Please do contact the access team if you need any assistance and we can help where possible: shropshireaccess@campbestival.net.

THE PASS

The ONE FREE pass will be collected at Camp Bestival Shropshire when you present your matching ID upon arrival and are with your personal assistant. This will not be sent to you in advance, and we will not issue any PA passes without matching ID (Passport or Driving License), so please remember to bring this with you to avoid disappointment! Personal Assistants will also be able to access the viewing platform if there is space available at the time.If you feel you require a PA at the festival but do not have any of the above evidence, please contact us explaining your requirements, with any evidence you do have, and we will consider it on a case-by-case basis.

ACCESSIBLE CAMPSITE

Everyone wishing to camp in the Accessible Campsite will need to apply via the Camp Bestival Shropshire Accessibility Application form.Within the campsite we offer the following facilities:
  • •    Campsite office with 24 hours staff available
  • •    Accessible toilets
  • •    Standard Toilets for friends/family
  • •    Accessible showers
  • •    A changing places unit containing a raised bed with a hoist above. Hoist slings will not be available. If you need to use this unit, please bring your own slings.
  • •    Charging points for electric wheelchair users – located in our pop up tent
  • •    Fridge for storing medication – located within the campsite office
  • •    Fresh Water Point
  • •    Waste Disposal Point
Please note that a maximum of 6 people (including yourself and your Personal Assistant) may camp together. Each party will be given a pitch measuring 5x7m. All of your party need to be able to fit within your pitch.Please note, cars are not permitted to stay in the campsite, once unloaded cars need to be parked in the access car park close by.All groups are asked to abide by this so that we can fit as many people in the campsite as possible. Please be considerate of others - if you exceed the pitch size, you are taking space away from others!

VIEWING PLATFORM

The Main Stage – The viewing platform is located at the back of The Main Stage Field.We also have a small viewing platform located at the back of the Big Top tent.The viewing platforms & areas are only accessible to those with the correct passes. Our platform has a 1+1 policy so space can be used for those who need it most, however, we do appreciate that at times this may not be possible if you have children or adults who can’t be separated. If this is the case please inform our staff and we will do our very best to accommodate you.There are accessible toilets located on the viewing platforms.

ACCESSIBLE PARKING

Everyone wishing to park in the accessible car park will need to apply via the Camp Bestival Shropshire Accessibility Application form.All those approved to camp in the Accessible Campsite will automatically have space to camp in the Accessible Car Park.If you are a day ticket holder and have a Blue Badge, you can apply to park in the Accessible Car Park via our online Application Form. Only Blue Badge holders, or those in the Accessible Campsite will be able to use the accessibility car park.If you are camping in a different campsite to the accessibility campsite, it is not recommended for you to park in the accessible car park, as this is a further distance away. For all other campsites, we recommend you use either the general car park or campsite specific car parks.

TRAVEL GUIDE

ARRIVING BY CARIf you are camping in the Accessible Campsite or need to access the Accessible Carpark, please follow the directions to the Camp Bestival site. Once you are close by you will pick up the dedicated road signs which take you to the accessibility campsite and car park.For all other campsites, please follow the information on our Travel Info page.Please always use festival directions when you see them, and turn off SAT NAVs as these are not always up-to-date and may change due to event situations.Your parking pass for the Accessible Campsite/Car Park will be collected at the festival where it will be allocated to one vehicle only (this also includes a campervan).ARRIVING BY PUBLIC TRANSPORTIf you are arriving by any bus service or taxi, it is a very short distance to the Accessible Campsite.Please contact us directly if you are travelling any other way.

ARRIVAL GUIDE

OPENING & CLOSING TIMESAll car parks and campsites will open at 9am on Thursday 18th August 2022.All campsites close at 12pm on Monday 22nd August 2022 (car parks close at 2pm).ON-SITE TEAMOur dedicated Accessibility on-site team will be on site all weekend. They are based at the Accessible Campsite and also have a presence at the viewing platform at The Castle Stage.

ASSISTANCE DOGS

If you would like to bring an Assistance Dog to the festival, please contact us directly first. We will usually request proof that the dog is registered with an organisation that is a member of Assistance Dogs UK.

TOILETS

Accessible toilets will be provided across site. We will provide further info on their location closer to the festival.There are accessible toilets at both the Main Stage and Big Top viewing platforms.

MEDICAL AND WELFARE PROVISIONS

If you have any medication that needs to be kept cool, we have fridges available for you to use in the medical tent and also in the access campsite office. The medical tent is open 24 hours a day however the campsite office is only open during the daytime.

STROBE LIGHTING

We would like to advise all customers that flicker, laser, strobe and other lighting effects may be in use at the festival site.

OTHER INFORMATION

We recognise that some, particularly those with specific learning difficulties may need to find a space to step away from the crowds and noise. We do our best to provide this but it is difficult in a festival environment.You will receive a full information pack before the festival detailing arrival information and other FAQs.Camp Bestival is committed to making our festival as accessible as possible for all our customers. In working with Attitude is Everything we are always looking to make our festival an inclusive space for everyone.

CONTACT DETAILS

Our Access Officer is responsible for all access-related enquiries and applications. If the information above does not answer your query or you require our information on PDF format you can contact them via the following;Email – shropshireaccess@campbestival.netPostal – Camp Bestival Shropshire, Farmilloe, 30 St John Street, London, EC1M 4AYYou should receive a response within roughly 5 working days. This may be longer when nearer the time of the festival, so please do try to be as patient as possible.

faqs.question: When is Camp Bestival Shropshire 2023?
faqs.answer: Camp Bestival Shropshire takes place from Thursday 17th August to Sunday 20th August 2023.

faqs.question: How much is the car park?
faqs.answer:
If you haven’t already bought your car parking tickets in advance (available from your point of purchase priced £20), Car Parking is also payable when you arrive in cash at a cost of £25. You only need to buy a ticket once and it will be valid for the whole weekend, no matter how many times you come and go. Day Car Parking Tickets will also available priced £15 per day, payable in cash on arrival. 

NB: Weekend Ticket holders who are not camping should ensure they retain their ticket so it can be used for all 4 days.

faqs.question: Where is Camp Bestival Shropshire?
faqs.answer: Camp Bestival Shropshire is held at Weston Park.Weston-under-Lizard, Shifnal, TF11 8LE

title: Weyfest
title_location: Rural Life Centre Tilford Surrey in Farnham

faqs.question: What time can I arrive at/leave the camp site at Weyfest?
faqs.answer: The Weyfest camp site is open from 10am each day and closes at midday on Monday. You are free to leave the campsite at any time during the weekend but if you wish to return, you must keep your wristband on.Please do not arrive earlier than the opening time as you will be directed to the car park in order to keep the road clear. Once the site is open, preference will be given to traffic on the road and you may have to remain in the car park until the road is clear of traffic ie. by arriving early you will most likely enter the site later.

faqs.question: Where is Weyfest?
faqs.answer: Weyfest is located at:The Rural Life Centre, Reeds Road, Tilford, Farnham, Surrey, GU10 2DL.

faqs.question: Are there any concessions for the disabled at Weyfest?
faqs.answer: A. We assume that, whereas the disabled person wants to come to Weyfest, the carer may not and so, on the production of proof of disability at the box office on arrival, the carer will be entitled to purchase a carer ticket at half of the gate price. This is limited to one carer for disabled persons over the age of 16 for festival entry only and does not include camping or campervan passes. Where it is imperative that a second carer is necessary to accompany the disabled person, documentation to that effect must be presented to the Box Office staff on arrival. All discount carer passes are sold at the discretion of the Box Office staff following receipt of an acceptable form of proof of disability.Acceptable forms of proof of disability are:Eligibility for Middle or Higher rate DLA (for care or mobility) orReceipt of enhanced rate PIP.A disabled parking badge, disabled railcard or any concession other than those listed above is not valid.

faqs.question: What happens If I bought a ticket and cannot attend?
faqs.answer:
Unfortunately we can’t issue you with a refund if you can’t make the event due to work commitments or your mates have dropped out. In these circumstances, we advise passing on your tickets privately to avoid losing out on the money spent.

Refunds can only be offered if the event is cancelled or postponed, as agreed upon purchase.

faqs.question: Does Weyfest have any age restrictions?
faqs.answer: No, all ages are welcome! There's a reconstructed village playground, a sci-fi zone and plenty of activities for kids too. It's great for the whole family! All ages are welcome at Weyfest, Children under 10 are admitted FREE. Children under 16 must be accompanied by a ticket-holding adult.

faqs.question: Is a camping pass required for each camper at Weyfest?
faqs.answer: Yes, a camping pass is required for each occupant of a tent, glamp, caravan or campervan at Weyfest.

faqs.question: How do I get to Weyfest?
faqs.answer: By Car - The site is 3 miles south of Farnham, just off the A287, midway between Frensham and Tilford villages.By Rail - The nearest station is Farnham railway station. It is approximately 3 to 3.5 miles away from the site.  There are plenty of taxis available in the taxi rank but sadly no buses that go to the Rural Life Centre. Festival address: Rural Life Living Museum, Reeds Road, Tilford, Farnham, Surrey GU10 2DL Tel: 01252 795571

faqs.question: Are there any disabled parking and disabled camping facilities at Weyfest?
faqs.answer: For those that are not camping there is a disabled parking area adjacent to the festival entrance. On arrival please let the stewards know that you are disabled and they will direct you to the parking area. If you are camping, there is a separate disabled parking and camping area adjacent to the exit of the campsite. There are also disabled toilets in this area.

faqs.question: Are there tickets available for Weyfest on the gate?
faqs.answer: Weyfest do not reserve any tickets for sale on the gate so if they sell out before the weekend they will not be available on the gate. If tickets sell out Weyfest will announce it on the website so please check the home page before leaving home if you intend to buy tickets on the day.

faqs.question: Do I need to bring ID?
faqs.answer: Not if you are over 21. If you are under 21 please read the Challenge 21 rules below: Weyfest will be operating the Challenge 21 initiative which aims to cut down on underage alcohol sales and highlights the fact that: “if you are lucky enough to look under 21 you will be asked to prove that you are over 18 when you buy alcohol”. Acceptable forms of proof are: photocard driving licence, passport or PASS* accredited proof of age card. The ‘Challenge 21’ initiative encourages sellers of alcohol to ask for official forms of identification from anyone that appears to be under 21-years-old.  If a trader suspects someone is under that age and doesn’t have the relevant identification, eg passport, photo driving licence, citizencard, they will not be served.  Stewards on site also have the power to request proof of age if they see anyone drinking alcohol who appears to be under age. The scheme is being promoted because it can be very difficult to identify accurately whether someone is 17, 18, 19 or 20 but is usually easier to determine whether someone is 21. However if young people have official identification to prove they are over the age of 18 they will of course be served legally.

faqs.question: Is it OK if I want to camp for just one night at Weyfest?
faqs.answer: Camping passes are valid for the whole weekend but you may camp for one or two nights at Weyfest if you wish.

faqs.question: Are there any parking facilities at Weyfest?
faqs.answer: Yes there's loads of FREEEEEEEEEEE parking!

faqs.question: How accessible is the Weyfest site for the disabled?
faqs.answer: Almost all the site has good disabled access including the arboretum. Disabled toilet facilities are available for the festival and disabled campers will be situated close to disabled toilets on the campsite.

faqs.question: Do you need a ticket for an Under 10 year-old at Weyfest?
faqs.answer: Under 10’s are free. You can simply ask for Under 10 tickets on arrival but Weyfest prefer it if you add them to your basket when ordering your tickets so that they know how many will be coming and can ensure that there will be adequate amusements for them in the Kidzone.

faqs.question: Can I bring my own food and drink into Weyfest?
faqs.answer: To enable the festival to comply with the four licensing objectives, alcohol cannot be brought into the festival arena but can be brought onto the camp site. Weyfest does, however, provide a very reasonably priced bar. Glass cannot be brought in to the festival for health & safety reasons but is allowed on the camp site. Please note that for safety reasons bags will be searched on entry to the arenas and entry will be refused if alcohol/glass/knives (or any potential weapons) are found in your bag. Small quantities of food are permitted in the arena

faqs.question: I have lost my Weyfest tickets. Can you replace them?
faqs.answer: If you have eTickets we can resend them to you (but check your spam folders first). Like any other box office or ticket agency we cannot replace lost paper tickets.

faqs.question: Can I leave my car in the car park if I leave site?
faqs.answer: Yes, as long as it is removed by midday on the Monday

faqs.question: Are there toilet facilities (including disabled facilities), showers and water supplies on the camp site at Weyfest??
faqs.answer: There are fresh water standpipes at regular distances around the campsite and water butts for fire fighting. The main campsite toilets are posh! – and there are a few single toilets for convenience.Showers are provided – tokens can be purchased from the ticket desk or in advance from the Tickets page. Showers are not available on Monday.

faqs.question: Is there a separate viewing area for the disabled at Weyfest?
faqs.answer: There are raised viewing areas for the disabled at the main stage locations

faqs.question: Are there any other restrictions on what I can bring into Weyfest?
faqs.answer:
• No Fireworks 
  • No Professional camera equipment (The use of tripods, lens cases and other professional equipment is not allowed without press accreditation)
  • No windshields in the festival arena
  • No gazebos
  • No glass

faqs.question: Is there a bicycle rack on site that I can store my bicycle in?
faqs.answer: There is a bicycle rack adjacent to the on-site café within the festival arena. Please bring your own lock.

faqs.question: Are there any electrical hook-ups on the campsite at Weyfest?
faqs.answer: There are a limited amount of electrical hook-ups available for purchase in advance (only) from the Weyfest page.Hook-ups are ONLY available for the Glamping area, motorhome/campervan site and disabled camping area and are available until approx 10 am Monday

faqs.question: Is smoking permitted at Weyfest?
faqs.answer: As the venue is an outdoor museum, with lots of valuable wooden artefacts to protect, smoking  and vaping is restricted to the Beekeeper’s Stage arena and campsites.

faqs.question: Can I park my car next to my tent or caravan at Weyfest?
faqs.answer: Unfortunately not. It is a health & safety requirement that cars must not be parked adjacent to tents, campervans or caravans. However, the car park area is very close to the camping area and you are permitted to drop off your camping equipment in the campsite before parking your car. Caravans must be unhitched and the car parked in the adjacent car park.

faqs.question: Can I bring my dog to Weyfest?
faqs.answer: Yes, dogs are welcome except in the cafe and some eating areas but must be kept on a lead and away from the speaker stacks at all times.

faqs.question: Can I sleep in my van / car at Weyfest?
faqs.answer: No. Camping is restricted to designated camping areas and vehicles other than caravans, campervans or vehicles permanently converted for the specific purpose of accommodation are not permitted to stay on the campsite. Sleeping in the car park is not permitted.

faqs.question: I've had a bad experience at other festivals with insufficient or unclean toilets. Are your facilities any better?
faqs.answer: Oh yes.. We have plenty of toilets that are cleaned and serviced constantly throughout the weekend and topped up with soft toilet paper.. The majority of these toilets are posh!

faqs.question: What campervan pitch size should I buy for Weyfest?
faqs.answer: The following pitch sizes are available: SMALL CAMPERVAN (vehicle size up to 5 metres long x 2.5 metres wide) LARGE CAMPERVAN or SMALL CARAVAN (vehicle size up to 6 metres long x 2.5 metres wide) XL CAMPERVAN or CARAVAN (Over 6 metres long OR 2.5 metres wide) Please note that each occupant of a campervan or caravan will require a camping pass.

faqs.question: Is there a cash machine on site so I can withdraw cash?
faqs.answer: Sadly not – we’ve tried this but the provider charged the customer too much per transaction and so it was hardly used. The General Store and some other traders offer cashback however.

faqs.question: Can I put a tent next to my friend's caravan/campervan?
faqs.answer: Sorry, no. It’s a health & safety thing.. However, there is a tent zone in the campervan field for those who wish to camp near to their friends that are in campervans. On arrival, simply follow signs for the motorhome/campervan site.

faqs.question: Will the steam and diesel trains be running over the weekend?
faqs.answer: Yes they will! Please note that the railway is run by the Old Kiln Museum and there is a small charge to help maintain it.

faqs.question: Can I have a barbeque or fire at the camp site at Weyfest?
faqs.answer: BBQ’s are allowed but must be off the ground. Flat throwaway BBQ’s or any type of open fire are not allowed.

faqs.question: I can't find the answer to my query. Who do I contact?
faqs.answer: Please send your query to info@weyfest.co.uk

title: A New Day Festival
title_location: Mt Ephraim Gardens Hernhill Faversham Kent in Faversham

faqs.question: When is A New Day Festival 2023?
faqs.answer: A New Day Festival returns to Mount Ephpraim Gardens Friday 18th August - Sunday 20th August 2023.

faqs.question: Does A New Day Festival have onsite camping?
faqs.answer: Yes camping is available on site for A New Day Festival with pitches starting from £6 plus booking fee.

faqs.question: Are there any parking facilities at A New Day Festival?
faqs.answer: There are parking facilities and most importantly, it's free!

faqs.question: How much are A New Day Festival tickets?
faqs.answer: Please see the ticket section for more information on ticket prices.

faqs.question: Are there any concessions for the disabled?
faqs.answer: We have had to review our policy, so please read carefully. A person requiring a carer must be in possession of higher rate DLA or enhanced rate PIP with a care component. Just having a Blue Badge will not qualify for carer concession. Disabled people with a clear need for a carer can buy a ticket with carer option on the ticket page.

faqs.question: Where is A New Day Festival?
faqs.answer: A New Day Festival is located in Mount Ephpraim Gardens in Faversham, Kent. The postcode is ME13 9TX.

faqs.question: How do I get to A New Day Festival?
faqs.answer: By Car - Situated between Boughton and Hernhill Mount Ephpraim Gardens is approximately 1 mile from the end of the M2. By Rail - The closest railway station is Faversham Station.

faqs.question: How do I access my tickets?
faqs.answer: Your RapidScan tickets are ready for you as soon as your order completes. Just head to www.skiddle.com/orders or the 'my tickets section within the app for full access to your tickets.

faqs.question: Are there any disabled parking and disabled camping facilities?
faqs.answer:
For those that are not camping there is a disabled parking area adjacent to the festival entrance. On arrival please let the stewards know that you are disabled and they will direct you to the parking area. Disabled parking & camping is STRICTLY for Blue Badge holders. Any vehicle in disabled area without a blue badge will be removed!  
If you are camping, there is a separate disabled parking and camping area adjacent to the exit of the campsite. There are also disabled toilets in this area.

faqs.question: Does A New Day Festival have any age restrictions?
faqs.answer: A New Day Festival is a family festival there are no age restrictions. You may be asked to show photo ID.

faqs.question: What happens If I bought a ticket and cannot attend?
faqs.answer: Unfortunately we can’t issue you with a refund if you can’t make the event due to work commitments or your mates have dropped out. In these circumstances, we advise passing on your tickets privately to avoid losing out on the money spent. Refunds can only be offered if the event is cancelled or postponed, as agreed upon purchase.

faqs.question: How accessible is the site for the disabled?
faqs.answer: Almost all the site has good disabled access. However, there are several steep gradients - especially in front of the main stage - and there are no tracking mats provided for the pathways, should it rain. We advise that guests in standard self-propelled wheelchairs may not find the site very straightforward. We recommend the use of Free-Wheel adaptors or, if you prefer, the rental of motorised scooters via Shopmobility at Whitefriars Canterbury (2nd Floor Car Park - They validate parking too!). Scooters should be booked in advance by calling 01227 459889   Disabled toilet facilities are available for the festival and disabled campers will be situated close to disabled toilets on the campsite.

faqs.question: What are the entry times?
faqs.answer: Start: 12:00pmEnd: 11:00pm

faqs.question: Can I charge my disability scooter during the festival?
faqs.answer: Scooters can be charged next to the disabled viewing platform during the day. We are looking into the possibility of overnight charging facilities but can’t promise anything just yet.

faqs.question: Can I bring my own food and drink into A New Day Festival?
faqs.answer: You are not allowed to bring your own food and drink into A New Day Festival site however you can take them onto the campsites. There will be a wide variety of food and drink stalls inside the festival, serving up organic, vegetarian and vegan options.

faqs.question: Can I bring fold-up chairs, windbreaks or gazebos into A New Day Festival?
faqs.answer: Fold up chairs are allowed into the festival but you are asked to pack them away during the evening when the arenas are reaching their busiest capacity. Windbreaks or gazebos are not permitted into the festival.

faqs.question: What are the set times for A New Day Festival?
faqs.answer: The specific timings are confirmed much closer to the date of the festival, usually on social media. Make sure to keep an eye on A New Day's Facebook page for updates!

faqs.question: When is All Points East 2023?
faqs.answer: All Points East 2023 is held over 2 weekends from Friday 18th August - Sunday 27th August 2023.

faqs.question: Where is All Points East?
faqs.answer: All Points East is located in Victoria Park, London.

faqs.question: How much are tickets for Lost Village?
faqs.answer: Lost Village tickets are released in phases, with each phase increasing slightly in price.

faqs.question: How to get to Lost village festival by train.
faqs.answer:
The nearest train station is Newark North Gate (approximately 10 minutes by car) and Lincoln  Central (approximately 15 minutes).

There will be frequent shuttle buses between Newark Northgate and the festival site.

There are direct trains to Newark North Gate from many major cities, including the following:

London 80 mins

Leeds 60 mins

Peterborough 33 mins

Nottingham 40 mins

York 45 mins

Newcastle  110 mins

Manchester 120 mins

Edinburgh 200 mins

 

For more information visit National Rail. There will be frequent shuttle buses running from Newark Northgate to the Lost Village site.

faqs.question: Is there Disabled access at Lost Village
faqs.answer: If you are disabled or care for someone who is, please drop them an email - hello@lostvillagefestival.com and they will be very happy to assist you in every way that they can.

faqs.question: What are the entry times?

faqs.question: Are pre-payment plan tickets available for Lost Village?

faqs.question: How to get to Lost Village by car/ coach.
faqs.answer:
Car

Our site is 10 minutes from Lincoln City centre. There will be official Lost Village parking at the cost of £20 per vehicle. Please sign-up to our Newsletter via the homepage for more information on how purchase a parking ticket (details released February).To use our official parking you must purchase a parking ticket prior to the festival.

Coach

Coaches will be running to the event from several key locations around the counter, operated by Big Green Coach.You can book your coach journey now by heading to their website HEREFor every customer who books travel with Big Green Coach they sponsor and protect 5 square foot of Amazonian Rainforest for 10 years!

faqs.question: How do I get to cinch presents Creamfields North?
faqs.answer: By Car - You can reach the creamfields site easily by the signposts clearly marked. Creamfields is located close to Liverpool and Manchester. Please ensure taxi drivers follow the signs for drop-off and pick-up only.By Creamfields Shuttle - The Creamfields shuttle bus service runs from Manchester, Liverpool and Warrington. The shuttle buses run throughout the day and night to and from the festival site.By Big Green Coach - WEEKEND RETURN COACHPicking up from 55 locations: Aberdeen, Barnsley, Basingstoke, Birmingham, Bournemouth, Bradford, Brighton, Bristol, Cambridge, Canterbury, Cardiff, Carlisle, Chelmsford, Cheltenham, Colchester, Coventry, Crawley, Darlington, Dartford (Bluewater), Derby, Doncaster, Dundee, Edinburgh, Exeter, Falkirk, Gillingham, Glasgow, Gloucester, Grimsby, Hull, Leeds, Leicester, London Victoria, Luton, Middlesbrough, Milton Keynes, Newcastle-Upon-Tyne, Newport, Northampton, Norwich, Nottingham, Oxford, Perth, Plymouth, Portsmouth, Reading, Romford, Scunthorpe, Southampton, Stirling, Sunderland, Swansea, Taunton, Worcester and York.DAY RETURN COACHPicking up from: Birmingham, Bradford, Coventry, Leeds, London Victoria, Nottingham, Sheffield and Stoke-on-Trent.By Rail - The closest train stations to Creamfields are Runcorn Station, Warrington Central, Warrington Bank Quay and Liverpool Lime Street. Shuttle buses run from Warrington, Liverpool and Manchester.

faqs.question: When is Creamfields North 2023?
faqs.answer: Creamfields North returns in 2023, date to be confirmed...

faqs.question: What happens If I bought a ticket and cannot attend?
faqs.answer: Unfortunately we can’t issue you with a refund if you can’t make the event due to work commitments or your mates have dropped out. In these circumstances, we advise passing on your tickets privately to avoid losing out on the money spent.Refunds can only be offered if the event is cancelled or postponed, as agreed upon purchase.

faqs.question: Where is Creamfields North?
faqs.answer: Creamfields North is located in Daresbury, Cheshire in the North West of England near to Liverpool and Manchester.

faqs.question: How do I collect my ticket(s) on the day?
faqs.answer: If you have to collect your tickets on site then please head to the relevant box office to collect. Day ticket holders collect at the NORTH box office. Weekend camping ticket holders collect at the SOUTH box office. Please ensure that you have a valid form of photo I.D. ready to show and your confirmation email which can be shown on your smartphone.

faqs.question: Do you offer international delivery on tickets?
faqs.answer: Yes. When checking out please select 'international delivery' to ensure that your tickets are sent to you without delay. You will be sent a tracking number once your order is dispatched. Your tikcets will arrive no later than 48 hours before you're due to attend the fiirst day of the event and someone will need to sign for the delivery. Please note, international delivery may not be available to all countries. If we're unable to deliver to your address we will contact you to arrange a collection from the event box office.

title: Solfest
title_location: North Lakes Country Park in Silloth, Cumbria

faqs.question: How much are Solfest tickets?
faqs.answer: Adults Weekend ticket start at £109.95 plus booking fee, with Child Weekend tickets from £25 plus booking fee. Group family discounts are available, plus monthly payment plans.

faqs.question: What time do I have to be off site at the end of the festival?
faqs.answer: You must be off site by sunset on the Monday Bank Holiday.

faqs.question: I’m disabled, what help is there?
faqs.answer:
There will be as much assistance as we can provide on a case-by-case basis. There is no concession for a disabled person but you may bring a carer free of charge. Please purchase the tickets you require (adult, young persons, children and Thursday camping) from skiddle and upload the relevant forms to them. We can provide electric hook ups for powered wheelchairs but please contact us in advance to arrange this, or for more information. Access scheme
For this event, we're using the Skiddle Access Scheme by offering Personal Assistant tickets for customers who need to be accompanied. A Personal Assistant ticket is to be offered for free or discounted when somebody with a disability requires a carer to be in attendance with them. To automatically be eligible, please provide a copy of one of the following pieces of documentation listed below.
>Front page of DLA / PIP (no specific rate)
>Front page of Attendance Allowance letter (no specific rate)
>Evidence that registered severely sight impaired (blind)
>Recognised Assistance Dog ID card
>Credability's Access Card 
If this applies to you then, please book the tickets you require (not including the Personal Assistant ticket) and contact the Skiddle Customer Care team with your documentation along with your 16-digit order reference number by submitting a support request here: https://help.skiddle.com/en/

faqs.question: When is Solfest 2023?
faqs.answer: Solfest returns to North Lakes Country Park Thursday 24th - Sunday 27th August 2023.

faqs.question: Does Solfest have onsite camping?
faqs.answer: Yes! Solfest has free camping, included with weekend tickets. There is a quiet campsite and noisey option, the Shoreside, which opens early from 5pm on Thursday 24th August.

faqs.question: Can I pay on the gate?
faqs.answer: Tickets will be available on the gate as long as we don’t sell out in advance. For guaranteed entry, we recommend you buy your tickets online before arriving here.

faqs.question: Is there somewhere I can park so that I can leave site early?
faqs.answer: If you need to get your car off site during the weekend, please explain to the stewards, you’ll need to leave your car in day parking, as we don’t allow any vehicle movements on the campsites over the weekend wherever possible.

faqs.question: I am attending Solfest as a Carer, do I need to buy a ticket?
faqs.answer: No. Carers come FREE to Solfest. To claim your free Carers ticket, please purchase the tickets you require (adult, young persons, children and Thursday camping) with the exception of the Carers’ ticket. Skiddle now handle all of these requirements and will sort it out for you from their website.

faqs.question: Where is Solfest?
faqs.answer: Solfest is located in North Lakes Country Park which is around 4 miles north of Silloth town centre, in Cumbria. It takes 35 minutes to get there from Carlisle, and 50 minutes from Penrith, by car. The postcode is CA74NQ.

faqs.question: Does the ticket price include camping?
faqs.answer: Yes. Friday, Saturday and Sunday night camping is included in the ticket price. You can arrive on Thursday if you add one Thursday Camping supplement per adult to your order.

faqs.question: Does Solfest have any age restrictions?
faqs.answer: There are no age restrictions to attend Solfest. All ages and families are welcome.

faqs.question: Can I arrive on Thursday?
faqs.answer: Yes, but adults (18+) will need to purchase advance Thursday Camping tickets. This is a £15 supplement which must be purchased at the same time as your tickets. Anyone under the age of 16 must be accompanied by an adult with a valid ticket and thursday camping pass. You must get to the site between 9am and 8pm on Thursday because moving vehicles around the camping areas as it gets dark poses a significant safety risk. The gates will be closed at 8pm on Thursday and reopen on Friday at 9am. The main arenas will open at noon on Friday.

faqs.question: What time does the festival start?
faqs.answer: The campsites will open at 9am and close at 8pm on Thursday to those of you with a Thursday Camping Ticket. The campsites will reopen on Friday at 9am. The main festival arena opens at 1pm on Friday.

faqs.question: Is there a family camping area?
faqs.answer: Yes. we have a family campsite, close to the kids arena and designed for families.

faqs.question: Can I bring my own food and drink into Solfest?
faqs.answer: Yes, you are free to bring your own food and drink to Solfest. Glass is not permitted within the main festival arena. There will be a wide variety of food and drink stalls inside the festival, serving up organic, vegetarian and vegan options.

faqs.question: What are the entry times?
faqs.answer:
Thursday (requires Thursday Entry Add On Ticket)
9am-9pmFriday
9am-9pmSaturday
9am-9pmSunday
9am-9pm*Times subject to change Weekend Camping tickets allow campsite access from Friday 9am until Monday 5pm. To access on Thursday, you must purchase a Thursday Entry Ticket.

faqs.question: Will there be a cash machine on the festival site?
faqs.answer: No. But a free bus runs to Aspatria and Silloth over the weekend if you need to withdraw extra cash. The bar will have contactless cashpoints this year.

faqs.question: Is there a quiet camping area?
faqs.answer: Yes. Townside (Quiet Camping) is the place to go if you want to sleep when you return to your camp, but remember wherever you are camped, it is unreasonable to expect absolute silence all night – it is a music festival after all!

faqs.question: Can I bring or buy alcohol?
faqs.answer: Yes, but it’s exactly the same at Solfest as anywhere else. We would ask that you do not bring glass into the arena and that you use our recycling points when you’re finished. Under-age drinking is not permitted. Your adult ticket/wristband has nothing to do with the sale of alcohol or any other licensed products. The law is the law. If you are asked for ID and you do not have any, you will not be served alcohol.

faqs.question: Is there an online program showing which acts are on when?
faqs.answer: No. Solfest wants you to enjoy the whole of the experience which is why they publish a programme of events prior to the festival starting. Solfest will tell you who is performing but never when.

faqs.question: Can I bring my campervan / caravan / trailer tent?
faqs.answer: Yes. We do allow live-in vehicles, vans, caravans, campervans, motor-homes and trailer tents. There’s a small extra charge for your live-in vehicle, van, caravan, campervan, motor-home or trailer tent. We would always encourage you to share transport where possible (for the environment’s sake), arrive early to get a decent spot and travel in convoy to help reduce traffic disruption in the local area. We can’t guarantee a level pitch and we do not provide electric hook ups. If you intend to arrive on Thursday, you will need one additional Thursday camping ticket for each adult, as well as the vehicle pass.

faqs.question: What happens If I bought a ticket and cannot attend?
faqs.answer: Unfortunately we can’t issue you with a refund if you can’t make the event due to work commitments or your mates have dropped out. In these circumstances, we advise passing on your tickets privately to avoid losing out on the money spent. Refunds can only be offered if the event is cancelled or postponed, as agreed upon purchase.

faqs.question: Will you have programs / timetables for the weekend?
faqs.answer: Yes. Programmes will be available at the information area on site over the weekend. Solfest doesn't publish information in advance, mostly because instead of coming just one-band, they'd like people to come for the whole weekend. But, also, owing to the nature of the event, timings are subject to a bit of change, hence leaving the publishing to as late as possible.

faqs.question: Does it cost more for a campervan / caravan / trailer tent?
faqs.answer: Yes, to encourage people to use public transport wherever possible there’s a small additional fee per vehicle.

faqs.question: Are pre-payment plan tickets available?
faqs.answer: Yes Payment Plan tickets are available so you can spread the cost of your ticket over multiple smaller payments.

faqs.question: What time is “my favourite band” playing?
faqs.answer: Because we want people to come and enjoy the whole festival experience and not just cherry pick one band, we do not release the times and days acts will perform until the start of the festival. Our Programme Policy has more details.

faqs.question: Can I camp with my friends?
faqs.answer: Yes, but we cannot guarantee it, so it’s best to arrive early and as a group. We do not allow people to reserve, hold, mark, cordon off or otherwise claim a specific camping space so please all arrive together to avoid disappointment.

faqs.question: How many nights of camping are included in the weekend ticket price?
faqs.answer: You may camp Friday, Saturday and Sunday nights with your Solfest ticket. If you would like to arrive early and camp on Thursday night too, you must purchase one Thursday Camping supplement per adult ticket.

faqs.question: Is the festival family friendly?
faqs.answer: Yes. They pride themselves on having something for everyone, from workshops and events in the Healing Garden to activities in the Children’s Arena, and a vast array of music and performance spaces around the site. Solfest want grans, granddads, brothers, sisters, mums, dads, aunts and uncles to join in the fun and have a brilliant time together.

faqs.question: Can I park where I camp?
faqs.answer: Due to changes in licensing regulations all vehicles must be parked separately from tents. We aim to keep camping and parking as convenient as possible while still complying with out license. This condition has been added to the license for your safety and we hope you will help by following the new directions when on site.

faqs.question: Do I have to pay extra for my campervan / caravan / trailer tent?
faqs.answer: Yes. A Small addiitonal fee is charged for motorised vehicles. This can be purchased with your tickets.

faqs.question: Can I bring my dog?
faqs.answer: No. At the request of the landowner, pets are not permitted for safety reasons. We recommend a local boarding kennels, Grass Roots Kennels who offer a great service for our festival goers dogs.

faqs.question: Can I have a campfire?
faqs.answer: Unfortunately, due to significant damage to the land during 2013, the land owner has requested that there are NO CAMPFIRES within camping areas. We are planning to have a large communal campfire in each camping field.

faqs.question: Does my child need their own ticket?
faqs.answer: Yes, with the exception of Carers, everyone at Solfest must purchase a ticket. Children three years old or under will get their tickets for FREE but you must still order them.

faqs.question: Can I charge my mobile phone on site?
faqs.answer: Yes. You can charge your phone in the Information Tent just inside the main entrance to the arena, ask a steward for directions.

faqs.question: Will there be showers and washing facilities?
faqs.answer: A limited number of hot showers will be available operating just outside the entrance to the festival site next to disabled camping and close to family camping. Showers are limited in number and are token operated for a small fee. Taps are located at regular intervals around the perimeter of the camping fields.

faqs.question: When is Reading Festival 2023?
faqs.answer: Reading Festival returns to Richfield Avenue on Friday 25th - Sunday 27th August 2023.

faqs.question: How do I get to Reading Festival?
faqs.answer: By car - Please follow the AA signage and directions on your car pass and not your Sat Nav. The car parks are located on grass fields, some with metal trackway approach roads and some internal roads are on land that may not be suitable for certain car suspensions. By train -Reading train station is a 15-20 minute walk from the festival site. There are many routes from throughout the country to the station, including from London Paddington. The last trains leaving Reading train station are often incredibly busy and do not run late on Friday and Saturday night. Please leave extra time if you're planning on using these services. To check train times and service providers, please visit the National Rail website. By coach - Reading Festival's exclusive coach travel partner Big Green Coach is the largest music festival coach provider in the UK and transport tens of thousands of people all over the country - so they really are the true experts! They will again be providing fantastic services from all over the UK direct to the Reading festival site. Use the Big Green Coach deposit scheme to secure your coach seat for just £10.

faqs.question: How much are Reading Festival tickets?
faqs.answer: Reading Festival 2023 weekend tickets start at £259.20

faqs.question: Does Reading have onsite camping?
faqs.answer: Yes, Reading Festival has on-site camping and you will be assigned your camping area when purchasing your tickets.

faqs.question: Where is Reading Festival?
faqs.answer: Reading Festival takes place at Richfield Avenue Festival site, Reading RG1 8EQ.

faqs.question: What happens If I bought a ticket and cannot attend?
faqs.answer: Unfortunately we can’t issue you with a refund if you can’t make the event due to work commitments or your mates have dropped out. In these circumstances, we advise passing on your tickets privately to avoid losing out on the money spent. Refunds can only be offered if the event is cancelled or postponed, as agreed upon purchase.

faqs.question: Does Reading Festival have any age restrictions?
faqs.answer: All ages are welcome at the festival. However, there are entry restrictions for under 16s and we do advise not bringing young children. Anyone 15 and under must be accompanied by a ticket holder over 18 years old at all times. Children under 13 years are admitted free. ID may be required upon entry to the event. Please bring ID if you look under 21 years old and remember that legally there is no automatic right to be served alcohol. Service is always at the discretion of the licensee for whatever reason they decide, and the licensee is under no obligation to explain the reason.

faqs.question: Can I bring my own food and drink into Reading Festival?
faqs.answer: The festival only allows sealed soft drinks under 500ml, as well as empty reusable plastic and metal bottles of any size into the Arena. Please refill your empty bottles at the water points inside the Arena for free. Food is admitted for personal consumption only.

faqs.question: When is Moovin 2023?
faqs.answer: Moovin Festival returns for 2023 on Friday 25th August to Sunday 27th August.

faqs.question: Does Moovin have onsite camping?
faqs.answer: Yes, Moovin has a variety of camping options available, from staying in bell tents to campervans. There is also the option of a ‘quiet(ish)’ camping area. However, if camping is not for you, there are plenty of accommodation options within the local area with good transport connections to the festival site.

faqs.question: How much are Moovin tickets?
faqs.answer: Weekend tickets start from £100 + booking fee with camping available to be added on for an additional £25 +booking fee.

faqs.question: How do I get to Moovin?
faqs.answer:
By Car - The site is only 15 minutes from Stockport and 30 minutes from Manchester City Centre. Once you have arrived there are three carparks available.By Bus - Stockport Train Station has buses which leave every 15 minutes to the village.By Rail - The nearest stations to the festival site are Marple, Romiley and Stockport.

By Car

If you are coming by car use SK6 5HZ, this will take you to the Post office in Compstall and the site is signposted from there. There are three available carparks.  The best one for campers is 5 minutes from the entrance of Etherow Country Park, it costs £10 for the weekend and the Sat Nav postcode is SK6 7HX.For day ticket holders there is a carpark at the entrance of Etherow Country Park, Sat Nav SK6 5HZ.  If you did end up leaving your car there you will need to renew your ticket at 9am though….!The Farm is an eco farm and only limited vehicles are allowed onsite, however shuttle buses to the site are available from both of these car parks for a small fee, or if you are feeling  fit, the 15 minute walk to the site is beautiful.There is also a free car park facing Marple Train Station further up the Road, Sat Nav SK6 7DA. The shutttle bus will not be running from here, however you can walk, get bus 383 or 384 or call 0161 427 0777 VIP Taxis to take you to the entrance of the park, where you can then get the shuttle bus or walk to the site itself.

Public Transport

If you are coming by Public Transport the nearest train stations are Marple, Romiley and Stockport train station is also nearby with buses every 15 minutes. You can get public buses 383 and 384 to Compstall from any of these stations and then either take the shuttle bus to the site for a small fee or make the beautiful 15 minute walk which will be signposted.SHUTTLE BUS TIMES ARE YET TO BE CONFIRMED.GETTING HOME – A Taxi rank is located a short walk across the road from the main entrance. The number to call is 01614270777 (VIP TAXIES). ------------------------------Coach Tickets with Tuned In Travel:As the official transport providers of Moovin festival, Tuned in Travel have an array of transport options available to choose from. Book a seat on a coach and meet like minded festival goers or get the fun started early in a private hire vehicle!Return coaches available from Chorlton, Didsbury, Manchester and Stockport on all days of Moovin Festival.For one way tickets please see our friends at Tuned in Travel  https://www.tunedintravel.com/events/moovin-festival-2022 and any queries please contact them at customerservices@tunedintravel.com   Click here for info: https://www.tunedintravel.com/events/moovin-festival

faqs.question: Is there disabled access at Moovin Festival?
faqs.answer: Please email info@moovinfestival.com with your access or additional needs before purchasing tickets and Moovin Festival will do its utmost to accommodate you.

faqs.question: Where is Moovin Festival?
faqs.answer: Moovin Festival is situated in the village of Compstall at Whitebottom Farm which is just outside of Stockport and Manchester City Centre.  The postcode is SK6 5H

faqs.question: What happens If I bought a ticket and cannot attend?
faqs.answer: Unfortunately, we can’t issue you with a refund if you can’t make the event due to work commitments or your mates have dropped out. In these circumstances, we advise passing on your tickets privately to avoid losing out on the money spent. Refunds can only be offered if the event is cancelled or postponed, as agreed upon purchase.

faqs.question: Does Moovin have any age restrictions?
faqs.answer: Yes, you must be 18 or over to attend Moovin Festival. It’s always best to carry your ID with you as a Challenge 25 Policy will be in place.

faqs.question: How can I access my tickets?
faqs.answer: You can access your RapidScan tickets at any time by heading to www.skiddle.com/orders or the 'my tickets' section of the Skiddle app.

faqs.question: Can I bring my own food and drink into Moovin?
faqs.answer: You may bring soft drinks with you onto site but no glass bottles will be permitted. Only alcohol purchased on site can be consumed on site, drinks packages will be available to order for those camping. There is also a wide selection of food caterers at Moovin, providing free range and ethically sourced food on site.

faqs.question: Can I leave a re-enter?
faqs.answer: Yes, please ensure you wear your wristbands and stick to the entry times.

faqs.question: Can I take my dog?
faqs.answer: Unfortunately, not. Only guide dogs will be allowed on site.

faqs.question: What are the set times?
faqs.answer: The set times will be released much closer to the festival.

faqs.question: When is Maui Waui Festival 2023?
faqs.answer: Maui Waui Festival takes place Friday 25th August - Sunday 27th August 2023.

faqs.question: Is there camping available at Maui Waui Festival?
faqs.answer: Yes, there is on-site camping at Maui Waui Festival. Camping tickets will need to be purchased alongside your festival tickets - see https://www.mauiwauievents.co.uk/ for more details.

faqs.question: Where is Maui Waui Festival?
faqs.answer: Maui Waui Festival is located at Hill Farm, Gressenhall, Dereham, Norfolk NR19 2NR.

faqs.question: What camping options are there at Maui Waui Festival?
faqs.answer:
• Red Camp - sociable camping for those who want to stay up late
  • Blue Camp - low noise camping - keep it quiet after 1am
  • Green Camp - family camping
  • Yellow Camp - accessible camping
  • Quiet Camping (pre-ticketed only)
  • Campervan / Caravan

faqs.question: Can I park next to my tent?
faqs.answer: No but the car park is very close by.

faqs.question: Can I set up a tent in the campervan field?
faqs.answer: Yes, a single tent per campervan.

faqs.question: Are there hot showers?
faqs.answer: Yes there are hot showers.

faqs.question: When is Victorious Festival?
faqs.answer: Victorious Festival takes place Friday 25th August - Sunday 27th August 2023.

faqs.question: How do I get to Victorious Festival?
faqs.answer: Victorious Festival is held on The Common and Castle Field in the beautiful seaside location of Southsea, Portsmouth. There is good public transport available in the city and Southsea is mostly flat so ideal for walking/cycling.

faqs.question: When will I receive my E-tickets?
faqs.answer: E-tickets will be released approximately 2 weeks before the event.

faqs.question: Accessibility information
faqs.answer: The location of Southsea Seafront is mostly flat with grass terrain and concrete paths running through the site. Full accessibility information can be found at https://www.victoriousfestival.co.uk/info/access/

faqs.question: Does Victorious Festival have onsite camping?
faqs.answer: No but Victorious Festival does have an off-site camping area at Farlington Fields, P061UW. The campsite is a short, free bus ride away from the festival. Please see https://www.victoriousfestival.co.uk/farlington-fields-offsite-camping/ for further information.

faqs.question: Where is Victorious Festival?
faqs.answer: Victorious Festival is held on The Common and Castle Field in the beautiful seaside location of Southsea, Portsmouth.

faqs.question: Can I add camping to my order?
faqs.answer: Camping is only available to those attending all 3 days of the festival. If you have a festival ticket you can upgrade to camping by contacting the ticket provider.

faqs.question: What are the opening times for Victorious Festival?
faqs.answer: The opening times for Victorious Festival are between 10am and 11pm each day. No entry or re-entry after 8pm. If you do leave and re-enter, you will have to queue and be searched again.

faqs.question: Does Victorious Festival have any age restrictions?
faqs.answer: No, Victorious Festival is a family-friendly event. Anyone aged 15 or under must be accompanied by an adult over the age of 18 - in this case the 18+ ticket holder may be asked for valid photo ID if they look under 25. All bars will be operating Challenge 25 so again you will need valid photo ID if you look younger than 25.

faqs.question: Can I bring food & drink into the Victorious Festival?
faqs.answer: You are not allowed to bring your own food and drink into Victorious Festival, with the exception of baby food and either an empty water vessel or a factory-sealed water bottle (NOT glass). Free tap water will be available at all bars and at drinking water points across the site. There will be a wide variety of food and drink stalls inside the festival.

faqs.question: Can I bring a bag to Victorious Festival?
faqs.answer: Yes. There are no restrictions on bag sizes at Victorious Festival but all bags will be searched and larger bags will take longer so please be mindful of this.

faqs.question: Is Victorious Festival family-friendly?
faqs.answer: Victorious Festival is proud to be family-friendly and includes a massive free kids area and a baby change area. Prams/buggies are welcome as are pull-along carts.

faqs.question: Can I bring my pet to Victorious Festival?
faqs.answer: No, only assistance dogs will be permitted into Victorious Festival. Please leave your pets safe at home.

faqs.question: Can I bring a chair to Victorious Festival?
faqs.answer: No, chairs and inflatables will not be permitted at Victorious Festival. There will be seating areas on site.

faqs.question: Are vapes allowed at Victorious Festival?
faqs.answer: Yes, Victorious Festival allows vapes and refills. Refills must be in their original packaging. Please be mindful of those around you.

faqs.question: When is Leeds Festival 2023?
faqs.answer: Leeds Festival returns to Bramham Park on Friday 25th - Sunday 27th August 2023.

faqs.question: How do I get to Leeds Festival?
faqs.answer: By car - If you are driving to Leeds Festival, please drive carefully. Remember that traffic will be heavy along the festival routes - so please drive safely and carefully. All routes to the festival are from the A1 or M1. Travel to the A1 or M1 whether from the north, south, east or west and follow the festival signs.FROM A1 COMING FROM THE SOUTHThe route to Leeds Festival will be signposted from Junction 35 northboundFROM M1 COMING FROM THE SOUTHThe route to the festival will be signposted from Junction 32 northboundFROM M62 COMING FROM THE EASTThe route to the festival will be signed from junction 33 westboundFROM M62 COMING FROM THE WESTThe route to the festival will be signed from junction 29 eastboundFROM A1/ A1(M) COMING FROM THE NORTHThe route to the festival will be signed from junction 46 southbound.If you must bring your car, please consider the following in the interests of the environment and also to reduce congestion:: Transport as many people as possible with you: Travel at off peak times (the peak time for arriving onsite is 08.00 to 14.00 on the Thursday): Consider car sharing By train - Book your train tickets in advance with First TransPennine Express and you could save over 50% at tpexpress.co.uk.There will be frequent shuttle buses running from Leeds City Railway Station and Leeds Coach Station to Bramham Park.To check train times and service providers, please visit the National Rail website. By coach - Leeds Festival's exclusive coach travel partner Big Green Coach is the largest music festival coach provider in the UK and transport tens of thousands of people all over the country - so they really are the true experts! They will again be providing fantastic services from all over the UK direct to the Leeds festival site. Use the Big Green Coach deposit scheme to secure your coach seat for just £10.

faqs.question: How much are Leeds Festival tickets?
faqs.answer: Leeds Festival 2023 weekend tickets start at £259.20.

faqs.question: Is there disability access and PA Tickets?
faqs.answer: How To Apply for the Disabled Access SchemeTo apply for the Leeds Festival access scheme first purchase a standard ticket. Once you have purchased your ticket you will be asked to complete and submit an access requirements application form which consists of a number of questions regarding your requirements at the event. Along with this, you must provide supporting documentation for validation of your request.Leeds Festival Access Scheme allows you to apply for the following facilities:Wheelchair Accessible Viewing PlatformAccessible car parking & Drop off passPA (Personal Assistant) ticket – (at no extra charge)Accessible toilet facilitiesAccessible CampingAccessible Terms & ConditionsIt is mandatory to provide one of the following forms of supporting documentation in your application as evidence of your requirements and to grant a PA ticket. Please include one of the following with your completed form:PIP (Personal independence payment)DLA – care and/or mobilityLetter from a medical professionalD/deaf or blind registrationThe Access Card or equivalent with a +1 icon for PA ticketsBlue Badge – permitted for parking only requestsPlease note any submitted documents are securely destroyed.If you do not have the above evidence but feel you need assistance to access the festival, please get in contact via the number below. Anyone turning up on the day without making prior arrangements may not be able to access the above facilities. However, Leeds Festival will always try to accommodate any late requests.Personal Assistant Ticket SchemeIf a customer is unable to attend the festival without the support from a PA, then we will provide an additional PA ticket at no extra cost.This ticket can only be approved by the Access TeamPlease do not buy a ticket for your PA as this will not be refunded if they are approved.The PA ticket is provided on the expectation that your PA is willing and able to assist you throughout your visit, and would be available and able to help you in the event of an evacuation.Full Disabled Access Information can be found here - https://www.leedsfestival.com/information-category/accessContactIf you require further assistance or information that cannot be found online, please contact a member of the Leeds Festival access team.Post: Access Team, Festival Republic, 30 St John Street, London, EC1M 4AY Email: access@leedsfestival.co.uk the team at Leeds Festival aim to respond within 72 hours

faqs.question: Where is Leeds Festival?
faqs.answer: Leeds Festival takes place at Bramham Park, Bramham, Wetherby, LS23 6LU

faqs.question: What happens If I bought a ticket and cannot attend?
faqs.answer: Unfortunately, we can’t issue you with a refund if you can’t make the event due to work commitments or your mates have dropped out. In these circumstances, we advise passing on your tickets privately to avoid losing out on the money spent.Refunds can only be offered if the event is cancelled or postponed, as agreed upon purchase.

faqs.question: Does Leeds have onsite camping?
faqs.answer: Yes, Leeds Festival has on-site camping and you will be assigned your camping area when purchasing your tickets.

faqs.question: Does Leeds Festival have any age restrictions?
faqs.answer: All ages are welcome at the festival. However, there are entry restrictions for under 16s and we do advise not bringing young children. Anyone 15 and under must be accompanied by a ticket holder over 18 years old at all times. Children under 13 years are admitted free. ID may be required upon entry to the event.Please bring ID if you look under 21 years old and remember that legally there is no automatic right to be served alcohol. Service is always at the discretion of the licensee for whatever reason they decide, and the licensee is under no obligation to explain the reason.

faqs.question: Can I bring my own food and drink into Leeds Festival?
faqs.answer: The festival only allows sealed soft drinks under 500ml, as well as empty reusable plastic and metal bottles of any size into the Arena. Please refill your empty bottles at the water points inside the Arena for free. Food is admitted for personal consumption only.

faqs.answer: South East Dance Festival takes place on Saturday 26th August 2023.

faqs.question: How do I get to South East Dance Festival?
faqs.answer: Arriving by Train:Travelling to South East Dance Festival is extremely easy by train. The two local stations Southend Victoria or Southend Central are easily accessible from Central London. Whether you are travelling from outside or inside the London area, you will be able to find a train connection that will get you to the festival. For train travel to Southend Victoria or Central visit National Rail for up to the minute timetable and pricing information.Arriving by Bus:Whether you live in Southend, London or outside areas, once you arrive in the local area you may decide to commute to the festival via local buses. Getting a bus is straightforward as all you have to do is find the nearest stop for the 24 or 27 bus which will take you directly to Cokefield Avenue round the corner from the South East Dance Festival site in Garon Park. You can check out a local journey planner for bus travel.Arriving by Car:The address is :Garon Park, Eastern Avenue, Southend on Sea, Essex, SS2 4FA.Finding the festival by car - Garon Park is near to the following motorway junctions and A roads: A1159, A13, A127, A130, Junctions 28 & 29 of the M25.  You can check the website for more details.

faqs.question: What happens if I bought a ticket and cannot attend?
faqs.answer: Unfortunately we can’t issue you with a refund if you can’t make the event due to work commitments or your mates have dropped out. In these circumstances, we advise passing on your tickets privately to avoid losing out on the money spent. Refunds can only be offered if the event is cancelled or postponed, as agreed upon purchase.

faqs.question: Where is South East Dance Festival?
faqs.answer: South East Dance Festival is held at Garon Park, Southend on Sea.

faqs.question: Can I bring my own food and drink into South East Dance Festival?
faqs.answer: Licensing laws do not permit you to bring your own food and drink on site unless you have specific dietary requirements supported by a doctor’s note. There will be quality food available at the event from different food sellers and plenty of bars.

faqs.question: What medical assistance is available?
faqs.answer: There is a medical first aid centre with qualified staff. Please identify the location on arrival.There are lots of Marshall’s and Security on site who can be alerted to get medical help. If you see anyone unwell please take them to the first aid area. If they are not able to be moved please contact a marshall or member of security as quickly as possible who will call for the necessary help. If you need to take medication regularly remember to bring it and let your friends know of any illness or allergies you may have.

faqs.question: What are the search and security policies?
faqs.answer:
You could be searched at the entrance for illegal items. If found they will be confiscated. Persons suspected of illegal activity will be searched and may be removed from the site.Do not attempt to bring in illegal substances as you risk a strong chance of being caught.The following items cannot be brought in to the ‘Soul Crusade’ site:No! No offensive weaponsNo! No fireworks, flares, laser pens or laser equipment.No! No animals except guide dogs. Please respect others. Anti-social behaviour could lead to being removed from the site. 

Valuables

 Keep your valuables safe. Carry money, credit cards, mobile phones, cameras, and anything else of value with you at all times. Don’t leave valuables where people can pick them up.

faqs.question: What facilities are available?
faqs.answer:
Toilets

There are plenty of toilets on site. Please keep toilets clean. Always wash your hands after using the toilets.

Rubbish and Waste

There are plenty of bins on site. Please use bins and not the floor.

faqs.question: What items are restricted from Crooked House In The Park?
faqs.answer:

  • Glass
  • Illegal Substances
  • Chairs & Gazebos
  • Animals
  • Legal Highs
  • Laser equipment / pens
  • Fireworks, flares

  • Any form of aerosols
  • Unauthorised items for trading
  • Food & Alcohol (Food & Drink available on site)
  • New Psychoactive Substances (NPS)

faqs.question: When is FeastyFest 2023?
faqs.answer: FeastyFest takes place on Sunday 10th of September 2023.

faqs.question: How do I get to FeastyFest?
faqs.answer: TrainSutton and Cheam stations are within easy walking distance of the festival site. There are also numerous local stations with easy access to the site via bus routes. DrivingPlease use postcode SM3 8BP, when navigating to the festival using a sat nav. As you approach the site you will see yellow event signs on your route, we ask you follow these as you approach your final destination.  Parking AvailabilityFeasty fest runs a car park with parking for over 1000 cars via Netley Close off Nordan Road, there is plenty of space here for people’s cars when coming to the festival. DO NOT under any circumstances park on residential roads or in small closes where nearby residents live, this will disrupt the day to day life of local residents and we want all to enjoy the FeastyFest. Bus Stop & Nearby RouteThe Tilehurst road bus stop is right next to the festival site, it is accessible on the following routes: 151, 213, 613, 627.

faqs.question: Is FeastyFest Accessible?
faqs.answer: We are proud to provide an accessible site for all and will help to accommodate any Feasters’ additional needs to ensure that everyone can enjoy the festival and all it has to offer.We are working to make FeastyFest as accessible as possible. However, FeastyFest is an outdoor event in a park that could pose problems for mobility (particularly in wet weather).Free tickets will be provided for carers and personal assistants for standard adult ticket holders with physical and mental difficulties. For those with child and teen tickets, a free carer or personal assistant ticket shall also be provided free of charge, but the child or teen must be accompanied by a paying adult ticket holder (such adult ticket holder may be the carer or personal assistant).

faqs.question: How much are FeastyFest tickets?

faqs.question: Will I need cash at FeastyFest?
faqs.answer: There are no cashpoints on site and all stands are predominantly card only with vendors providing a card payment option also, therefore FeastyFest do not recommend bringing large amounts of cash on site.

faqs.question: Is disabled parking available?
faqs.answer: Free disabled parking is Via Parkside Road of the Broadway in Cheam Village. Clear signage will direct blue badge holders to the disabled parking area. You must be in possession of a valid blue badge to gain access.

faqs.question: What are the disabled features?

faqs.question: How do I get to Equinox Festival?
faqs.answer: By Taxi - There are several local taxi firms to choose from. It is recommended that you use the taxi firms to travel from the train station and bus stops to avoid walking on the roads if you are carrying a lot of camping equipment. By Car - If travelling by car please use the postcode until you reach the festival road signs then follow them for the remainder of your journey. If travelling from the North you will be joining the M180 towards Scunthorpe/ Grimsby and if travelling from the South you will travel towards Lincoln following the A158 / Wragby Road E to A157. By Bus - The Interconnect 51 bus is running regular routes across the weekend. By Rail - The closest rail station is Grimsby Town.

faqs.question: Accessibility information
faqs.answer: General Site Info: Chalk Farm is a greenfield site- mainly flat but there are sloping areas and it can become muddy, meaning that sometimes access across the site is not that easy. Please bear this in mind.Arena Facilities: There are accessible toilets located in the arena.General Campsite Facilities: The camping area is flat and the arena is easily accessible from most of the camping area. Tent camping is included in weekend ticket price, tickets are also available for campervans, live-ins and caravans.Accessible Campsite: Please apply on our website equinoxfestival.org.uk Accessible toilets are provided, along with a secure fridge for any medication that may need to be kept cold. Charging facilities for electric wheelchairs or scooters and medical devices.

faqs.question: What day does the campsite open on at Equinox festival? What time?
faqs.answer:
The campsite will be open 10.00am Friday. There is strictly no admittance before this time. There is no holding area for you to park up in until we open, anyone blocking roads or illegally parking will be reported to the authorities.
