faqs.question: When is One Out Festival 2023?
faqs.answer: One Out Festival takes place on Saturday 16th September 2023.

faqs.question: Ticket Information & Entry
faqs.answer:
ID & Scanning: 

All tickets will be checked and scanned on entry, please bring a valid form of photo ID. Accepted forms of ID are passports, driving licenses or proof of age cards bearing the ‘PASS’ logo. 

Do I need to print my ticket?

It will speed up entry but it is not compulsory. Having it on your phone is OK too. Do not worry if the name on your ticket does not match the person using it on the day.

Admission policy:

There is a strict ZERO tolerance drugs policy (including Nitrous Oxide), full searches will be carried out before entry is granted, no refunds can be issued and we reserve the right to refuse admission.

 

Searching is a condition of entry: 

We reserve the right to confiscate any item which may not be suitable for the event as well as a danger to others or the venue. Anyone found in possession of illegal substances or contraband goods will be refused admission, ejected from the venue and may also be liable for prosecution. One Out Festival reserves the right to refuse admission to the ticket holder if they display inappropriate or aggressive behaviour, or are intoxicated or under the influence of drugs.

You must not:

take alcohol into the venue

bring glass inside the festival site

bring any corrosive substances 

bring your own food or drinks into the festival

faqs.question: Carer Tickets?
faqs.answer: For carer tickets, please email info@oneout.co.uk and show a valid PIP document to claim a ticket.

faqs.answer: No, there aren't any payment plans available for this event.

faqs.question: Food & Drink at One Out Festival
faqs.answer: FoodThere will be a selection of high quality food available at One Out. These units will be located in the centre of the festival. BarsBars can be located next to the main stage & inside the big top stage. Inside the VIP area there will be an exclusive bar for VIP members only. WaterDrinking water can be found at all main bars and is free.

faqs.question: Toilets at One Out Festival
faqs.answer: The venue has multiple toilets around the venue including a large permanent toilet block for those who don't like portaloos. These can we easily found by signage around the venue.

faqs.question: One Out Festival admission policy
faqs.answer:
• There is a strict ZERO tolerance drugs policy (including Nitrous Oxide). Full searches will be carried out before entry is granted and One Out reserve the right to refuse admission. No refunds will be issued if admission is refused.
  • Searching is a condition of entry. One Out reserve the right to confiscate any item which may not be suitable for the event as well as a danger to others or the venue. 
  • Anyone found in possession of illegal substances or contraband goods will be refused admission, ejected from the venue and may also be liable for prosecution. No refunds will be issued.
  • One Out Festival reserves the right to refuse admission to the ticket holder if they display inappropriate or aggressive behaviour, or are intoxicated or under the influence of drugs.
  • You must bring the following into the festival:  alcohol, corrosive substances, food or drink. Tap water is available free of charge in the festival.
  • One Out do not permit re-entry to the event. Once you leave the event, you cannot re-enter.

faqs.question: Travel information
faqs.answer: Maidstone is the county town of Kent, England and is 32 miles south east of London. The river Medway runs through the centre of the town, linking it with Rochester and the Thames estuary.  Historically the river was a source of and route of much of the towns trade, as the centre of agriculture for the county of Kent, known as the Garden of England. By RoadFrom Dover, Ashford International Station and the Channel Tunnel via the M20 motorway.  Maidstone is accessed from junctions 5, 6, 7 and 8. From London and the rest of the UK via the M25 and M26/M20 motorways. By CoachTicket prices for a coach from London to Maidstone usually start from £3.00 but in times of high demand you are likely to pay a bit more.  National Express runs from London Victoria Park Plaza.  Under normal conditions the coach would take 1h and 35 minutes.From Eltham: by bus from national express the journey is an 1h and cost from £5 to £8 Alternatively you can take a train from Eltham to Maidstone via Dartford and Strood in around 1h and 46minutes. By RailMaidstone town is easily accessible through it two major railway stations - Maidstone East station for services from London and Ashford. - Maidstone West for services from Gatwick and Strood.From London Victoria to Maidstone East the direct journey takes 1h and 2minutes. From Ashford International Station the direct journey on the fastest route takes 21minutes, slowest journey 33 minutes and the average time is 27 minutes. The average journey time between Gatwick Airport and Maidstone West is 2 hours 23 minutes. The fastest journey time is 1 hour 33 minutes. On an average weekday, there are 76 trains per day travelling from Gatwick Airport to Maidstone West. The journey time may be longer on weekends and holidays. Gatwick Airport is not a direct route but go from Gatwick Airport to Tonbridge, change at Tonbridge to get to Maidstone West.From Strood to Maidstone the fastest route takes 15 minutes, slowest route takes 26 minutes and the average journey takes 22 minutes. Strood connects with the High Speed Rail service into London. Trainline is Europe’s leading train and coach app. which brings together all rail, coach and other travel services into one simple experience so people can get the best prices and smart, real-time travel info on the go. By BusMaidstone is served by three bus companies, East Farleigh coaches, New Venture and Arriva Bus Company.  Arriva being the major bus company.  Major bus timetables can be viewed on line at www.arrivabus.co.uk or printed timetables can be collected from Maidstone Museum and Tourist Information, The Mall Shopping Centre and The Maidstone Link council offices.  Arriva bus services run from Monday to Sunday, restricted service on Sundays and Bank Holidays.  Maidstone Bus station can be found underneath The Mall Shopping Centre, King Street, Maidstone. Here are a few really useful bus routes to help you get aroundMaidstone Hospital via Tonbridge Road to Maidstone bus service 3.Royal Tunbridge Wells to Maidstone via Matfield bus service 6 or five Oak Green bus service 6a, Paddock Wood & East Peckham.Tunbridge Wells Hospital to Maidstone Hospital via Barming & Wateringbury bus service 6X.Royal Tunbridge Wells to Maidstone via Tunbridge and Mereworth bus service 7.Maidstone Hospital to Maidstone via Fant and Beverley Road bus service 8.Downswood, Shepway to Maidstone bus service 4.Vinters Park, Bearsted Green to Maidstone bus service 9.Bearsted Green, The Landway to Maidstone bus service 11.Penenden Heath, Boxley Road to Maidstone bus service 79.Sandhurst, Hawkhurst, Cranbrook, Staplehurst to Maidstone bus service 5.Tenterden, Biddenden, Headcorn to Maidstone bus service 12.Grafty Green, Kingswood to Maidstone bus service 59.Parkwood to Maidstone bus service 82.Senacre Wood to Maidstone bus service 85.Coxheath to Maidstone bus service 89.Snodland, Larkfield to Maidstone bus service 71.Leybourne Park, Larkfield to Maidstone bus service 71A.Kingshill, West Malling, Larkfield to Maidstone bus service 72.Sittingbourne to Maidstone bus service 333 & 334.Kings Hill, West Malling Station to Maidstone bus service X1 & X2.Gillingham, Chatham to Maidstone bus service 101. Maidstone is also served by a park and ride service Mondays to Saturdays running every 20 minutes. Willington Street to Maidstone bus service 501London Road to Maidstone bus service 503

faqs.question: Travel information
faqs.answer: Magna is located on: Magna Way, Rotherham, S60 1FD. Pedestrian access is available from Sheffield Road, S60 1DX.If you are travelling using a sat nav then the postcode S60 1FD will bring you on to Magna Way, after which Magna is the big, black building straight ahead.From the M1 take junction 33 if you are travelling from the south, and junction 34 if you are travelling from the north. Magna is about 1 mile from Meadowhall Shopping Centre and there is free parking for up to 400 cars and 40 coaches. By CoachIf you are travelling by National Express coaches, alight at Sheffield Interchange and take the X1 bus route, as detailed below.The nearest Supertram stops are at Carbrook and Meadowhall. You can then take a short walk to the X1 bus stops, and this bus service stops right outside Magna. By TrainThe most convenient train stations to use are Rotherham Central, Sheffield and Meadowhall.From either of these stations you are advised to take the no.X1 bus service direct to Magna. From Sheffield station walk to the Interchange (about 4 mins) to catch the bus. From Rotherham Central, turn right out of the station into the bus station and take the X1 bus (stop B4).  By BusThe new X1 Steel Link service drops visitors right outside Magna, up to every 10 mins.   Travelling from Sheffield City Centre, you can catch the X1 Steel Link from bus stops on Eyre Street (ES3), Castle Street (CG22) and Arundel Gate (CS3).  From areas around Sheffield, travel on your local bus to the city centre and then jump on the X1 Steel Link at your most convenient stop.  The X1 Steel Link travels from Maltby through Rotherham, picking up at the Interchange stand B4, and on to Magna.   Taking only 5 mins, travelling to Magna couldn’t be easier from Meadowhall Interchange stand C3 on the X1 Steel Link.
